campaign.story:
I love to draw. The drawings I like best make me laugh. During the pandemic, I created two new jigsaw puzzles, Rogues Gallery and Lackluster Circus. If you get them now, you’ll be ready for your next quarantine, house arrest, or hibernation.
Oodles of unpleasant characters covering some unpleasant wallpaper.
Rogues Gallery is a collection of framed portraits...peculiar characters covering a swath of curious wallpaper.
Logically, the world's worst circus must be somewhere. Could this be it?
Lackluster Circus is a gaudy collection of traditional circus acts that have refined their performances to a modest level of mediocrity. And there are enough clowns to make any sane person queasy.
What sponsors get. Your reward can be one puzzle or both. Each is a 1,000-piece puzzle that will measure 19.75" x 27.5" (50 cm x 70 cm) when you put it together. The puzzle pieces come in a reusable poly bag in a sturdy, two-piece box with a half-size cheat sheet to help you if you get stuck.
********
Why a jigsaw puzzle? Puzzles are great because you can do them alone or with others. You get to set the pace. You can do the whole puzzle in one marathon session or drag the effort out over weeks. Solving a puzzle sharpens your cognitive skills and helps you learn to focus on details. Snapping a puzzle piece into position feels good and probably releases a flood of endorphins. How nice. And jigsaw puzzles don’t require any batteries, instruction manuals, or wifi.
Great puzzles have something to look at on nearly every piece. Never any boring blank areas.
What makes a puzzle great? I believe the best jigsaw puzzles have three vital qualities. First, lots of color. Next, oodles of details. No boring expanses of sky or snow. Last, a good puzzle is puzzling—a little mysterious and full of false clues, duplicates, and distractions.
I designed both of these puzzles to give you abundant colors, beguiling details, and mild mystery.
How difficult are these puzzles? Challenging, but not so exasperating that you will have to be institutionalized. Not as difficult as last year’s Ocean Commotion puzzle.
The challenging Ocean Commotion puzzle (detail) is still available for the fearless.
You’ll receive an overview of the whole image on the box base and the half-size cheat sheet, so you and a friend can both refer to the complete image while working on the puzzle. If you believe the puzzle is too easy, try solving it without referring to the cheat sheet. If it is still too easy, do it blindfolded.
Where are these puzzles going to be made? These puzzles will be made at Sarah's XZY puzzle workshop in China. (We know that sounds like a ridiculous, made-up name, but it’s real.) Printed and bonded to specially made, heavy puzzle board to prevent delaminating and reduce paper dust. Housed in a sturdy clear poly bag and nestled in a robust two-piece box.
Puzzles make good gifts...easy to wrap.
“Don’s puzzles are always loaded with interesting and unexpected ”
“These puzzles will make great gifts for folks with a high tolerance for nonsense.”
“The world would be a better place if more people stayed home and worked on puzzles.”
*******
When can I expect these rewards? Assuming nothing calamitous happens, you should be enjoying these puzzles by September 2021. Probably sooner. 
********
Shipping. The cost of shipping is automatically added to your pledge based on if you live in the U.S. or Canada.
Just the local neighborhood. We are limiting rewards to residents of the U.S. and Canada only. Later, once we ship all rewards, some extras of these jigsaw puzzles will be available at our online store. So, anyone excluded from the Kickstarter project will be able to get Rogues Gallery and Lackluster Circus puzzles there.
Who are these creatures? Do any remind you of anyone in your circle of family or friends?
Customs. Sometimes, but not always, shipments to Canada get hit with customs duties. I have no way of predicting if they’ll apply to your shipment. Customs inspections are very arbitrary and willy-nilly. Most packages sail through without any duty, but some are selected seemingly by chance and the recipient gets hit with a duty fee. So if you can’t tolerate the risk that your shipment might get selected for extra costs, you should probably not support this project. Or arrange to have your reward shipped to a friend in the U.S. who can bring your jigsaw puzzles during their next trip.
Tracking number. You will receive a tracking number when we ship, so track your package daily to make sure it doesn’t get hung up in the system and returned to us. Don’t just assume it will show up at your door. Shipments have a way of getting stalled, and monitoring the status of the tracking number allows you to intervene promptly.
Where are you? When the rewards are ready to ship, we’ll send out a Kickstarter address survey. If you don’t respond to that survey within 6 months, we’ll assume you no longer want your reward. I don’t have the space to hold your reward in perpetuity or until the cows come home.
Fulfillment is provided by our capable and multi-talented partners at Fulfillrite. Our Fulfillrite friends are fast and they do things right the first time.
Plenty of diverting details to entertain you.
What’s going on? Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds but not so often that you think I’m a pest.
Questions? Send me your questions and I’ll add them and the answers to the FAQ section at the bottom of this page.
Leftovers from my previous Kickstarter projects, including previous jigsaw puzzles, are available while supplies last at www.calamityware.com. A good place to find some unusual gifts.
Sign up for our newsletter here so you’ll never miss a thing at Calamityware.
Don Moyer, Pittsburgh, April 25, 2021
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This project is using established production methods—printing, dies, robots folding boxes, etc. We don’t need to quarry any unobtanium or invent anti-gravity devices. The design of these puzzles and boxes is complete and I’ve already tested a prototype, so we are good to go. The most likely threat is some unanticipated obstacle in the production schedule that will slow us down. 

I'll try to make everything go fast so you have your puzzles before the next great quarantine.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Good start! Thanks for your amazing support. 
Jump start. I've given the puzzle workshop permission to start production, even though the Kickstarter project hasn't ended. That head start will give us extra time to deal with whatever fiascoes are ahead. There are bound to be fiascoes ahead.
A reminder. Kickstarter rewards for this project are only shipping to the U.S. and Canada. If you live somewhere else, you should probably cancel your pledge. Later, after the Kickstarter rewards have shipped, you’ll be able to order puzzles at www.calamityware.com. And there you'll have more shipping options than we can offer inside Kickstarter. To ensure you don't miss the opportunity,

campaign.story:
It’s rude to constantly express your impatience, frustration, and anger. So, let the Peeved Paisleys do it for you.
The design of this bandana features oodles of paisleys who are clearly peeved, aggravated, and irked. 
A seemingly serene symmetrical design contains plenty of peeveded paisleys.
Like my previous BADbandanas, I’m going to reproduce this drawing as a 21-inch square bandana. With white paisleys on a dignified gray background, these bandanas will be 100 percent cotton printed right here in the good-old USA using duplex printing like the quality bandanas I grew up with. (Dyed—not that obnoxious silkscreening we all hate.)
What do you get? Each bandana contains a couple dozen annoyed paisleys combined in a serenely symmetrical composition that is an homage to the classic bandanas of the past.
Package of three. (Makes a great gift.)
Packed in sets of three so you’ll have spares for gift giving. Bandanas make convenient masks to discourage inconvenient viruses and they have many uses in fashion, personal hygiene, and pet decoration. No one is going to want just one. So I’m offering reward levels of BADbandanas in packs of three.

Don says, “I love traditional bandanas but they need more pizzazz. I doubt you have any bandanas in your drawer quite like this—peeved paisleys!” 
BADbandanas make superb gifts. Even if you aren’t a big fan of bandanas, you may want to get a bunch to share. Great gifts for friends, family, neighbors who are angry, annoyed, or vexed.
Do you need a reminder of how you can use your BADbandanas?
Don and dog model BADbandana uses. (Don’s the one wearing glasses.)

What the critics are saying...
 “A perfect expression of my current mood. This design is ideal for these troubled times.” 
“One can never have too many clean bandanas.”
 “Excellent gift for friends—especially those who are miffed...and who isn’t?” 
 “Is that pizza sauce on your chin? No problem. Mop it up with your BADbandana.”
 “A perfect blend of silly and practical. An enhancement to any wardrobe.” 

SCHEDULE
Lightning fast. If there are no calamities, you should have your BADbandanas by April, 2021. Perhaps sooner. Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds.
SHIPPING
Just the local neighborhood. Because shipping is extra slow and troublesome these days, we are limiting rewards to residents of the U.S. and Canada only. Later, some extras of these BADbandanas will be available at our online store. So, anyone excluded from the Kickstarter project will be able to get Peeved Paisleys there.
Tracking. You will receive a tracking number when we ship, so track your package daily to make sure it doesn’t get hung up in the system and returned to us. Don’t just assume it will show up at your door. Shipments have a way of getting stalled, and monitoring the status of the tracking number allows you to intervene promptly.
Customs. Sometimes, but not always, shipments to Canada get hit with customs duties. I have no way of predicting if they’ll apply to your shipment. Customs inspections are very arbitrary and willy-nilly. Most packages sail through without any duty, but some are selected seemingly by chance and the recipient gets hit with a duty fee. So if you can’t tolerate the risk that your shipment might get selected for extra costs, you should probably not support this project. Or arrange to have your reward shipped to a friend in the U.S. who can bring your Peeved Paisleys during their next trip.
Shipping is provided by our capable and multi-talented partners at Fulfillrite. Our Fulfillrite friends are fast and they do things right the first time.
Where are you? When the rewards are ready to ship, we’ll send out a Kickstarter address survey. If you don’t respond to that survey within 6 months, we’ll assume you no longer want your reward. I don’t have the space to hold your reward in perpetuity or until the cows come home.

LOOSE ENDS
Updates and progress reports. Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds but not so often that you think I’m an obnoxious pest.
Questions? Send me your questions and I’ll add them and the answers to the FAQ section at the bottom of this page.
Thanks for your amazing support.
Leftovers from my previous Kickstarter projects are available while supplies last at www.calamityware.com. Not only is this a good place to find some unusual gifts, but it is the only place you’ll find the world’s greatest shower curtain.
Don—Pittsburgh, January 6, 2021
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The basic techniques of making bandanas are centuries old. But even this simple and mature technology can probably still go wrong in surprising ways. This is my seventh bandana project, so experience ought to be a help. I’ll do all I can to anticipate problems and vanquish threats. Whatever happens, I promise to keep you informed and to get my sponsors whimsical bandanas as soon as possible after the project closes. I feel confident you’ll be wearing BADbandana 7 by early April, 2021.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Folding the Peeved.
BADbandana production is complete and we are folding BADbandanas at a gratifying pace. Hooray. We're weeks ahead of schedule.

Whoop-de-doo! Project succeeded. Thanks.
Now what happens? Kickstarter is going to use the next two weeks to collect pledges. If they have a problem with your credit card, you can expect emails from them to sort out the difficulties. Watch your in-basket for signs of trouble.
We caught a lucky break by green lighting production early. All the bandanas are printed and hemmed. We're starting to fold and pack them today.  Everything is way ahead of schedule at this point. So, you'll probably be cavorting with peeved paisleys by the beginning of March, not the end of April as originally planned.
Good news! We’re going to start production early.

comments.content: They have arrived! Another great Kickstarter! Thanks Don and co.
Jeff
Thank you!

Why in the world I thought these were going to be tan I guess I may never know LOL. Nonetheless, they were received. A skosh thinner than I recall any bandana I have ever had being!, but it has been donkey's ears since I've bought a bandana. So,... so far they are bringing me joy. Onward,...

Got my Peeved Paisleys today. I was surprised to see how off-center they were. The bottom border was 1 1/2" wider than the top and sides. I looked back through the others (I've backed every set and several of your other wonderful projects) and don't see this on them. I still love them, in spite of my OCD!
I've been trying to make a quilt from the bad bandanas and it's been a little frustrating because some of the earlier versions were quite off center, but luckily these were right on.
Peeved Paisleys have arrived in Massachusetts!
A Peeved Paisley area rug would be a nice addition to almost any room. Just sayin'
Survey submitted! Looking forward to seeing them arrive!

I've previously picked up #3 Spirited Bones and #6 Pizza Dragons (and the world's greatest shower curtain), and now I see #5 Robot Uprising in your webstore. Clearly I need those little robots in my back pocket! Is there a way to combine shipping of that with this new lot, or is that too much hassle?
I have that "world's greatest shower curtain" and it's fantastic. The kids and I have picked out and named our favorite beasts. Looking forward to some peeved paisley!
Or Gray😜✌🏼
can’t wait for flavor Grey! Thanks Don

You may not appreciate this use, but I am a person with allergies. I got tired of going through boxes and boxes of tissues. For the last few months I have been tucking a bandana into my back pocket as my washable handkerchief (snot rag). It works great and produces less waste!
New color?
Well, if a bank won't give me a loan if I'm wearing a bandana with dragons eating pizza, then I don't want a loan from that bank!

campaign.story:
100 rare photos from the past will be restored to crisp perfection.
You can pick a print to frame, enjoy the whole collection in digital format, or cherish them in a limited edition photobook.

What is The Past in Focus about?
Did you know that there are hundreds of thousands of photographs buried in photo archives around the world? These archives contain beautiful images from the past that deserve to be displayed and appreciated. They deserve to be restored and seen in high-definition. 
Man and woman kissing across two vessels ( c1920s ) / Samuel J. Hood, photographer / Australian National Maritime Museum
Back in 2018, the first Past in Focus campaign was launched here on Kickstarter and since then over 600 rare photographs have been restored and shared with history buffs from the four corners of the world. Now, the Fourth Edition is about to be assembled and I hope you will take part in bringing this new collection to life. 

100 rarely-seen images will be digitally restored to their original splendor. Take your choice of any of the photos to own as a print - or buy the collection and enjoy them all in beautiful hi-res!
Members of the Maranui Surf Life Saving Club Cockfighting ( 1914 ) / Sydney Charles Smith, photographer
What Kind of Images Are Being Restored?
Sailing ships, mountain landscapes, Native Americans of the West, magnificent buildings of New York City, the fjords of Norway, beautiful scenery from America's national parks, aviation images, captured moments from the era of the wild west ..... anything unique, truly eye-catching, and RARE. The rarer the juicier.
Kilcredaun Lighthouse ( 1860-1914 ) / Robert French, photographer / National Library of Ireland
View of Ouray, Colorado ( 1901 ) / Library of Congress
There will be a good mixture of landscape images, portraits, and "everyday" scenes like the kind pictured above and below. The majority of the images will date from 1860-1945 because these images are in the public domain which will allow you the freedom to use these images for personal or commercial use.
A Woman in Prayer at a Church in Norway ( 1904 ) / Anders Beer Wilse, photographer / Nasjonalbiblioteket
At the conclusion of the campaign, all 100 of the restored images from "The Past in Focus - Fourth Edition" will be available for viewing online and you can then take your pick of which image you want to frame for your home. Enjoy a mystery? I can surprise you with a print!
The Flat-Iron Building in New York City ( 1903 ) / Detroit Publishing Company Collection
If you can't decide which photo you would like to own, then you can own them all - The Past in Focus Image Collection will include all 100 images fully-restored as hi-res jpegs ( 1200-5500px ) so you can make 5x7", 8x10" or 11x14" prints yourself.
The majority of these images will be unearthed from the largest and most magnificent photo collection in America - the Library of Congress - but I will peruse libraries from the far corners of the world as well... libraries such as The National Library of Norway, the Rijksmuseum, the National Maritime Archives of Australia, and The British Library.
The Temple of Jupiter in Baalbek ( 1890-1900 ) / Detroit Publishing Company Collection / Photograph from The Holy Land Set
The Past in Focus Image Collection will include a PDF that includes captions of every photo and the archive that it was obtained from, allowing you to explore its source yourself. 
Portrait of fisherman Johannes Johnsen ( 1935 ) / Anders Beer Wilse, photographer / Nasjonalbiblioteket
The Winter Camp ( 1908 ) / Edward S. Curtis, photographer / Library of Congress
Libraries make it a practice to scan photographs and then upload them to their archives untouched and unrestored. Most need color correction, sharpening, and a great deal of spot cleaning to bring them to vibrant life again. It takes me anywhere from 10-45 minutes to clean and restore each photo. If "The Past in Focus" gets successfully funded, I'll be taking time off from my small business to focus on the digital restoration of these 100 images.
Below is a vintage glass-plate negative shown before and after restoration.
Another before and after example: 
My sister and I operate a home-based photo business, so making beautiful photographs is our specialty. All 8x10" shipped within the United States will be printed and cut by hand in our home studio. They will be printed on Canon premium luster photo paper with Chromalife inks ( 150+ year lifespan ). Any orders outside of the United States will be printed and shipped by Loxley Colour of Scotland, a fine photography studio. All photos are archival so you'll have a print that one day will be as old as the image printed on it!

Shipping Rates for Prints: 
$2 in the USA
$10 Everywhere Else
Close-Up of One of the Prints
This will be a beautiful 120-page hardcover photobook printed on 100# glossy coated paper featuring all of the photographs from The Past in Focus -Fourth Edition. Only 100 of these books will be made so this is a very limited edition!! Would you like your name in the book? You deserve it, so just let me know and you'll be accredited as an official restoration sponsor!
Add-ons are certainly allowed! If you want rewards from two different tiers, simply add to your pledge the amount of the second reward you would like. 
Example: If you selected the Make 100 Limited Edition Book reward tier ( $50 ) and want the Image Collection as well ( $30 ), then you would select the book tier and change your pledge to $80 ( $50+$30 ). 
Warning! The book is a LIMITED EDITION and cannot be added to any other reward tier! If you would like the book, you must select that reward.  
John Crouch with his Delahaye 135 racing car at the Grand Prix in Bathurst ( 1946 ) / State Library of New South Wales / Photograph from The Motoring Set
Officers of General George B. McClellan’s staff ( 1862 ) / James F. Gibson, photographer / Library of Congress / Photo from The Civil War Set
Don't feel like buying the whole collection? Then try out a photo set! Or better yet, add some to the collection! 
Stretch Goals! 
If funding goes above these amounts, more photos will be added to the collection! 
If we reach $4,000....
...then "Yachting" will be added. This set features beautiful yacht images from photographer John S. Johnston. 
If we reach $5,000....
...then a set of 10 photos from the National Park Service will be added. 
If we reach $6,000....
....then a set of 8 photographs from famed photographer Frank Hurley will be added. 
If we reach $7,000....
....then How Interesting! will be added. This set features unusual images of all kinds. 
If we reach $8,000.....
...then a set of 10 images from the archives of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration will be added.

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! 

First off I want to thank all of you for making The Fourth Edition of The Past in Focus possible! The book turned out beautiful and if you selected that as your reward level you should have received it in April ( if you didn't, please contact me ). There are a few extra copies of the book still available - I also have some extra copies of the First Edition and Third Edition - so if anyone wants one, send me a message! These are extremely limited editions.

Hello everyone! 
It's been a little while since I have posted an update so one is certainly due! There are several announcements to make, so here goes: 
Over the weekend, a survey was sent out to those who selected The Past in Focus book reward. This is just to collect mailing addresses. If you didn't receive the survey, please let me know.

Hello everyone! 
Just wanted to post a quick update: if you backed any of the print or digital levels ( except for the one with all the bonus sets ) you should have received a survey in your email inbox.  The Past in Focus Image Collection will be sent out later today to all of you who already answered this survey.  :-)

Funding for The Past in Focus has been successful! 
Thanks to all of you who supported this project, yet another 100 images will be restored and issued in a limited edition book! 
I love restoring historic photos and sharing them and I am so grateful to have such encouraging backers who are just as eager as I am to see these images get the spotlight attention they deserve.

campaign.story:
We are JounMill, family metal molding manufacturer. We like to invent fun and useful things. Launching this project on Kickstarter, We want to bring Clobe out to the world successfully!
 Desk accessory that imitates the planet earth
Put it on your desk and see how the world is turning. Clobe is super functional desk accessory that you can only meet here on Kickstarter.

 As you know, the Earth rotates once a day on its axis. And the sunlight always covers half side of the planet rotating. The core design concept is to describe the sunlight reflecting on the Earth so that we can see where is in daytime, where is in nighttime, time, season, some kind of natural phenomenons all at once.

 Also it can charge devices like smart phones, earbuds with high performance wireless charger module in it.
24 O'Clocks

Get Informed 
Clobe is first designed as clock. However, it shows you not only the time but also date, temperature, humidity which we want to see in our life so frequently. Just tap the right corner of the screen to see what you want.


World Clock 
 Turn the globe to see the time of a specific city you want to know. Let the city face forward then the time being shown will automatically change.

 Almost every capital cities and some popular cities are here. All the cities are in specific time zones that are divided by UTC(Universal Time Coordinated) from -11 to +12. However, a few cities don't use the time zones where they are in. In that case, they have their own time zone given in brackets after each name.


The seasons are always changing
The Earth rotates about an imaginary line that passes through the North and South poles of the planet. This line is called the axis of rotation and tilted about an angle of 23.5 degrees relative to our orbital plane - the plane of Earth's orbit around the Sun.

 When the Earth orbits with the tilted axis of rotation everywhere except the equatorial regions takes different amount of energy from the Sun everyday. That is why the seasons are changing.


Wireless Charger
QC 2.0/3.0 adapter is required. Otherwise, charging system will be unable.
10W charging mode for Galaxy series
7.5W charging mode for iPhone series
5W charging mode for other devices
Non-slip rubbers on charging bed
Charging bed dimension : 140mm/5.5in * 88mm/3.5in * 30mm/1.2in which fits every smart phone and also AirPods


4 brightness levels
It's mood light
 Clobe is designed to look like the real Earth in real time. The light inside describes the sunlight reflected from the Earth in universe. The light keeps rotating once a day and changing the angle according to the date.

Imagine when you are lying on the bed in your room and there is a Clobe mildly glowing on the desk at night. This is a beautiful Mood Light. Of course, you can easily turn ON/OFF the light by tapping it or your smart phone.
Brightness is adjustable within 4 levels.


Settings
 You can adjust time, date with control buttons behind or your smart phone via Bluetooth. Once you have done it, Clobe remembers the data with a mercury cell in it so that you don't need to do that again even after it loses power.

You can also adjust the brightness of the globe and information screen.

DST, date format(yy/mm/dd), 12h/24h format set them all with your preference.


Color temperature is also adjustable.
3000K / 4000K/ 5000K/ 6000K


Charging adapter is not included
 It works with 5V/1A adapter if you don't need to charge any other devices. If you want to charge you need to use QC2.0/3.0 adapter.

What you can do with smart phone via Bluetooth :
Time & Date Setting
Turn On/Off mood light
Adjust brightness
DST(Daylight Saving Time) On/Off
Play with the light


AU$1 is about US$0.74
Shipping
US, Australia : AU$20
The rest of the world : AU$22
Rewards don't include additional duty and taxes that may be charged as per local laws of importation.


What's in the box
Charging adapter will not be provided. To charge any other devices, QC2.0 or QC3.0 adapter is necessary.
Color options are DARK GREY, WHITE, BROWN. The selection will be asked after this project ends. White is with yellow LEDs.
Super Early Bird will get the first delivery.



Can it be operated in a cordless mode? No it can't. Sorry for the confusion by images. It doesn't have a battery in it not to increase the cost.
  How long is the USB A to C cable included? It's 1.5m long. Or 59in.
  How is the texture? Matt and soft. We could not demonstrate as perfectly as it is because we are not experts in camera... Sorry. However, it's definitely high-quality. Not toyish.
  Are the time zone lines correct? The vertical lines on the globe are simplified version of the time zone lines which is kind of zigzag in real life. Though they are not the same, you can get the accurate time of a specific city if you know its time zone.
  Is the brightness of the dot-matrix adjustable too? Yes. You can adjust either the light in globe and the dot-matrix separately.
  Showing mode : The light in the globe can move as you want by a smartphone application regardless the time and date. It will be fun!

campaign.story:
ON HELL: A Tribute to the Year 2020
A plague. A global recession. Spikes in unemployment. Protests in the streets. Buildings burning. And Donald Trump just won't leave. 2020 has been a year that will stay in our memories for a long, long time. To bring this remarkable year to a close, the Mouse Book Club is releasing a commemorative series this holiday season: ON HELL.
Mouse Books ON HELL Edition
TAKE A BREAK FROM YOUR PHONE AND PICK UP A *small* BOOK!!!
If you are like us, this campaign season you read way, way, way too much online journalism. Mouse Books offer a convenient alternative to reading on your phone: phone-sized books!
Phone-Sized Book
MOUSE BOOK CLUB MEETINGS
You are invited to 3 Mouse Book Club Meetings over the course of the January, 2021. Each meeting is centered to one of the books, and we invite a special guest to the meeting who is an expert on the author/book. These Meetings are hosted on Zoom and you can participate live or listen to the replay via OUR PODCAST.


BUDDY PASS
Reading is best when shared plus MOUSE BOOKS MAKE GREAT HOLIDAY GIFTS! If you buy two sets you'll save a little money and we can ship to two locations if you like.
MOUSE MICRO-LIBRARY
If you are new to Mouse Books you can catch up on our previous series with one of these sweet little BOX SETS.
MOUSE READER REVIEWS
"I love small things that are beautifully made." Clarissa in San Antonio
“I am once again smitten with literature. This new medium (Mouse Books) offers a unique approach, an engaging appeal to consider, to ponder." Tim in Portland
“I LOVE being a member of the Mouse Club!! Experiencing the written word tactically is not only irreplaceable and difficult to articulate, but it is vital we read, caress and FEEL the power the written word possesses. We have strayed so far!!” Kelly in Walla Walla

WORLD-CLASS QUALITY
We are obsessed with making these books extremely high-quality. We have put a lot of time and energy in to fine tuning the physical object in your hand. 
We've partnered with one of the great printers in the USA, Lake County Press in Waukegan, Illinois, to bring Mouse Books to life. And since our printing partner is local to our Chicago-based team, we know our quality standards are upheld during every print run.
World-class color laboratory at our printer, Lake Country Press.
THANK YOUUUU!!!!
If you are NEW to Mouse Books, THANK YOU for making it through the whole description! We sincerely hope you subscribe!!!
If you are returning to Mouse for another project, THANK YOU for believing in this effort! We look forward to continually working hard to make your  Mouse Book Club experience better and better.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Mouse Books is, in our estimation, a very low-risk project. We have two major costs: printing and shipping. We have a keen understanding of both. In the last couple years, we have printed and shipped tens-of-thousands of books. If we hit our funding threshold we will be able to fulfill one year of quarterly shipments to all subscribers, and print/fulfill all 3-pack orders.

The biggest hurdle for this campaign is shipping in time for the holidays. We have put the key print files into the printer's hands already and feel did not launch this campaign until we were confident we could hit the shipping deadline to ensure delivery in time for the holidays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi All,
Let's close the On Hell series strong! First off, if you never got your books, message me. Lots of internationals still lagging, but all US should have arrived ages ago.

If you have not read them, we HIGHLY RECOMMEND checking out these additional resources:

Hi All,
PLEASE JOIN US for our discussion on Dante with Prof Bill Cook TOMORROW at 6:00 EST. Zoom info below:

HI ALL,
ANY MISSING BOOKS???
OK - unless you are international you should have gotten your books already. 
IF YOU DID NOT RECEIVE YOUR BOOKS YET PLEASE MESSAGE ME YOUR ADDRESS!

DANTE MEETING RESCHEDULED FOR FEBRUARY 3

HI All,
We had an AMAZING conversation with Stanley Fish about Paradise Lost. Here is a link to show. 
https://mousebookclub.com/podcasts/paradise-lost-by-milton/

Hi All,
Yesterday we dropped off 375 packages of HELL, and there are about 75 still to pack up today. Honestly, I got distracted by the news, which unfortunately continues to seem on point with this series. 
On the bright side, the books look great and these should land just in time for the speaker series that kicks off next week. Thanks again for all your support and patience and we look forward to getting down to the business of reading and discussing :)

campaign.story:
Financial knowledge is in the cards! Introducing The Money Deck: a whimsical, pocket-sized guide to personal finance, concisely captured on 52 casino-quality playing cards. Whether you’re looking to save your bottom line, invest in your financial future or just play poker, this deck will help demystify money for newbies and pros alike. Each card provides a cleverly curated concept, artfully delivered with humor, simplicity, and impeccable design.
If a Wall Street bro and your favorite grade school teacher combined to teach personal finance, you might just get The Money Deck.
The Money Deck is like a greatest hits album of the most important personal finance concepts, based on the input of hundreds of money enthusiasts. Whether it’s the basics (what the heck is a financial plan?), investing tips (how do most people mess this up?), retirement help (when?!), or the fun and philosophical (how much money do I need to be happy?), we’ve got you covered.
Concepts, quotes, tips and handy reference cards come paired with beautiful original illustrations and top-notch graphic design. Topics covered include:
Simply put, The Money Deck is for those who have money, and especially those who don’t. From the living room to the waiting room, aspirational investors, debt destroyers and wannabe retirees will find a way to grow their knowledge portfolios.
Perfectly pocket-sized, it makes an enriching gift for those near or far, be it the savvy student, new grad, cool client, or that friend who dodges the dinner bill like it’s their ex.
Learning about money has never been more simple, fun and approachable. Forget the confusing-by-design jargon – The Money Deck keeps hand-picked concepts clear and unpretentious. Most importantly, owning the deck will make people think you have your life together…and you just might prove them right!
The ultimate Christmas gift
Yep, the decks will be shipping out in early December, so  you'll be able to fill the stockings of friends and family with top-notch financial wisdom.
The deck will be manufactured by WJ Playing Cards, producers of casino-quality playing card decks. They'll use state-of-the-art presses and top-end card stock to print a deck that both looks and feels amazing.
The tuck case has a beautiful wrap-around design, full of intricate details, and will be printed on matte-finish stock, with gold foil and embossing, to create a striking visual effect.


In the past 6 years, Ben has released four other educational decks of playing cards: The Beer Deck, The Weed Deck, The Design Deck, and The Font Deck. They have now sold over 10,000 copies, been shipped to 90 countries, and are used as curriculum aids in several colleges and universities. You can purchase them here, or choose a reward level that includes them!
Nicholas Fleming is a business consultant and dad-joke enthusiast from Newfoundland, Canada now based in Seattle, Washington. He earned his MBA from Harvard Business School and loves to synthesize business concepts in fun and accessible ways.
Ben Barrett-Forrest is a designer, type nerd, musician, and baker from Whitehorse, Yukon, now living in Victoria, British Columbia. This is Ben’s fifth deck of educational playing cards launched on Kickstarter.  www.benbf.ca 
Jori Bolton is a Canadian editorial illustrator living in Hamilton, Ontario with his wife, two parrotlets, and a miniature poodle. Some past illustration clients include The Globe and Mail, MoneySense, Reader’s Digest, Scientific American, The Washington Post and WIRED.  www.joribolton.com 
We'd love to tell as many people as possible about this playful new way to learn about personal finance. If you're excited about this project, please share it with your friends.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Money Deck is my fifth deck of cards I've Kickstarted, so I'm getting the hang of this process. I work with Shipfusion, a reliable distribution company with a warehouse Chicago, so shipping should run smoothly.
There's always potential for delays to arise in the manufacturing process, but I've built in enough leeway to reduce the risks.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
The decks are made from 100% paper, and can be easily recycled in municipal recycling programs.
The scrap paper from the manufacturing process is shredded, baled, and repurposed into tissues and toilet paper.
Sustainable materials
The decks are manufactured using sustainably-harvested paper, and printed with non-toxic, vegetable-based inks.

updates.update_content:
Hi folks,
Hooray! We're delighted to tell you that at long last, your Money Decks have shipped!

Hi folks,
Here's a quick update on The Money Deck shipping. 
The big boxes of decks have arrived at a distribution centre in Los Angeles, but apparently things are so backed up due to Black Friday mayhem that the boxes haven't been processed yet. We're hoping that they'll be processed tomorrow, and then sent to our distributor in Chicago.

Hi folks,

They look and feel amazing, and we're so happy with how the gold foil and embossing turned out!

Hi folks,
I just received some photographs from the Money Deck manufacturer, showing how the tuck cases are coming along. And boy, they are shiny! 
We opted to go for gold foil and embossing, and we're really excited about how they look. Here are some photographs of the printed tuck case sheets before they have been folded.

Hi folks,
Woweeeee! We hit our goal, in under 40 hours! Thanks so much to all of you for supporting this project.

campaign.story:
UPDATE: ELEVENTH HOUR BONUS BOOK
This campaign was extremely exciting and, as always, the Mouse Team is grateful for your desire to get serious about reading. To celebrate the close of another successful campaign we are going to add one more book to the mix. Du Bois was a genius, and his work has an immediate and compelling relevance at this very moment. This book will ship with everything else in a few weeks.
TAKE A BREAK FROM YOUR PHONE AND PICK UP A *small* BOOK!!!
If you are like us, you can only take so much social media and online journalism. Mouse Books offer a convenient alternative to reading on your phone: phone-sized books!
YOU SUBSCRIBE, WE SEND YOU BOOKS
Ever subscriber gets 12 Mouse Books during the year, which are carefully curated into 4 quarterly series built around a theme. Our selections focus on great works of literature that are highly relevant to our current moment. 
CAREFULLY SELECTED, ORGANIZED, AND PRESENTED FOR MAX RELEVANCE AND JOY
In making our selections, the Mouse Book Club strives to be practical and inspiring in the face of challenging questions: How do we live these human lives? How do we live meaningfully, honorably, and purposefully despite the imperfections of the world and our own hearts? (h/t to Maria Popova for putting into precise words this spirit.) 
The SOLITUDE Series focusses on one of the core experiences of COVID-19.
WE GATHER TO DISCUSS THE BOOKS WITH THE BEST EXPERTS WE CAN FIND
You are invited to 12 Mouse Book Club Meetings over the course of the year. Each meeting is centered to one of the books, and we invite a special guest to the meeting who is an expert on the author/book. These Meetings are hosted on Zoom and you can participate live or watch the replay.  

INTERNATIONAL BACKERS PART OF THIS TOO!
EARLY BIRD GIFT
The first 200 Backers to this campaign will get a free copy of The Prophet by Kahlil Gibran shipped IMMEDIATELY (e.g. the day you pledge - US backers only...If you are international we'll include it when your pledge fulfills). Simply put, this is one of the greatest books of all time and our gift to you for being an awesome early backer.
The Prophet has been translated into 108 languages, and it has never gone out of print.
BUDDY PASS
Reading is best when shared. If you buy two memberships you'll save a little money and we can ship to two locations if you like.  
MOUSE MICRO-LIBRARY
Get one of the first two years of Mouse Books in a sweet box set. 
MOUSE READER REVIEWS
"I love small things that are beautifully made." Clarissa in San Antonio
"I was reading the Murders in the Rue Morgue and another passenger was so very intrigued by the Mouse Book, I had to give it to them. It was the most wonderful idea, they were very happy. But now, I wanna finish reading it for myself. What are the steps to ordering another copy?" Joel in Austin (we gave him another copy...)
"“I am once again smitten with literature. This new medium (Mouse Books) offers a unique approach, an engaging appeal to consider, to ponder." Tim in Portland
“I LOVE being a member of the Mouse Club!! Experiencing the written word tactically is not only irreplaceable and difficult to articulate, but it is vital we read, caress and FEEL the power the written word possesses. We have strayed so far!!” Kelly in Walla Walla
WORLD-CLASS PRINTER
We are obsessed with making these books extremely high-quality. We've partnered with one of the great printers in the USA, Lake County Press in Waukegan, Illinois, to bring Mouse Books to life. And since our printing partner is local to our Chicago-based team, we know our quality standards are upheld during every print run.    
LCP's rockstar color laboratory. If the FBI had a question about color they would call our printer.
THANK YOUUUU!!!!
If you are NEW to Mouse Books, THANK YOU for making it through the whole description! We sincerely hope you subscribe!!!
If you are returning to Mouse for another year, THANK YOU for believing in this project! We look forward to continually working hard to make your  Mouse Book Club experience better and better.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Mouse Books is, in our estimation, a very low-risk project. We have two major costs: printing and shipping. We have a keen understanding of both. In the last couple years, we have printed and shipped tens-of-thousands of books. If we hit our funding threshold we will be able to fulfill one year of quarterly shipments to all subscribers, and print/fulfill all 3-pack orders.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
I love to draw. The drawings I like best make me laugh. A few months ago, I found myself drawing an asteroid and dinosaurs escaping on bicycles. It struck me that these could make great patterns for a bug-out bag. This Kickstarter project is about producing a small batch of quilted-cotton bags with the Skedaddleosaurus patterns. Are you in?
Prototypes are approved. Now I just need sponsors.
Exterior: a whimsical, yet dignified, pattern of dinosaurs making a great escape.
Interior: a motivating pattern of menacing asteroids.
With the Skedaddleosaurus Bags you don’t have to leave good taste behind while making your escape. Whether you’re getting away for the weekend or starting a permanent, dystopian road trip, these are the bags for you.
*********
TOTE BAG
Quilted-cotton tote bag enlivened with two distinctive patterns. Exterior is dinosaurs escaping on bicycles and interior features complementary pattern of menacing asteroids. Pattern designs by Don Moyer in soothing palette of Bright Aqua, Teal, Caribbean Sea, and Caviar.
• Full top zip to secure your goodies.
• One exterior pocket—with a zipper.
• Six slip pockets on the inside to keep your granola bars separate from your gold bars.
• Flat bottom for stability in turbulent times.
• Large enough to hold two chihuahuas with room to spare.
• Dimensions: 14”W x 6”L x 13”H. Strap drop approximately 12” for over-the-shoulder use.
Care: Machine washable. First, remove your stuff and the bottom stiffener. Then, machine wash in cold water on gentle cycle with mild detergent. Dry flat. Do not bleach. Do not iron. Then put your stuff back in.
*********
DUFFEL BAG 
Quilted-cotton duffel bag enlivened with two distinctive patterns. Exterior is dinosaurs escaping on bicycles and interior features complementary pattern of menacing asteroids. Pattern designs by Don Moyer in soothing palette of Bright Aqua, Teal, Caribbean Sea, and Caviar.
• Full top zip to secure your goodies.
• Three exterior pockets—one zipper pocket on the side and two slip pockets on the ends.
• Six slip pockets on the inside to keep your ray gun separate from your Ray-Bans. 
• Flat bottom for stability in turbulent times.
• Large enough to hold an unconscious English Bulldog
• Dimensions: 20”W x 10”L x 12”H. Strap drop approximately 16” for over-the-shoulder use.
Care: Machine washable. First, remove your stuff and the bottom stiffener. Then, machine wash in cold water on gentle cycle with mild detergent. Dry flat. Do not bleach. Do not iron. Then put your stuff back in.
Beautiful, useful, funny.
Rewards—Supporters of the project will receive either the tote, duffel, or both bags. We have already inspected and approved the pre-production prototypes. So fabrication can start as soon as the project reaches its funding goal.
Both bags will be produced at Bella’s textile workshop in China. She and her team do great work and have delighted us with their prototypes.
Pack your bags and you’re ready to go.
What the critics are saying
Both bags look great. Dignified from a distance and silly up close.
*******
Travel is dirty. These can be cleaned. Brilliant.
*******
Handles over shoulder leaves hands free for fighting zombies.
********
Excellent gifts for anyone contemplating an exit.
*******
Shipping. The cost of shipping will be added to your pledge based on where you live. Because shipping is restricted during the Covid-19 pandemic, we are limiting rewards to residents of the U.S. and Canada only. Later, when global trade is restored, some extras of these bags will be available at our online store. So, anyone excluded from the Kickstarter project will be able to get Skedaddleosaurus Bags there.
Sometimes, but not always, shipments to Canada get hit with customs duties. I have no way of predicting if they’ll apply to your shipment. Customs inspections are very arbitrary and willy-nilly. Most packages sail through without any duty, but some are selected by chance and the recipient gets hit with a duty fee. So if you can’t tolerate the risk that your shipment might get selected for extra costs, you should probably not support this project. Or arrange to have your reward shipped to a friend in the U.S. who can bring you dinosaurs during their next trip.
If you are an international sponsor and receive a tracking number when we ship, track your package daily to make sure it doesn’t get hung up in the system and returned to us. Don’t just assume it will show up at your door. Shipments have a way of getting stalled, and monitoring the status of the tracking number allows you to intervene promptly.
Where are you? When the rewards are ready to ship, we’ll send out a Kickstarter address survey. If you don’t respond to that survey within 6 months, we’ll assume you no longer want your reward. I don’t have the space to hold your reward in perpetuity or until the cows come home. 
 Shipping is provided by our capable and multi-talented partners at Fulfillrite. Our Fulfillrite friends are fast and they do things right the first time.
What’s going on? Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds but not so often that you think I’m a pest.
Questions? Send me your questions and I’ll add them and the answers to the FAQ section at the bottom of this page.
 Leftovers from my previous Kickstarter projects are available while supplies last at www.calamityware.com. A good place to find some unusual gifts.
Don Moyer, Pittsburgh, May 25, 2020
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This project is using established production methods—textile printing, cutting, sewing, etc. We don’t need to quarry any unobtanium or invent anti-gravity devices. The design of both bags is complete and I’ve already tested prototypes, so we are good to go. The most likely threat is some unanticipated obstacle in the production schedule that will slow us down. Perhaps insidious microbes will disrupt global supply chains or manufacturing capacities will be diverted to produce hazmat suits. Who knows? I’ve built extra time into the schedule to accommodate mild disruptions. But biggies could surprise us all. I promise I won’t rest until these bags reach their new homes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Racing to the finish line
The bags have shipped. Most of you will get an email shipping confirmation with tracking number today or tomorrow. If you don't see it...
• Check your spam folder or the other email account you used when you made your Kickstarter pledge.
Nearly ready to skedaddle.

Survey time.
A boat-load of Skedaddleosaurus bags are nearing the end of their journey. So, it's time to collect mailing addresses from the sponsors of this project. Look for an email from Kickstarter inviting you to complete their simple on-line address survey. It will only take you a few seconds.
Good news. All the Skedaddleosaurus Bags are done and on the truck. Next stop, a boat to make the journey across the Pacific.

Just a quick update. Production is going smoothly. Fabrics have been printed with our wacky patterns and bags are being assembled. No problems so far.
Might we a slight delay with shipping because we need to consolidate these bags into a container with  some cotton shopping bags so they can all make the trip together. Also seem to be fewer boats shuffling across the oceans during the pandemic. So, getting space on a vessel is slightly harder than during normal times. I’ll keep you updated when there is news.

Hooray! We made it.
Now, Kickstarter will start collecting the pledges. It’s a two-week process. If they have trouble with your credit card, they’ll send you an email to try to straighten things out. So, keep an eye on your in-basket. and spam folder.
Meanwhile, Production of the Skedaddleosaurus bags has started. (See previous update.)

Who knew? Although I have done many Kickstarter projects, these bags are something entirely new. I had no idea if you would support the project or not. Imagine my surprise and pleasure when several hundred sponsors appeared during the first week. Thanks. You are the best!
Green light. Because we hit the funding goal early, I feel confident giving the workshop a green light to start production weeks before the project ends. We are giving Bella the order today. Getting an early start will either help us deliver the rewards early or give us extra time to cope with the fiascoes that are likely to appear later.

campaign.story:
Edo Karuta Playing Cards is our fifth playing card offering on Kickstarter. After previous four playing card projects (modestly successful due to the support of our backers) that were entirely focus on the theme of change and transformation, we decided to explore something different - street graffiti. We have always been interested in street culture, which Flagrant Agenda started off with, particularly graffiti and how it can be use as an medium to make a point. After at least two unsuccessful attempts to come up with a concept and design that we are pleased with, we stumbled upon MILTZ.
PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

MILTZ https://miltz.myportfolio.com is a young and talented graphic artist from Japan and we are particularly intrigued with his project, Shibuya Bluffiti. The juxtaposition of negativity associated with graffiti and the possible normalization of graffiti as a part of a neighbourhood and the modern interpretation of a traditional lettering style showed us a new way of looking at graffiti - graffiti does not have to always be counter culture and anti establishment. While change usually happens by going against the norm, it can also happen by working within a system.
This collaboration between us and MILTZ has taken in quite unexpected directions with very fascinating bouncing of ideas and crafting of visual elements to be included in the deck. May we present the Edo Karuta Playing Cards. 
The aesthetic mainstay of Edo Karuta is the ubiquitous Edomoji, Japanese typographic and lettering styles that were invented and vastly popular during the Edo period. They are primarily used for advertising and branding in the various trades that sprung up during the prosperous epoch before the advent of modern Japan. You can still see many traditional Japanese brands using Edomoji in their marketing efforts. Walk by any Japanese restaurants and you will bound to see banners with Edomoji written on them. In Edo Karuta, these typographical elements are superimposed onto each other to make up interesting and visually arresting motifs, the signature style of MILTZ that we saw in his Shibuya Bluffiti project. You can see these representations most clearly in our card backs. 
The pips are stylized motifs of the 4 seasons
The Edo period of Japan was chosen, or shall we say, fallen upon us as the thematic mainstay of Edo Karuta. Edo period can be considered the golden age of pre-industrial Japan. The Pax Tokugawa that was enabled by the unification of Japan by the Tokugawa Shogunate allowed for unprecedented economic growth as well as the flourishing of arts and other cultural pursuits. However, the Edo period was also characterized by isolationalist outlook and the cementing of strict societal hierarchy that lead to what some say as a general slow-down of industrialization. The Edo Period  ended with the arrival of the external powers that the Tokugawa regime cannot resist which lead to a modernization spur.
The aesthetic and thematic mainstay bring us back one full circle in terms of change. Edomoji symbolizes the merchant class, the beneficiary of the Pax Tokugawa and the catalyst for change due to the upset of the social order - on the surface of the system, all is rosy but change is already set in motion by the actions within the system. Alas, the last straw usually comes from outside the system, in this case, black ships appearing over the horizon.
Tuck Case  
Meaning of the stylized edomoji on our tuck case
Card Back 
The thick border of our card back with MILTZ's signature superimposition of two different edomoji scripts
PLAY

Primary Joker
The Aces
Each of the aces include a haiku, short, 3-phrases poems based on the four seasons from Matsuo Bashō (松尾芭蕉, 1644–1694), recognized as the greatest of all haiku masters.
The 4 haiku and their rough English translations:
♣ 春 (Spring) | 春もやや気色ととのふ月と梅 | After a long winter, plums began to bloom. The moon has come.
♦ 夏 (Summer) | 駿河路や花橘も茶の匂ひ | Although it is the season of the flower of Tachibana, Suruga-road smells of tea.
♥ 秋 (Autumn) | 朝茶飲む僧静かなり菊の花 | A monk is drinking tea in the garden in the morning. Chrysanthemums bloom in front of their eyes.
♠ 冬 (Winter) | 初雪や水仙の葉のたわむまで | The first snow has fallen. The snow piles up on the daffodils, and the leaves are bent.
Court Cards
The court cards feature subtle differences when view from different orientation with the graphical differences inspired by how the characters' lives and personalities have changed throughout their lifespan. The overall illustration is based on ukiyo-e motifs, poses and animal mascots with bold visual arrangements and liberal use of colours.
Tokugawa Ieyasu, the founder and first shogun of the Tokugawa Shogunate. Tokugawa Yoshimune, the eighth shogun and considered to be the best shogun in Tokugawa Shogunate

Tokugawa Tsunayoshi, the fifth shogun, also widely known as the 'dog shogun' for his love of dogs
Tokugawa Yoshinobu, the last of the Tokugawa shoguns
Yoshino, highly accomplished courtesan who was conferred the highest rank of Tayu
Kasuga no Tsubone, influential female politician in early Tokugawa shogunate that contributed greatly to the stabilization of the new regime
Katsushika Oi, consummate female painter in the style of ukiyo-e
Tenshoin Atsuko, official wife of the 13th shogun and key figure in the peaceful transition of Edo period to Modern Japan
Hattori Masanari, head of Tokugawa founder's castle guards
Honinbo Shusaku, Go master and nicknamed the 'Invincible' for his 19-game undefeated winning streak
Raiden Tameemon, legendary Sumo wrestler
Hijikata Toshizo, the last chief of the special squad, Shinsengumi, formed by the shogunate to protect its interest in the final days of the Edo period
Secondary Joker 
EDO KARUTA features:
Two colour schemes - The red/white Daimyo deck and the black/gold Shogun deck
Printed by United States Playing Card Company
Traditional cut and magic finish
Available in 2 editions - the Basic and the Special
Premium metallic ink for Shogun deck
Fully customized seal
For Basic - a classic Bicycle deck with a standard tuck case
For Special - custom pressed tuck case with special deck sleeve.
The Special Edition of both Daimyo and Shogun deck come with a custom design tuck case and deck sleeve. As the artwork for Edo Karuta fills all available space in a deck, the tuck case and deck sleeve are modified to showcase the inner tuck case and deck sleeve artwork while maintaining the structural integrity of the deck. 
You can see the prototype of rendering of the tuck case and deck sleeve below for both Daimyo and Shogun deck. The tuck case is open from the front, thus allowing the whole of the inner tuck artwork to be seen. The middle portion of the tuck case, when opened, is also hollowed, which allows the card back to be seen immediately when the tuck case is open. When cards are removed, the rest of the inner tuck case artwork will be revealed.
Sticker seal for the Daimyo Special Edition will be printed on foiled paper
The stylized edomoji (賭博封) on the sticker seal refers to the ban on gambling during the Edo period. Ironically, underground gambling and creative ways to overcome the prohibition flourished. We toyed with the alternative meaning of the phrase, 封, also meaning 'seal',  to put in on the sticker seal.
Artwork of the outer and inner deck sleeve for Daimyo Special Edition
Sticker seal for Shogun Special Edition will be printed on textured paper
Artwork of outer and inner deck sleeve for Shogun Special Edition
As part of our decks, we will also be rolling out custom minted coins as add-ons. Previously, we had Agenda EDC Coins as part of our playing cards campaigns. We think of coins as an natural extension of what we did with playing cards as they are related to playing cards in spirit as they are both are used by magicians in variety of tricks, collected vehemently by collectors, and, are instruments of chance. 
Edo Karuta Coin will again be a high quality offering that we have and help us provide a different, more durable and tactile way to express our ideas. We are hoping to again ride on the wave of the EDC (Every Day Carry) movement where coins are an integral and essential part of the movement and present opportunities for our ideas to be carry around and ponder upon every time the coins are being handled.
  Six Different Finishes for Edo Karuta Coin
6 different finishes from left to right - Antique Silver, Satin Gold, Black Nickel, Antique Copper, Antique Brass, Antique Gold
The Edo Karuta Coins will be die struck out of of a base brass material by CoinsforAnything and are 2” (approx. 50mm) in diameter. The coins will come in 6 finishes – Antique Silver, Antique Gold, Antique Copper, Antique Brass, Satin Gold and Black Nickel – and will feature smooth edges. All coins will be minted in USA.
FUNDING GOAL // SGD$22,000 
STRETCH GOAL 1 // SGD$25,000 <CRUSHED PREMIUM STOCK>
For add-ons, you need to be already pledging for a reward.
Click on ‘Manage your pledge’ and under the pledge amount of the reward you pledge, increase the amount accordingly to each of the add-ons price (see below).
Help us with this process by dropping us a message after you have adjust your pledge to include the add-ons with the details of your add-ons.
Respond to the post campaign survey asking you for the details of your add-ons. If you have any question, do feel free to drop us a message as well.
 Group 1 Countries include US, SG, HK, UK, JP, DE and AU.
Edo Karuta Coins are available in six different finishes.
Flagrant Agenda started off in 2014, focusing on street fashion and serving as an outlet to express ourselves on issues that we feel strongly about. We have, since launching our first project in Kickstarter in 2017, transited to being a lifestyle label and exploring a wider range of apparels and products. A strong focus on graphics and illustrations with a contemporary and urban overtone continues to be our modus operandi.
Our apparels and products are strongly driven by issues related to our surroundings, the environments we grew up in, what we encounter in our everyday lives and the society at large. On the fun side, we enjoy experimenting how these issues and themes can be realized visually. On the reflective end, we seek fulfilment in understanding how people who grew up and live in different cultures interpret these themes and gaining insights into similarities and differences in the way how people think.
We are grateful for all the support that we have gotten for the 3 projects that we have launched so far on Kickstarter - Agenda Playing Cards V1, Mini Agenda Playing Cards, Agenda Playing Cards Redux and Agenda Playing Cards Facade. Kickstarter is a wonderful platform that have extended our capacity to experiment with our ideas in ways that we could not have done before and, of course, provide platform to reach all of you who have supported us. On that note, we will continue to strive to explore and improve the way we bring our ideas to life.

Follow on Twitter
Like the Facebook page
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk to any project now is the ever changing situation related to COVID-19. The worst situation would see a total shutdown of non-essential travels between countries. Production might be adversely affected if USPC and our partners are unable to operate due to strict social distancing measures.

Barring the most dire of situation, we are fairly confident that the project will proceed as plan if it is funded. If the situation deteriorates, we promise to refund all the pledges and hope for a better time to relaunch our project.

If the project is going ahead, we sincerely seek your understanding if there is any minor hiccups along the way. We will be forthcoming with any issues in production and fulfilment and will be always available for any questions and suggestions. 

We look forward to your support in our project. Thank you very much!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Environmentally friendly factories
The main printing company that we will be working with, United States Playing Card Company, has various initiatives in place to minimize the environmental impact of their production and operation.

Firstly, the printing is done with vegetable ink on sustainably-harvested paper. The cards are non-toxic and when the need to finally retire or throw away the product, the product can be recycled like regular paper products. 

Second, their production generate a fair amount of scrap paper but these scrap paper are shredded, baled, and sent it off to be up-cycled into tissues or toilet paper.

Next, production area needs to be kept at a certain temperature and humidity level, thus to conserve energy, the area is partitioned off so that the entire warehouse space isn’t forced to operate at that level.

updates.update_userinfo: Shout out to Card Experiment's Yaksha Playing Cards. Campaign ending in 4 days.
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers

We would like to bring your attention to a new project by Card Experiment. The Yaksha deck is part 1 of the new Mythology series. Continuing in the fine tradition Japanese inspired themes,  Yaksha will be putting the spotlight on Oni (demon or trolls) and how they have been represented in Hannya (masks used in Japanese theatres). The design thrust is also inspired by traditional Japanese tattoo art form and features, in our honest opinion, quite stunning visuals and colour combinations.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #14: A thousand apologies for delay. Fulfillment is still on-going.
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers

We are truly sorry for the delay and the lack of communication. We were beset in the last few weeks by personal difficulties and also some external factors that we are unable, unfortunately, to manage effectively. We have managed to resolve most of them and will make extra effort to complete the fulfillment.

Due to cancellation of flights to several countries, it will take longer for some Backers to receive the decks as their rewards will be shipped by registered surface mail. Some US Backers will be receiving the Basic decks from the fulfillment centre in the US. Please wait a little longer.

Some of you should have already received the rewards and we are continuing to send out the rewards at a steady pace. Please rest assured that you receive your rewards. We will also try to keep up with replying messages.

We sincerely apologize for the delay in fulfillment.

Yours faithfully
Flagrant Agenda

updates.update_userinfo: Update #13: Rewards are coming your way
updates.update_content: Dear Backers

updates.update_userinfo: Update #12: We are in the final and last stage of production
updates.update_content:
Dear backers

USPC has just informed us that the production for the Basic Daimyo and Shogun is completed. They were slight behind schedule for about 1 week. The Basic decks are on their way to our fulfilment centre and we will update when we received them. Here are some photos that USPC has kindly helped us to take before they send off the decks to us.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #11: An belated progress update and a shoutout to Genso & Densho Playing Cards
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers
We apologize for this long overdue update, which we planned to be in July but delayed until now so that we have more to share.
First of all, we have more or less settled on the shipping arrangements for fulfilment of the rewards. International postal services are experiencing disruptions everywhere, especially to the USA. Fortunately, the COVID-19 situation has been easing up for many countries and many services are up and running as we speak and we hope that it will continue until the rewards are ready for shipping. For USA, many services are still disrupted but we have found a way to overcome the limitations. Our fulfilment partner has been trying out a logistic forwarder that will help us bring the rewards to USA which will then be sent through postal services to US backers. We are confidently that rewards will be able to ship and reach all of you without much delay when production is completed.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #10: Production is moving slowly but steadily
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers
The last 2 weeks has been a slow one for Edo Karuta Playing Cards. We have been talking to our production partners, many whom have restarted their operations only recently, and making amendments to the designs to account for production. We are glad to say that all designs have been finalized and we are waiting for production to start for the cards, coins and tuck cases. A longer waiting time is expected, especially for USPCC as they are in the midst of clearing the backlog from the lockdown of their manufacturing facilities. For our stickers, the production was not delayed but they are already in. They look gorgeous!

updates.update_userinfo: Update #9: Surveys are out! And what to do if you missed the project or wanted to add-on now.
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers
The surveys have been sent to all of you. We will be getting information for shipping as well as add-ons (if any) from you. If you have any comments, feedback or suggestions for us, you can also put them in the last question of the survey.
Please help us complete the survey at a convenient time for you as soon as you can so we can move along for the production. The shipping details can be amended anytime in the event you relocate before we start our fulfilment. We will only close it a few days before fulfilment and will put up an update to inform all of you.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #8: Edo Karuta Playing Cards Successfully Funded!
Update #7: Less than 72 hours to end of campaign! Testing of sticker seal and revised shipping fees for our Singaporean backers!
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers
We are less than 72 hours to the end of the campaign! The last 25 days has been a very encouraging and exciting time us. Once again, we witnessed and gotten tremendous support, in fact, the biggest out of all our projects, for Edo Karuta Playing Cards. Thank you very much for all your support! If you are still contemplating about adding on, please do decide and do so before the end of campaign. If you have any questions, do feel free to drop us a PM.
