campaign.story:
The Italian city of Florence needs no presentation: it is a synonym for art, history and timeless beauty.
Passione Playing Cards is proud to present to you Florentia, the project of custom playing cards celebrating the birthplace of the Renaissance - passionately designed by Elettra Deganello.
 QUICK OVERVIEW -- [EDIT MAY, 6TH]
Main decks: Antica (purple foil on the box + gold metallic ink touches inside), Nova (holographic foil on the box + yellow neon ink touches inside) and Aeterna (limited edition containing all 55+55 cards from both decks). Printed by USPCC.
 Fully custom and totally different back design, court cards, aces and jokers - for a total of 36 meticulously hand-drawn figures. 
Extra deck: Florentia Player's Edition, designed for full playability and printed by USPCC, with semi-custom courts.
Shipment estimated to begin in October 2020.
 UPDATES & DETAILS! Follow Passione also on Instagram or Facebook.
NOTE: All images are renderings. The final product is subject to change.
All the decks of the Florentia project and their backs. From the left: Aeterna, Antica, Nova and the Player's Edition.
Florentia Player's Edition is the newest addition to the Florentia Project: designed for everyday use, sports semi-custom court cards and represents the last incarnation of the Florentia concept devised by Elettra Deganello since the beginning.
The elegant design of the Player's Edition tuck case.
The courts have been designed by Giordano Loddo and are a variation of the "standard" Passione Playing Cart courts, of course adapted to match the theme and the style.
Semi-custom cards, designed with playability in mind.
The classic back design of Florentia Player's Edition.
Florentia Antica ("antica" means 'ancient' in Italian) and Florentia Nova ("nova" translates to 'new') represent two different visions on the same concept: to overwhelm collectors and playing cards lovers with a notable abundance of breathtaking art, history and beauty... just like the city of Florence does with its visitors.
A comparison between the AoD of the two main "souls" of Florentia.
Florentia Antica and Florentia Nova at a glance.
Elettra Deganello, the author, explains the two decks this way: "Florentia Antica represents a classic and balanced vision of beauty, in which architecture and rationality play a predominant role."
The main element of the back design is the stylized rose window of Florence Cathedral, S.M. Del Fiore. Tangled decorations balance the rationality of the geometric shapes and stylized architectural elements complete the composition.
Florentia Antica Ace of Hearts, back and box.
"Florentia Nova instead was born as a free and dynamic artistic expression, without constraints or fear of the contrasts between ancient (or classical) and modern."
The back design combines a clean geometric basis with dynamic elements. Its beating heart is the coat of arms of the Medici family, which is supported by two cherubs and surrounded both by a dancing ribbon and a laurel leaves frame.
Florentia Nova Ace of Hearts, back and box.
From the sketch to the final Ace of Spades of Florentia Nova.
The Jokers of Florentia Antica are Giotto, one of the most famous Italian painters and architects (legend says he was able to draw a perfect circle by hand) and the "Marzocco", the heraldic lion and symbol of the city of Florence.
The Jokers of Florentia Nova are Leonardo Da Vinci - he needs no introduction: a 360° genius in many fields - and the "Porcellino" (Italian "piglet"). This figure is the main subject of THE Florence fountain par excellence, which is linked to good fortune according to a special popular tradition that will be soon presented in our project updates.
The court cards of Florentia Antica and Florentia Nova are all different... and definitely full of surprises.
A comparison between the KoC of Florentia Antica and Florentia Nova, Dante Alighieri and Giovanni dalle Bande Nere.
A comparison between the QoH of Florentia Antica and Florentia Nova, inspired by sculptures made by Bartolini (from Prato) and Cecioni (from Florence).

It has become a tradition for Passione Playing Cards to produce a luxury double-deck tuck case, shaped like a book, which is a work of art in its own. Florentia Aeterna will hold both Florentia Antica and Florentia Nova cards together in a limited, hand-numbered edition.
Florentia Aeterna double tuck case.
Florentia Aetena back and front view, plus a detail of the art print.
The Florentia Aeterna (eternal, timeless) tuck case is the evolution of Acheronte and Pinocchio double boxes and will be printed by Archivio Tipografico in Italy (see Business Partners section) on very special stock. Whoever has acquired one of our previous double boxes already knows what to expect (top quality!) However, more information will be disclosed during the campaign.
Florentia Aeterna double tuck-case uncut sheet.
As a special feature, the uncut sheet shows a frame that would normally be cut.

Florentia Fine Art Prints enhance the quality and the detail of the illustrations which substantiate the decks. Printed on luxury paper, hand-numbered (only 99 available!) and signed by the author, the limited art prints are conveniently included in the top tiers (see the Rewards Description section).
Florentia Fine Art Print.
Florentia Fine Art Prints are 35cm x 50cm. Letterpress technique will be used to print them.
  Details of Florentia Fine Art Print.
But now let’s have a closer look at the two main decks.
Florentia Antica represents a classical and elegant vision of Florence. Touches of gold enrich the detailed black and white illustrations.
Depicted in Florentia Antica, you can find important historical figures from Florence; as concerns the all custom aces, they represent some of the most iconic sculptures and monuments that you'd admire when visiting Florence – especially the so-called 'Loggia dei Lanzi'.
  Hearts and Clubs of Florentia Antica.
Diamonds and Spades of Florentia Antica.

Florentia Nova somehow represents the blooming of the Renaissance: innovation, dynamism, and freshness are the keywords. Unexpected neon touches add a modern look to the cards.
Depicted in Florentia Nova you can find important historical figures from Florence; as concerns the all custom aces, they represent some of the most iconic sculptures and monuments that you'd remember after visiting the Italian city.
Hearts and Clubs of Florentia Nova.
Diamonds and Spades of Florentia Nova.
Florentia Aeterna will be printed on cotton paper with gold foil and hot impression. The limited-edition tuck box will be hand-made in Italy by letterpress experts. 
Florentia Aeterna double tuck case.
The following image is a rendered version of the Florentia Aeterna uncut double tuck case. You will be able to order it as an add-on item as well or find it conveniently included in the top rewards.
Florentia Aeterna tuck case.
The two decks are doubly protected: first with a wide lid that "closes the book" and then with two individual flaps.
The outer lid of the Florentia Aeterna double-deck reveals the individual illustrated flaps.
The double tuck case opens like a book and shows a technical drawing inspired by Santa Maria del Fiore.
To better understand the content of each tier, please check the following table. Please be aware that some items are limited, and some are a Kickstarter exclusive:
Visual Designer, Illustrator
Elettra Deganello is an Italian designer and entrepreneur. Along with Maurizio Toccafondi she founded :[creative]studio, a design agency based in Tuscany, and has collaborated since the beginning with Passione Playing Cards.
She is also the author of Pinocchio Playing Cards, another awesome and successful playing card project.
Special thanks to Maurizio Toccafondi for creating all the renderings on this page!
 Follow Elettra on Behance and Instagram.
You can add other items you'll receive as rewards! Choose the items you desire in the following table and increase your pledge accordingly!
United States Playing Card Company
Florentia Player's Edition will be printed by USPCC (makers of the world-renowned Bicycle® playing cards) on Air-Cushion finish.
You may have seen Air-Cushion mentioned as Cambric, Linen, Magic or Embossed, but they are all terms used by USPCC to identify the same finish.
Gambler's Warehouse has years of experience in order fulfilment, e-commerce and customer service. They also have a strong relationship with the United States Playing Card Company and spend countless hours researching and keeping track of the latest news and standards in the playing card industry.
Gambler's Warehouse has supplied cards & chips to thousands of casinos and other corporations for the last three decades—from Las Vegas and the Americas to Europe, Africa, and Asia.
Archivio Tipografico is an active and collaborative space for the preservation, the study, and the practice of typographic arts. The aims are to preserve, to keep alive and to reinvent in a contemporary way the craftsmanship knowledge for movable type composition and high-quality letterpress printing.
Passione is a brand of custom playing cards, that aims to bring Italian design and Italian culture into the world of custom playing cards, to promote the culture of custom playing cards, and to be a reference for the cardistry movement in Italy.
Previously funded projects on Kickstarter by Passione Team.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every project has risks, for a playing cards project the risks are of two kinds:

1) Bad quality.
2) Delays.

We have chosen the best partners in printing (WJPC, USPCC) and an experienced center for fulfilling and tuck case production (Gambler's Warehouse, TX, and Archivio Tipografico, Italy) so we are not worried about this aspect at all. The decks will be as cool as you expect them to be.

As for the delays: sometimes they just happen, however, we will do our best to ensure that there are no unnecessary delays and any issue is promptly communicated to you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Sustainable materials
USPCC uses:
• 100% recyclable and repulpable materials
• 100% non-toxic inks
• Starch based adhesives
• Water based coatings
• Raw paper suppliers are North American based and FSC certified
Environmentally friendly factories
WJPC passed the BSCI audit and received FSC certificate in 2019.

updates.update_userinfo: Update on the fulfilment status (spoiler: it's complete!)
updates.update_content:
Hi friends!
I’m happy to confirm that all rewards have been shipped. GW should have provided a tracking number to all of you, please check your email (maybe also in the spam folder) to find it. If you have any issue, don’t hesitate to contact me via private message.
Hopefully, the packages won’t be too much affected by the pandemic – still raging in many countries. To minimize that, we requested full tracking for all international (outside the US) packages. This extra-cost was not accounted for in the planning of the campaign, but Elettra and I thought it was the right thing to do to minimize the risks.

Dear friends, I know you are waiting for your decks for ages, so I'm keeping this update short and go straight to the news:
the international rewards (outside the USA) have been shipped by GW
all national rewards are ready to be shipped, but due to the current situation in Texas (the power shortage), no regular pickups have been done by the courier.
What can I say about it? ... I feel relieved.

Dear friends, two things first: 
Happy New Year! (let's hope that 2021 will be better than 2020)
I'm sorry for the delay in updating you.
Unfortunately, after two updates when I was just saying "there are delays, we don't know when USPCC is going to complete the printing phase" I didn't want to write a third update with basically the same words.

updates.update_userinfo: Photos and videos to cheer you up and the new exciting project by Elettra Deganello
updates.update_content:
Dear friends, while we are waiting for the completion of the production (as we said in the previous update, USPCC is printing the missing tuck cases and the Gamblers are assembling the decks) Elettra Deganello, the mastermind behind Florentia, received two assembled production decks. 
I think you would be nice to show you how goods the cards and the tuck cases are, in the meantime.

Dear friends, I know that you would like to hear this: "Fulfilling has just started, here you can find your tracking code", but unfortunately we are not in that position yet. Let me explain to you why.
USPCC forgot to print the tuck case for Florentia Player's Edition. I noticed that when I finally received some photos of the playing cards themselves.
USPCC agreed to print the missing tuck case and the Gambler's Warehouse agreed to assemble them as for the other decks (Florentia Nova and Florentia Antica).

Not a big surprise, right? Anyway, it should be next week. Now, I guess it's not super important the exact day, I just hope that they deliver the decks to the GW ASAP so that the final assembling can begin. 
Speaking of which, a few minutes ago I received some images of the very first tuck cases produced by the Gamblers. Boy oh boy... they are gorgeous. Now, please consider that the photos are shot with a smartphone in a warehouse, anyway... I'm speechless... they turned out exactly how we envisioned.

updates.update_userinfo: Estimated completion date from USPCC is Oct 13th.
updates.update_content:
Dear friends, some of you have noticed that we closed the window to change the address on some tiers only. The reason is that while we are waiting for USPCC and GW to produce, respectively, the cards and the tuck cases, we decided to anticipate the fulfilling of some of the rewards.
Art Prints and Aeterna tuck cases have been already produced in Italy by Archivio Tipografico and we decided that shipping them from Italy would have been a good option. Moreover, the Aeterna boxes and the seals have been sent to Gambler's Warehouse.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping of Art Prints and Aeterna Uncuts in some countries
updates.update_content:
Dear friends, I'm happy to update you on the production of the Florentia Project:
Aeterna tuck case, uncut sheets and Florentia Art Prints are ready. Elettra has already signed them.
We received the hard proofs for Florentia Nova, Florentia Antica and Florentia Player's Edition. They are gorgeous! Elettra tweaked some minor things, to make them even better, and we are ready to go into production!
Please be aware that during COVID-19 times USPCC has slowed down. I'm waiting for confirmation about production times, if there are delays on the expected date (October) I'll let you know.

Dear friends, I want to keep you posted with the Florentia project production:
USPCC and GW have approved all of the artwork (Nova, Antica and Player's Edition) and things are progressing. We've been told that digital proofs will be ready next week. It seems that USPCC is experiencing a slowdown due to COVID-19 and that has affected the approval of our print files as well. It's too early to understand if this delay will impact our fulfilment date (October 2020), but we'll monitor the process.
 Florentia Aeterna boxes and Florentia Fine Art Prints are complete now, and they will be soon shipped to Elettra Deganello to number / sign them. Enjoy some photos taken by Archivio Tipografico, in Turin! I will personally visit them tomorrow morning (I feel lucky!!).

campaign.story:
We're excited to announce the return of Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman  in Puppets, the new 3 issue story arc from writer Tom Ward and artist Luke Parker, with letters from Micah Myers. 
Still reeling from the shocking revelations in Monsters, Merrick stumbles into a trap set by the broken and maniacal Punch and Judy. Meanwhile, friction between Dr Frederick Treves and his friends comes to a head over his disastrous dabblings in the dark arts, and old enemies make an unwelcome return.
As always, thanks to our returning backers for your continuing support, we couldn't do this without you. And if you're new to our comic, a warm welcome to the sensational adventures of The Elephantman, the most remarkable human being ever to draw the breath of life! 
Puppets is a perfect jumping on point for new readers, but you can also check out the series from the beginning by downloading issue #1 for FREE.
ISSUE #9 PREVIEW
Check out the cover for issue 9, and the opening pages, all drawn by Luke. If you love them as much as we do, the artwork is available as pledge rewards.
ISSUE #10 COVER
ISSUE #11 COVER

THE WORLD OF MERRICK
Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman is a Victorian penny dreadful pulp adventure comic set in 1880s' London. Based on a fictional version of the life of Joseph Merrick, it steps between historical facts and turn of the century folklore juxtaposed with the superhero comic conventions of super powers, masks, secret identities and fantastic adventures.



QUALITY COMICS
If you've encountered any of our physical issues of Merrick I'm sure you have noticed the print quality and the nice distinctive feel they have, it's something we feel really passionate about.
We're striving to make every issue of Merrick something special, an item that you will want to keep. These are not disposable comics.
Both issues are beautifully presented, full colour, standard US size comics printed on heavy stock 120GSM uncoated bond paper. Issue #9 is 24 pages, #10 is 20 pages, #11 is 28 pages, all plus covers.
As with all single issues of Merrick, issue's #9 - #11 will be limited numbered runs of 500 never to be reprinted with the same cover.
A maximum of 2 print runs for each issue.
All single issues are shipped bagged and boarded to ensure they reach you looking as great as they went out.
We'll also send you digital versions of each issue in .pdf and .cbr formats so you can enjoy issues of Merrick on the move on your tablet, smartphone or PC.
Although issue #1 of Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman is completely sold out, there is still a chance to build an impressive collection of single issues by picking up copies of #2 - #8 with less than 60 copies of Merrick #2 left!
Don't worry about missing any of the story, you can download issue #01 in .PDF/.CBR absolutely free. 
Getting up to 11 issues is a huge achievement for any comic series. We're super excited to be making more books. Everything we've published to date is available on this Kickstarter.

THE TEAM
Tom Ward: Writer and creator of Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman. Tom is also co-creator and writer of Doc Dino and has been published in Comichaus, The Grime, British Showcase Anthology and has a story in Rum Row later this year. @highbrowtrash  
Luke Parker: Artist, colourist, designer and co-creator of Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman. You may have also seen his work on SEX, or The Winternational (Image Comics), or Halloween Eagle (Dark Horse Comics). @artofparker www.artofparker.com 
Micah Myers: As a freelance comic book letterer, Micah has lettered a host of comics for Image, Dark Horse, IDW, and many more. @micahmyers
Clare Lenton: Freelance editor and senior content designer, with a Masters degree in English Literature, specialising in Gothic literature. @ClareLenton
THANK YOU
Thanks to the amazing Kickstarter community, we have been able to create and release the first 8 issues of Merrick, a one-shot spin-off; Treves: A Restless Night and a special cross-over issue; Merrick & Crowe: Birds of Prey. 
We love making this comic, and we think it keeps getting better as a series as we learn and improve as creators, and we have you guys to thank for that for giving us these opportunities.
Now it's time to continue Joseph Merrick's story so we've returned to Kickstarter to hopefully fund the fourth arc.
All our books, plus prints and t-shirts, are available at our webstore www.merrickcomic.co.uk or digitally over at Comixology. 
WHAT THE REVIEWS SAY
"In each issue, you can feel the love, sweat, and tears the team put into their work. Although the art and some story beats take inspiration from Mike Mignola and some Hellboy, it stands apart creating its own history in indie comics, and it'll carve out its own slice in your heart and brain, making you crave more of the world." - www.comicbookyeti.com
"the art and story in Merrick grows with confidence in every issue and with each arc Ward and Parker find their voice more and more – as well as feeling free to experiment with where the story is heading. The artwork also becomes more imaginative and iconic (and less derivative), with Parker creating this dark and angular style which manages to perfectly evoke Victorian London, but also has a modern edge to it at the same time. A book that really definitely deserves the use of the word sensational!" -www.pipedreamcomics.co.uk
"Merrick started off as a character surrounded by myths who I felt I had half an idea of where this adventure could go – but the creative team have surprised me time & again and that’s made me come back to the title to re-read, rediscovery and enjoy.  A great character that has been filled up with endless potential thanks to Tom & Luke and eight issues in there’s still so much more for it to give.  Can’t wait for issue nine and beyond." - ComicsAnonymous
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is not my first, second, or indeed third rodeo, this is my EIGHTH Kickstarter.

I have delivered on all my previous projects, and things are a fairly well oiled machine at this point. The art for issue #9 is already completed, and will be heading to be lettered as I type this.

I've scheduled in plenty of breathing room on the completion date and I will always keep you updated on our progress.

I love making this comic, it really is a passion project for me and I am 100% dedicated to getting it finished and out to you all.

Obviously the COVID-19 pandemic is currently making things somewhat unpredictable. Currently the UK post offices are still open and our printer is still working, but these things could change. Digital issues will of course go out as they are ready. If there are any unavoidable delays I will keep you promptly updated.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi guys

Thanks again for backing our Puppets story arc. I really hope you've had time to read and enjoy the comics.

This is just a real quick update to let you know that we have just launched a new campaign for the second collected edition trade paperback of Merrick, that contains issues #5-8, and the out of print Merrick & Crowe cross-over.

Hi guys
I have now finished dispatching the last of the pledge rewards for the campaign, and it seems packages are also starting to turn up!

Thank you so much for being part of this Kickstarter and allowing us the opportunity to make more comics. I really hope you enjoy the comics and are pleased with your decision to back us.

Merrick: The Sensational Elephantman #11 is back from the printers. It came out perfect!

Hi!

MERRICK #11 PROGRESS

campaign.story:
I love to draw. My sketchbooks are filled with silly things that I like to draw. A few months ago I found myself drawing apes as they would appear in the line waiting to get through airport security. Wouldn’t that make a marvelous jigsaw puzzle?
Why a jigsaw puzzle? Puzzles are great because you can do them alone or with others. You get to set the pace. You can do the whole puzzle in one marathon session or drag the effort out over weeks. Solving a puzzle sharpens your cognitive skills and helps you learn to focus on details. Snapping a puzzle piece into position feels good and probably releases a flood of endorphins. How nice. And jigsaw puzzles don’t require any batteries, instruction manuals, or wifi.
More than 100 primates and a few aliens being extruded through the indignities of air travel.
What makes a puzzle great? I believe the best jigsaw puzzles have three vital qualities. First, lots of color. Next, oodles of details. No boring expanses of sky or snow. Last, a good puzzle is puzzling—a little mysterious and full of false clues, duplicates, and distractions.
I designed the APES AND ALIENS puzzle to give you abundant colors, beguiling details, and mild mystery. 
How big is the finished puzzle? There are 1,000 puzzle pieces. Once you put the Apes and Aliens puzzle together, it will measure 19.75" x 29" (50 cm x 70 cm).
How difficult is this puzzle? Challenging, but not so exasperating that you will have to be institutionalized. We included an overview of the whole image on the box lid and base, so you and a friend can both refer to it while working on the puzzle. If you believe the puzzle is too easy, try solving it without referring to the image on the box. If it is still too easy, do it blindfolded.
Puzzles make great gifts because they are easy to wrap.
Where are these puzzles going to be made? These puzzles will be made at Sarah's XZY puzzle workshop in China. (We know that sounds like a made-up name, but it’s real.) Printed on specially made, heavy puzzle board to prevent delaminating and reduce paper dust. Housed in a sturdy clear poly bag and nestled in a robust two-piece box with an image of the finished puzzle on both the lid and base. 
My two previous jigsaw puzzles in Kickstarter were smaller. Now they are rare collectibles.
*******
Shipping. The cost of shipping will be added to your pledge based on where you live. Because shipping is restricted during the Covid-19 pandemic, we are limiting rewards to residents of the U.S. and Canada only. Later, when global trade is restored, some extras of this puzzle will be available at our online store. So, anyone excluded from the Kickstarter project will be able to get puzzles there.
Sometimes, but not always, shipments to Canada get hit with customs duties. I have no way of predicting if they’ll apply to your shipment. Customs inspections are very arbitrary and willy-nilly. Most packages sail through without any duty, but some are selected by chance and the recipient gets hit with a duty fee. So if you can’t tolerate the risk that your shipment might get selected for extra costs, you should probably not support this project. Or arrange to have your reward shipped to a friend in the U.S. who can bring you your puzzles in their luggage next trip.
If you are an international sponsor and receive a tracking number when we ship, track your package daily to make sure it doesn’t get hung up in the system and returned to us. Don’t just assume it will show up at your door. Shipments have a way of getting stalled, and monitoring the status of the tracking number allows you to intervene promptly.
Where are you? When the rewards are ready to ship, we’ll send out a Kickstarter address survey. If you don’t respond to that survey within 6 months, we’ll assume you no longer want your reward. I don’t have the space to hold your reward in perpetuity or until the cows come home.
Shipping is provided by our capable and multi-talented partners at Fulfillrite. Our Fulfillrite friends are fast and they do things right the first time.
What’s going on? Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds but not so often that you think I’m a pest.
Can you find all the aliens?
Questions? Send me your questions and I’ll add them and the answers to the FAQ section at the bottom of this page.
Leftovers from my previous Kickstarter projects are available while supplies last at www.calamityware.com. A good place to find some unusual gifts.
Don Moyer, Pittsburgh, April 12, 2020
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This project is using established production methods—printing, die cuts, etc. We don’t need to quarry any unobtanium or invent anti-gravity devices. The design of the puzzle and box is complete and I’ve already tested a prototype, so we are good to go. The most likely threat is some unanticipated obstacle in the production schedule that will slow us down. I’ve built extra time into the schedule to help ensure that families will have a puzzle to work on for the holidays—a great family tradition. I promise I won’t rest until all the puzzles are on their way to their new homes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

comments.content: We found the puzzle extraordinarily difficult. As a first-time effort, that's OK. But I found that SOOOO many ape-faces in the same color made it very hard to catch the differentiation needed to succeed. One always seeks to balance challenge with reward in any game. Of course, this was only our experience.
Maybe there is nothing to be done at this point, but I’d hope you would take this into consideration for future puzzles, of which I hope there will be many.
Thanks so much :)
Received in NC, Thanks!!
I just saw an inspiring story on Kotaku that Moe’s the perfect time to start a puzzle exchange. Maybe by the end of summer, it won’t be too late to add these to the groups’ puzzle pools.
Missed the fireworks... Congratulations!
nice, passed 1K backers, final day...
Wow, almost 1000 backers! Good call. The previous puzzles from Don have been among my favorites. If you know anyone who would be interested, make sure you tell them now. Less than 2 days left.

Hi Don, you always make me smile when I see a new campaign of yours. I really love your creative projects and how down-to-earth you always seem in your videos :) Unfortunately, there is no option for shipping to Europe. But I would like to support you this time anyway. Please keep up the great work. At one point I will get myself a "things could be worse tea mug" (I love the name you chose for it :) Stay healthy and I wish you good luck with the last days of the campaign!

Pretty amazing how timely your products have become. Calamityware, indeed! Thank you for the extra-thick Bad Bandanas, making it easy to get out of the house and celebrate Social Distancing. And, for the top-shelf jigsaw puzzles, to stay safe and sane at home. These will be treasures when the Covid Calamity has passed.
..new production partner... fingers crossed as the prior puzzles were really good. I hope you include a "picture of the puzzle" in the box as the prior ones had.. love that.

Great design! We loved all the goofy details. The clones and mirror twins were diabolical. It helped to have a really good light to enable discernment of the colore differences. We finished it in 3 days working on and off. Unfortunately, when we were done, we were short a piece. Possibly this was because our cat helped us and the cleaning women were here the other day. We're looking forward to your next design.

Although we did check the floor prior to arrival of the cleaning crew, I think the most likely explanation involves a vaccuum cleaner, alas. A samovar sounds intriguing; never thought about one until now. Maybe you coud put one in your next design.
Wow, nice surge today! Funded... :)
I've been waiting for another of your puzzles. Looks wonderful as always.

campaign.story:
Lawyer Up funded on Day 1 in less than two hours! We have fully stretched the game to perfection unlocking 15 Stretch Goals along the way that have upgraded all of the components, added some additional backstory cards, some mini expansions, a solo mode and expanded the Art Forgery case into a deeper experience.  We are looking forward to supporting Lawyer Up with a bunch of new case expansions down the line!
Click the 'Late Pledge' button above and you'll be able to pledge/pre-order via Gamefound. Remember, this option will only be available for a limited time so act fast!
If you miss the Gamefound.com pledgemanager, you can visit our online store at https://shop.rockmanorgames.com to place a preorder (or just buy the game if it's available)
If you have any questions, be sure to check the FAQ or our most recent Kickstarter updates before messaging us directly!
Meticulously designed and developed by Samuel W. Bailey (Forbidden Stars, Talisman: Cataclysm) and Mike Gnade (Maximum Apocalypse, the Few and Cursed) over the last 4 years, Lawyer Up is an asymmetrical two-player courtroom drama card game where one player is the noble prosecution and the other the steadfast defense. Each game begins with the Discovery phase, where players draft vital evidence to support their case and bury evidence that might help their opponent. Next comes the Trial phase, where players call witnesses and play powerful arguments along with the evidence they drafted into their examination pools. To form a coherent line of questioning, players will need to chain together their cards by matching bias symbols. The player who can best examine the Witness by generating the most influence will spend the difference to sway the Jury to their side. Every game is different, but the lawyer with the best case and most convincing arguments will be sure to get the verdict they are after!
The core game includes the base decks for both the prosecution and defense along with all the other components (jurors, bias tokens, etc) you need to play any case of Lawyer Up.  The core set also features two unique cases to play: The Art Forgery Case and the Murder Case.
The Art Forgery Case is a shorter case (6 Witnesses instead of 9) that focuses on learning the arguments and procedures in the base Prosecution and Defense decks.  It is all about drafting the paintings from famous Dutch painters and using the right evidence to replay them from discard piles.
The Murder Case is your modern Law and Order murder trial.  Jessica Fairmount was found standing over her father, covered in his blood, but insists that she was only trying to save him. The wealthy socialite has a lot to gain with her father's murder, but did she do it? This case features major asymmetry between the Prosecution (who can lock jurors to their side) and the Defense. The Prosecution must get all the Jurors to believe she is guilty while the Defense only needs one Juror to believe in her innocence for reasonable doubt.  
Lawyer Up is divided into two phases, the discovery and trial phases.  The discovery phase is a drafting phase representing both attorneys working back at their offices going through all the evidence of the case. During this phase, players simultaneously draw 3 cards and add one card to their deck, one card to their opponents deck and bury the last card.  This means that every time that you play a case, your deck will be unique.
Players will not only draft unique decks, they will also select their legal strategies and Witnesses.  The trial phase of the game is typically made up of 9 rounds of witness examinations. During this phase, players take turns calling witnesses and chaining together legal arguments fighting to win the witness and influence the jury.
You can only play cards from your hand that share at least 1 symbol with the card previously in your Examination.  You can't jump from legal argument to an emotional one, because that would confuse the jury.
As you win witnesses, the jury will be swayed more and more to your side.  Each case can have slightly different win conditions, but in general whoever wins the most witnesses will have the jury on their side and win the case.
For the first time ever, Rock Manor Games has two deep thematic expansions already developed and available as part of this campaign!  Each expansion offers up new mechanics and win conditions - while staying true to the drafting and easy to learn card play of the core game.
Between February 1692 and May 1693 more than two hundred people were accused of being witches in colonial Massachusetts. This case takes a look at this infamous time in America's history, where mass hysteria is taking hold of the judicial system.
The Witch trial features over 80 unique illustrations by Abigail Larson whose art beautifully captures the time period.  The Witch Trial does away with the jury and is instead lead by an angry mob who is ready to hang anybody they believe is a witch. The goal of the Prosecution is to hang 3 witnesses as witches before they run out of cards.  The defense is scrambling to keep the mob under control and prevent a full blown witch hunt!
This case transports you back to Atlantic City in the 1920s where Carmine Monacelli is put on trial for conspiracy to violate the National Prohibition Act.  Carmine is accused of operating a network of criminals involved in bootlegging, murder, gambling and more - but he's a powerful man in AC so it's going to take more than some Federal Prohibition Agents to take down this Godfather. 
The Godfather expansion features over 80 unique illustrations by Nabetse Zitro and introduces a Dossier deck. As players win witnesses, they are able to reveal or discard the top card of the Dossier deck.  The prosecution needs to prove Carmine's Mafia connections by revealing these Dossier cards while avoiding the powerful criminal activities such as "Jury Tampering" and "Swim with the Fishes" that the defense has shuffled into the deck.  
While these expansions are planned for retail release, we plan on spreading out their release over a few months.  Kickstarter backers will get everything first! well before any of it enters retail and distribution.
 Tons more previews in the playlist below!
Retailers 
We love to work with retailers from all around the world. Brick and Mortar Retailers who back at our retailer pledge will receive an early demo copy of the Art Forgery case to promote Lawyer Up in their store.  The demo copy will be ordered shortly after the campaign ends and produced in the USA with the Game Crafter (most of the videos above feature such a prototype).  The shipping associated with this pledge is for the prototype only.  All orders for the actual game will be handled outside of Kickstarter.
Someone from Rock Manor Games will contact you after the Kickstarter to help you with your personalized order.  Retailers are NOT required to pay for their orders upfront, we simply invoice you for your order and ask that you pay the invoice before Kickstarter fulfillment commences (~6 months later).
If you're an online retailer or simply not interested in contributing on Kickstarter, signup as a retailer here. We will email you closer to our retail release so that you can get Lawyer Up into your store.
Group Pledges
We do not have a specific Pledge Level for Group Pledges and plan on handling this in our Pledge Manager.  If you have a group of friends and are looking to pledge for at least 6 copies of Lawyer Up, message us on our website at rockmanorgames.com/contact and select the Subject "Group Pledge".  You will need to make sure you pledge for at least 1 base game here on Kickstarter and then we will import you as a group pledge into the pledge manager after the campaign is completed.
When our pledge manager is sent out via email, you will be asked to fill in your address and you will be charged for shipping at that time.  You must fill out the pledge manager and pay for shipping to receive your reward.  We know that high shipping costs are the worst, so we are offering a $5 shipping discount to all of our Kickstarter Backers. Here are our estimated shipping costs for this project. Keep in mind these are just estimates based on our 2020 shipping rates and costs could change based on a variety of circumstances.
1: Lower 48 States
2: Canada, Hawaii and Alaska
3: Andorra, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Monaco, Norway, and Switzerland
 4: Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam 
 5: Rest of World does not include Afghanistan, Brazil, Bolivia, Iran, Iraq, Libya, Niger, North Korea, Russia, South Africa, Syria, Somalia, Yemen. 
We have key fulfillment partners in the US, Canada, Australia, China and the EU and will freight the games directly to them, so there will be no surprise charges, such as customs fees or VAT. We have typically shipped EU rewards from a German depot. For this campaign, it's possible we may ship UK rewards from within the UK if necessary We'll make this decision as we get closer to fulfillment, based on the fees/customs/taxes after Brexit has occurred.  If you have any specific shipping questions before pledging, please message us on Kickstarter.
About the Team
Game published by Rock Manor Games, owned and operated by Mike Gnade. Learn more at https://rockmanorgames.com or follow us on facebook, instagram, youtube or twitter.
Game Design by Samuel W. Bailey and Mike Gnade 
Game Development by Samuel W. Bailey and Mike Gnade 
Illustrations by Sean Simmons (Vimes art), Vincent Christiaens, Lacey James, Abigail Larson, Nabetse Zitro 
Cover Illustration by Matt Zeilinger 
Graphic Design by Joel Finch 
Marketing and Community Management by Matt Cangialosi
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are fortunate to have gone through the Kickstarter process many times before and have consistently delivered our games to backers before our estimated delivery date. We attribute a lot of this speed to getting all of the core artwork completed upfront and have done the same with this project. We pride ourselves on communicating with our backers and impressing them by meeting deadlines and delivering an excellent product. Check out our past Kickstarter projects for samples of our transparency, process, and products.

REFUND POLICY
All pledges can be refunded within the 2 week post-campaign window via Kickstarter, no questions asked. Any refund requests after the 2 week post-campaign window has elapsed will be refunded via Paypal minus Kickstarter and Credit Card fees. No refunds will be given after shipping labels have been batched and prepared in preparation for fulfillment. We may at our sole discretion provide you with credit in our web store equal to your pledge amount if we are contacted after fulfillment has begun.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

You are responsible for confirming your pledge, address and other information required to ship your reward to you in a timely manner. If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our invitation via email, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received.

You are responsible for following our updates and tracking your shipment. If you do not contact us within 6 months of our update announcing that reward fulfillment has been completed, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received.

When you confirm your pledge, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your reward as entered into our pledge management system and agree that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment. Furthermore, you agree that when shipping to countries other than those specifically listed as being “friendly” (above) you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information, and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.

If these terms are not acceptable to you, we suggest that you contact us before pledging and/or reconsider your participation in this campaign. Thank you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hallelujah! Check out the email I got this morning:

We are making progress on fulfillment, but it is definitely more painful and expensive than ever. I've done my best to categorize each region below with the info that I have at this moment.  I'm so glad that many of you are starting to receive and enjoy your games!   

Asia
Australia

I am thrilled to announce that fulfillment is officially starting and being coordinated by Funagain Logistics around the world! When the label for your package is generated, you should receive a tracking number from them or their partners. For any issues with shipping or addresses in the USA/CAN, AU or Asia, please contact help@funagainlogistics.com directly. UK/EU backers should contact GamesQuest. If for some reason, they cannot resolve your problem, then you can reach out to us.

Asia

I'm titling this update part 1 because I know we will have another update with more details in the next few weeks.  Games have been arriving at ports and there are a lot of emails out there waiting for responses and updates on coordinating everything.  I expect to receive direction from Funagain Logistics on fulfillment very soon.  Last week, games for the EU and USA both arrived at port.  Tracking things from Ocean Freight to Warehouse is a bit tricky.  Typically, we don't get specific details until games have cleared customs and been received and unloaded at the warehouse.  We haven't gotten any receiving reports so far, but expect to get them this week.
I'm happy to report that I have much better news for this month's update.  Our Watch it Played video should be going live on their channel later this week.  Here's a sneak peek:

I'm going to start the update with all the bad news.  
Progress Update
It's been a pretty frustrating month.  I attended a 2.5 hour UK VAT webinar and learned practically nothing.  In fact, all it reinforced was that no one knows what's going on.  So I'm just not going to stress about it and we will see what happens. UK backers don't need to worry about it either, since the most I'll do is ask for some pity donations if I get royally screwed. I've never had to wait so long and pay so much for Ocean Freight.  It reminds me how much I hate this phase of the project, because all I can do is send emails and get increasingly frustrated.  The only positive to all of this, is that I've spoken to other publishers and this is a universal problem - one that is rumored to start clearing up after Chinese New Year.  Needless to say, I have never seen these types of delays and inconsistencies in ocean freight before.  Fulfillment may be very disjointed across regions because of this:

updates.update_userinfo: January Update: BGG's Most Anticipated Games of 2021!
updates.update_content:
Welcome to 2021, everyone! We hope your new year was full of joy and games! 
BGG - Most Anticipated Games of 2021
For the past several years, there has been a "Most Anticipated" list curated by fans on BoardGameGeek. Nominations are closing any day now and Lawyer Up is hanging onto its nomination by a thread, so we'd love your nomination and vote (just hit the thumbs up):

With the holidays, things have been very crazy trying to coordinate everything.  We are currently trying to book containers and ocean freight and hope to have the games on the water very soon.  I will do my best to provide ship names and time frames when we get all the shipping lanes straightened out.  It is our goal to start fulfillment in late January but that is very dependent on booking ocean freight which is apparently very stressed at the moment because of the holidays and COVID.
Estimated Timetable

BREXIT / VAT reckoning for the UK
Let me start off with some very bad news for UK backers going forward.  I just received freight shipping quotes and importing in the UK is 10x more expensive than importing into the EU.  We're talking ~$25 per copy of the game big.  I thought it was a typo and they added an extra zero.  After talking to 2 different UK fulfillment partners, I have discovered that not only was the quote correct but it's the result of some BREXIT policy changes with VAT calculation that start January 2021.  TLDR your government requires us to prepay 20% VAT on the MSRP.  That leaves us in the predicament of either shipping everything from the EU (and having you deal with VAT/customs/import etc) or figuring out a way to invoice and collect the VAT fees for each UK backer and then shipping from within the UK.  I'm currently investigating ways to best handle this unfortunate reality.  I feel the best result would be to figure out a way to invoice everyone in the UK for the VAT based on their order so it can ship UK friendly, but we could also just ship from the EU and see how it goes (no one really knows with BREXIT looming).  I'm open to suggestions on the best way to handle it, please feel free to comment and discuss below.

Last week we received our preproduction samples.  There was only 1 mistake with the factory printing some outdated cards in the Godfather expansion. We had sent them updated cards in August and I believe they just printed the old production files and missed updating them. They assured me they will correct this for the production run.  Otherwise everything looked absolutely stellar.

campaign.story:
The  project is simple... I guess.  I started a few years ago with a MAKE 100 BIRDS YOU WILL NEVER SEE.. now it's the Amphibian's and Reptile's turn..
These are paintings of Amphibians and Reptiles  you and your family.. and future family will never get a chance to see again....   A lot of reasons can attribute to their Critical Endangered statues or Extinction.

Often, these Amphibians and Reptiles are the first animals to warn us.. and the first to be affected by environmental issues.
This project is more to remind folks of these lost little friends as well as to honor them.  Also to remind us humans, how fragile the environment really is... I hope you will enjoy each of these little guys and girls...and yes they have hats!

updates.update_userinfo: No 50!! The Hood Island Giant Tortoise
updates.update_content: A Classy  Hood Island Giant Tortoise.  He is here to celebrate no 50 in this series of Reptiles and Amphibians.   In 1970 only 13 of these tortoises were around.  Now after a lot of help there are more, but they are still Critically Endangered.
A Kleinman's Tortoise.  These little ones were once found in Egypt and Libya, but are close to extinction there because of habitat loss and the illegal pet trade.
A Handsome Big-Headed Turtle.  These turtles are from Southeast Asia and Sothern China.  The are on the Endangered list as they are being overhunted and used for food.

The Golden Coin Turtle.  These beautiful turtles from China and northern Vietnam are Critically Endangered.  They are farmed and used in folk medicine.  They are one of the most endangered turtle species in the world

A dapper Blanding's Turtle.
These Turtles are an endangered species in Central and Eastern parts of Canada and the United States.  They are victims of habitat loss and fragmentation as well as invasive species like the Red Eared Sliders.

campaign.story:
What would Thucydides have to say about the Afghanistan War?  
Hi, I am John Lemay. I recently retired from the United States Army.  I served two tours in Afghanistan and two in Iraq as an infantry officer.  I am frustrated by the poor outcomes of both those wars - in great part because we repeated the mistakes of Vietnam.  The Vietnam generation did a fantastic job of recording the lessons of that war in books; yet those books had little impact on Afghanistan and Iraq.  The purpose of this project is to transmit lessons from the war in Afghanistan to current and future generations through video. 
To accomplish this, I will read The History of The Peloponnesian War, written by Thucydides, and consider how it applies to the Afghanistan War.  The History of The Peloponnesian War is divided into eight books, and I will make one video for each book.  In each video I will orient the viewer to the text and then I will let Thucydides' narrative draw out my experiences in Afghanistan.  By considering my combat tours through the lens of The History of The Peloponnesian War I will highlight some lessons that are relevant for future conflicts.  Below is my video from Book One of The History of The Peloponnesian War: 
What do you receive for backing this project?
You receive a subscription to my videos in a course format on the Teachable platform.  The teachable platform will enable you to watch the videos, read and download my notes on your web browser or on a phone app.  As a backer, you will receive an exclusive video not available to the general public and I will list you in the credits.  You will also receive any stretch goals that are unlocked - see the stretch goal section below.  Please be aware that I will make the core videos and notes available for free to the general public on YouTube, my website, and Facebook because I want to educate as wide an audience as possible about the war.
Who was Thucydides?  
Thucydides was an Athenian General who fought in the Peloponnesian War, the great Greek conflict between Athens and Sparta that lasted twenty-seven years, from 431-404 BC.  He was defeated by Sparta and then exiled by Athens.  He wrote his military history of the war as it happened, taking advantage of his exile to throughly research events. Because of the rigor he applied to his research, many believe Thucydides, and not Herodotus, is the Father of History, or they refer to Thucydides as the Father of Scientific History.  He is considered one of the great military philosophers.  Check out this white board "explainer" video about Thucydides:  
Thucydides Testimonials
 Thomas Jefferson wrote to John Adams in 1812: "I have given up newspapers in exchange for Tacitus & Thucydides, for Newton & Euclid; & I find myself much the happier."  Reference.
General of the Army George C. Marshall said in 1947: "[I doubt] whether a man can think with full wisdom and with deep convictions regarding certain of the basic international issues today who has not at least reviewed in his mind the period of the Peloponnesian War and the Fall of Athens.”  Reference.   
Stretch Goals
 FUNDED!!! $250 (funding goal) = Nine Videos & Notes.  If the project is funded you will receive access to the course that you purchased on Teachable  (Thucydides Ponders Afghanistan or Sun Tzu Ponders Afghanistan).  I expect to release them in early August.  Each course will include nine video talks and pdf notes to accompany them.    
 FUNDED! $500 = Google Earth Flyovers.  The geography of the Peloponnesian War can be confusing for modern readers.  If we reach this funding level I will produce eight google earth flyovers to highlight the key locations.  The flyover videos and KMZ files will be available in Teachable.  Check out my effort below (which will be much improved with funds for professional help!): 
PLAY

FUNDED! $750 =  Maps.  If we reach $750, I will add nine maps to help clarify key parts of Thucydides' narrative.  These maps will be available in Teachable.
 FUNDED! $1,250 = Infographics.  At this funding level, I will add nine infographics to illustrate some of my takeaways from the Afghanistan War.  These infographics will be available in Teachable. 
 $2,500 =  Podcasts.  If we reach $2,500, I will have someone(s) interview me about my video and record the interview.  The audio files will be available in Teachable, and I will also let you know where to find them on podcast software.
 $4,000 = Video Transcription to Podcast.  At this funding level, I will have the audio from my video transcribed into a podcast.  The audio files will be available in Teachable, and I will also let you know where to find them on podcast software.
 $5,500 = White Board Videos.  At this funding level, I will add nine white board videos to help explain key concepts from The Peloponnesian War or my lessons from Afghanistan.  These videos will be included in the Teachable course.  Below is an example that I made myself where I discuss a lesson from the Iraq War drawn out by Sun Tzu's The Art of War.
About John Lemay
I recently retired after serving 25 years and 7 months in the United States Army.  My career began at West Point and upon graduation I became an infantry officer.  I did two tours in Afghanistan and two tours in Iraq.  During my career I earned a masters of Peace Operations from George Mason University and a masters of Military Arts and Science from the Army’s School of Advanced Military Studies.  Now I am writing in my basement war room.

You can watch those videos at www.thebasementwarroom.com. The main risk is that I am a one-man show. If anything unforeseen happens to me, the project could be delayed.

updates.update_content:
Team,
One of the United States Army's focuses during the Afghanistan War was to create, and latter "train, advise and assist" the Afghan National Army.  The doctrinal word for this activity is "Security Force Assistance."  Security Force Assistance is not a new concept - the Spartans practiced it brilliantly when Athens invaded Sicily.  The Athenians sent a huge expeditionary force to conquer the island.  The Spartans responded by sending a very small force to rally the Sicilians against their invaders.  The result - the complete destruction of the Athenian Expeditionary Force - changed the course of the Peloponnesian War, eventually resulting in Sparta' victory.  However, Sparta practiced "Security Force Assistance" very differently in Sicily than the United States did in Afghanistan.  The draft infographic below by Luis highlights some of the differences.

updates.update_userinfo: Remembering a Fallen Service Member on Memorial Day
updates.update_content:
Team,

When I was young, and even a young Soldier, Memorial Day was all about statistics.  For example, someone might say “Remember: 291, 557 American service members died in World War II to secure our freedom.” This changed dramatically during the Afghanistan and Iraq Wars because people I knew died. Now I remember those individuals specifically, take time to pray for their families and talk to my kids about them by name.

Team,
Here is a draft infographic in the same format as the "Spartan Strategy in the Peloponnesian War" one.  However, the United States' strategy in Afghanistan is much harder to discern than simply reading the King of Sparta's speech as recorded by Thucydides.  But I believe that President Bush's speech on April 17, 2002 at the Virginia Military Institute (VMI) illustrates the basic US strategy for the following 19 years.  At that point US operations in Afghanistan had transitioned from CIA / Special Forces "unconventional warfare" to conventional warfare.  President Bush then made a speech at VMI, where George C. Marshall graduated from, on the occasion of awarding the George C. Marshall Award to ROTC Cadets, and then went on to compare the US occupation of Afghanistan with the post World War 2 Marshal Plan for Europe.  The US strategy was to prevent terrorists from using Afghanistan as a base for operations by creating a new Afghan government that was a Republic allied to the United States and equipping it with a military capable of controlling Afghanistan's territory.   To accomplish this the United States would implement a "Marshal Plan for Afghanistan".

Team,

Thank you for the feedback!  Here is the updated Spartan Strategy Infographic.  I believe it is easier to read but has enough information to address a complex topic.  One major change was replacing the background map of Afghanistan with one of Attica - much more topical for this infographic.   Now Luis is working on a similar graphic - but for the United States Strategy in Afghanistan.

Team,
Here is the Peloponnese, David's last map.  The call out is the Island of Sphacteria where the Spartan contingent surrendered.  
Thucydides wrote "Nothing that happened in the war surprised the Hellenes so much as this. It was the opinion that no force or famine could make the Lacedaemonians give up their arms, but that they would fight on as they could, and die with them in their hands: indeed people could scarcely believe that those who had surrendered were of the same stuff as the fallen; and an Athenian ally, who some time after insultingly asked one of the prisoners from the island if those that had fallen were men of honour, received for answer that the atraktos—that is, the arrow—would be worth a great deal if it could tell men of honour from the rest; in allusion to the fact that the killed were those whom the stones and the arrows happened to hit." - Crawley, Chapter 12.

Team,
What do you think of this infographic?  Luis, the artist, thinks it is too crowded.  I'm reluctant to par down the words.
Thucydides goes beyond a dry recording of historical facts in his narrative by adding speeches from the key players.  As the Peloponnesian War begins Archidamus, King of Sparta, and Pericles, an Athenian Leader, both give speeches outlying war strategies.  However, Pericles dies early in the war and the Athenians largely abandon his, or any coherent, strategy.  The Spartans have significant problems in execution, but despite numerous tactical and operational defeats, they stick to their strategy.

Team,
Below is another fantastic map by David - The Chalcidice, Thrace and The Helespont.  Spartan strategy required two elements - controlling Attica with land forces and then controlling the Aegean Sea.  Sparta had the army to control Attica from the start of the war but it took them 27 years to achieve naval superiority in the Aegean.  In addition to building their own navy, they had to weaken Athens' navy.  There were two ways of doing this - the first was by winning naval battles.  But before the Athenian disaster in Sicily it was almost impossible for Sparta to defeat Athens at sea.  The second was by freeing Greek Cities from the Athenian Empire.  The Athenian Navy was enormously expensive and required the tribute of many Greek Cities to maintain.  It could be attritted by slowly depriving Athens of tribute.

Team,
Here is the first Thucydides Infographic by Luis!  Thucydides theorized that states go to war due to fear, honor and interest.  He argues that all the machinations between Corinth, Corcyra and Athens which proceeded Sparta's declaration of war on Athens was just pretext, and that the real reason Sparta declared war was fear of the growing power of Athen's Empire.

Team,

Here is a geographic orientation to the alleged grounds of the Peloponnesian War.  Thucydides believed this was all pretext and and that the real reason for war was Sparta's fear of Athen's growing power.  Today many refer to this as the "Thucydides' Trap" and argue that the United States' fear of China will inevitably lead to war.  However, I think the specifics matter.  Sparta voted for war after Athens, which had an eastern facing empire that dominated the Aegean Sea, moved westward into the Ionian Sea.  The equivalent would be China dominating the Pacific Ocean (which it does not, we have China boxed into the South China Sea and dominate the Pacific) and then moving into the Atlantic Ocean and threatening to cut sea lines of communication with Europe.

Team,
Here is the current draft of David's most recent map:  Attica.  The Spartans were able to dominate it by land, although they were never even tried to assault Athen's walls.  Athens dominated the coast and sea surrounding Attica.  Not shown on the map are the "long walls" that connected Athens to Piraeus.  Piraeus was Athen's port town and the Athenian Navy's home port.  Supplies, including critical grain, flowed into Piraeus and was delivered to Athens via a fortified route known as the "long walls".

campaign.story:
Update  - April 6:
Due to the success of the campaign, the limited edition version of the deck has very low availability, so we are making the standard edition deck available as a reward and as an add-on. 
The standard edition will have the same cards inside but black ink on the tuck case and the seals will not be individually numbered.  You can add-on a standard edition deck to any pledge for $9 (includes shipping.) Limited edition decks are no longer available for add-on, but once we have an accurate account you still may be able to add-on one prior to fulfillment.
All the rewards with standard decks will have "standard" in the reward title. If it does not, the limited edition deck(s) will be included in that reward selection.
Standard Edition of the Deck
***
Introducing a precisely digitally hand-recreated reproduction of the first published complete transformation playing card deck in the world! The blue "Joan of Arc" deck is the first in a series of six famous decks we plan to release in 2020...  
The very first transformation deck issued by Cotta is from 1805. This deck is probably the most famous of all six, and is incredibly scarce. Original illustrations were fiddling artworks done by hand, on copper plates that were manually engraved with stipple and etching, and the cards were printed on linen period stock that was 97 mm x 69 mm in size, with blank card backs and squared corners at that time. Only the court cards were hand-colored, while the number cards used red stencils.
Cotta’s transformation cards were very successful and became a role model for later transformation decks from other publishers. And since the card backs were blank, individual cards were sometimes used by the nobility as visit cards and for leaving messages, so these playing cards often became multi-purpose items.
There are many historical values in the series of decks! But if you are only interested in the deck details & images instead of history & backstory, then please skip about half way down.
 The story behind these playing cards, which probably conceal the most of the world's playing card secrets, begins in Tübingen, a city in southwest Germany.
The atmosphere here is bursting with memories and experiences of the past. Visitors today can still enjoy the small stairs, narrow alleys, and pointed gables that shape the silhouette of old Tübingen on the way to its famous castle. Tübingen is home to one of Europe’s oldest universities and even today combines the colorful bustle of an university town full of students with the flair of a restored medieval center and a touch of many ancient cultures. The Romans already left some traces of their presence here in AD 85, but the city itself dates from the 6th or 7th century. Little wonder that this city attracted many eminent notables and artists, who found it inspirational for their work. 
 The idea behind the concept of Cotta's transformation decks was to create a series of six decks on an annual basis from 1805-1811. Each deck would focus on a different theme, with the first set based on Schiller's play Jeanne d'Arc, which was about the famous historical figure Joan of Arc. 
Forming a "Card Almanac" (Karten Almanach), each card in the deck would represent one of the 52 weeks in a calendar year. At the time it was popular to print various almanacs, which were special pocket books for the new year, and often included a short poem or quote for each week of the calendar year. It was a logical move to connect each of these 52 weeks with a playing cards.
Johann Friedrich Cotta (*April 27, 1764 - December 29, 1832), publisher, industrial pioneer, and politician, the man at the helm of family publishing house J. G. Cotta (founded yet in late 17th century by his grandfather Johann Georg Cotta *1631 - 1692) from Tübingen, Germany, around 1804 went on to produce a series of six playing card almanacs in successive years from 1805-1811, with a new deck appearing in all but one of those years. 
In addition to Johann Friedrich Cotta's high standing as a publisher, he was a man of great practical energy, which flowed into various fields of activity, he promoted even many reforms and supported talented individuals. It is also noticeable that in such period of his life he published numerous works of his own literature, political materials, and also yearbooks.
Cotta did have the goal of replacing the "inelegant" designs of contemporary German playing cards with a more artistic high-quality deck. But these playing cards were not intended for playing games with in the first place, but rather for stimulating discussion about the "themed" images on each of the cards. Each year the court cards were designed to represent another theme, while the number cards featured pictures that were largely independent drawings without a common topic, since they were especially intended as conversation pieces and depicted happenings.
The Cotta's famous house was the place, where among other brilliant German authors of the time, the works of Schiller and later of Goethe were published there in its journal pages, as well as journal's major contributor was Heinrich Heine, who with his early lyric poetry has inspired even composers such as Robert Schumann and Franz Schubert who set his works into music... 
So the picture that emerges from this time in Cotta's life is that he was constantly engaged in thoughtful conversation with literary men, and enjoyed close friendships with leading figures of the day like Schiller, Huber, Gottlieb Konrad Pfeffel, and others, many of whose works he published.
Johann Friedrich Cotta's long term friendship with the famous German poet, dramatist, philosopher, and historian Friedrich Schiller was well known. In 1795 Schiller and Cotta founded the Horen, a periodical that became important for students of German literature. Schiller's goal was to use his work to infuse higher ideas into the common lives of men, by giving them a nobler human culture, and “to reunite the divided political world under the banner of truth and beauty.” It was as a result of this relationship that Goethe became part of a close circle of friends with Cotta and Schiller. Even today there is evidence at Cotta's house of Goethe having slept there. 
It is probably this friendship that gave birth to the idea of creating a unique decks of transformation playing cards with the purposes of igniting discussion about the "themed" picture on each card. This was after all a time when people were open to such ideas, and producing a series of playing cards as almanacs for a continuous period of years was a natural development.
With help from you the backers we plan to produce the entire 6 deck series! The color of each tuck box created by Azured Ox has been inspired by Goethe's experimental optic and color theory, since Goethe was an important contemporary of Cotta, along with Schiller. (Goethe's deepest immersion into colors was during Cotta's decks issuing.)
Limited Edition Decks
Standard Edition Decks
Goethe’s spent years on his theory (built on wavelength theory of light broken into 7 colors demonstration after Newton), which became a personal obsession in his last years, and which he considered more important than his literary works.
Goethe believed that colors arise from the interaction between light and darkness, light and dark edges along the spectrum; that colors are realities, phenomena of nature... His color theory was intended to be a paradigmatic model for natural science in general, and Goethe was concerned with the psychological effects of each color, as well.
He believed that colors symbolize different values and that colors have a clear effect on the mind and feelings. Goethe had little use for concepts of divinity or for systematic thinking. His theory formulated a psychological and philosophical account of the way we actually experience color as a phenomenon.
Much of historical happenings, influences and activities would later find a place in the Cotta decks, including events in the life of Cotta's own family and of notable figures like Schiller and Goethe. Other important influences include the literature, art, history, politics (e.g. Napoleon's invasion), and religious reforms of the time, which all served as an important context to shape the art in the decks themselves. 
For example, Schiller experienced a grave illness that led to his death, and this around as well as many more is even depicted in the playing cards from the Cotta decks. In short, there is significant evidence of such connections between the artistic pictures and the immediate context that produced them.
It is especially significant for the way it displays meaningful and inspirational happenings from the time; in this first deck, such as Schiller on his death-bed (Six of Clubs) or sadness of Goethe (probably depicted on Nine of Clubs), assumed depictions from life of noble families, etc...
 First almanac deck: Jeanne d'Arc (Year 1805) 
The images on the court cards are characters inspired by Schiller's play "Die Jungfrau von Orleans" ("Joan of Arc"). 
The central figure of Joan of Arc is depicted as the Queen of Spades, the Maid of Orleans who inspired the French army to victory, but was later burned at the stake.
Features:
Printed by USPCC on Classic Stock
Poker Size
Embossed Finish
52 Cards + 2 Extra Jokers + 2 Extra Collectible Cards
Metallic Ink On Box & Backs
Custom Numbered Seals
Puzzle Image on all Tuck Spines of the Series
Digitally Hand-Recreated and Designed by Azured Ox
 Produced By Will Roya 
Cotta's first deck was designed by Countess Mary Day von Jennison-Walworth (sometimes spelled with a single `n'). Her maiden name was Beauclerk, and she was the wife of Count Francis Jenison Walworth (1764–1824). She was an illegitimate (twin) child who led a very colorful life, and finally settled down somewhat after marrying Count Francis in 1797. (Probably, she was creating illustrations in Stuttgart.)
We are limiting this 1st deck to only 1,000 copies with numbered seals. We may print a small amount additional decks without seals to meet demand or for a special edition. 
The entire 6 deck series is in many ways designed by Azured Ox to meet collector's demand (as "collection of historical books") and will be produced with the piece of puzzle image on each tuck spine (left side of box) to create together nice display of the Tuebingen monument surroundings, where the idea for Cotta's decks was born. 
The publisher's name was placed on the Ace of Clubs as follows: "A Tubinge chez J. G. Cotta, Libraire."
The transformations on the number cards have no reference to each other or to the court cards (as well lots of them might be considered as unexplained mystery).
The court cards were designated with the words "Valet", "Dame", and "Roi", which are the French terms corresponding to the Jack, Queen, and King.
In the first deck, beside Joan of Arc depicted as the Queen of Spades, other individuals closely associated with Joan include Etienne de Vignolles or La Hire (Jack of Hearts), who helped Joan to victory in the battle of Patay in 1429; and Raymond (Jack of Diamonds), a peasant who was Joan's page.
Key political leaders who figured prominently in the events surrounding Joan's life are also represented, including King Charles VII (King of Hearts), the French monarch who relied on Joan's help to reach the Rhiems, the traditional place of coronation; Charles' mother Isabeau (Queen of Hearts), who was in league with Charles' enemy; Charles' mistress Agnes Sorel (Queen of Diamonds); Charles' opponent Philippe the Good (King of Diamonds), an ally of England; and the king of Naples, René d'Anjou (King of Clubs), who lost the kingdom after defeat in battle. General Talbot (King of Spades) was the English commander of the outpost of Orleans at Saint Loup, who was wounded in battle, captured, and was part of a prisoner exchange.
Both Joan's "sister" Louison (Queen of Clubs) and Montgomery (Jack of Clubs) are fictional creations of Schiller, while the fictional Lionel (Jack of Spades) is the character who holds up Joan's sword in a location revealed by the voices that she supposedly heard telling her to help.
 Clubs: Montgomery, Louison (Joan's fictional sister), René d'Anjou (King of Sicily) 
Diamonds: Raimond (villager), Agnes Sorel (Charles' mistress), Philippe de Bourgogne 
Hearts: Etienne de Vignolles (La Hire), Isabeau de Baviere (Charles' mother), Charles VII (King of France) 
Spades: Lionel (knight), Joan of Arc, Talbot
At last we came with an idea to reflect opposite of noble life and to bring closer to you even more of the unique artistic history placed on extra collectible playing cards...
Also we thought it could be interesting to put another illustrations from the far past on the additional extra cards, in respect to year almanacs, we came with an idea of twelve calendar months in the series as exclusive collection of unique historical artworks...
An absolutely original playing card masterpiece to hang on your wall (double sided)
 New Standard Deck Rewards
 Please note: Limited edition decks are no longer available for add-on. After the campaign, when I have a more accurate count, some may be available to add-on prior to fulfillment.
 The end of funding period for this first "blue" deck of the series is symbolically set to:
 Johann Friedrich Cotta's 
 (256th) Birthday on April 27, 2020 
As of the launch of this campaign we have already submitted art to USPCC to prepare for print.  USPCC recently reported a 10 day shut down because of the COVID-19 outbreak but we are confident we can deliver this project by the end of July if they are not shut down for more then 30 days. If we do have a delay it will be  communicated with backers in a speedy and transparent manner.
 We have already put a significant amount of resources in making this deck possible. But if we can pass 20k in funding we will include something special for every backer or upgrade the deck in some way.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Artwork has been pre-approved by USPCC. Some small design elements may be subject to change based on backer feedback and printer recommendations.

Besides being a super backer, I have successfully completed and delivered several of my own campaigns as well as helping & collaborating with other creators.

I really enjoy the process of creating decks with the artists and working with backers to bring the decks to life. I am in a fortunate situation to be able to cover some of the costs of producing the decks but without the help of the Kickstarter community I would not be able to bring all of my projects to life. Creating these decks is a significant investment of time and money and I am grateful for any and all support.

If there are delays or issues they will be communicated and dealt with in an open manner. As always, I appreciate any feedback. You are welcome to reach out to me directly at any time and I will do my best to get back to you in a timely manner.

Back this project with confidence!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
