campaign.story:
This project is simple. Let’s make big, fine-quality porcelain bowls festooned with oodles of robots.
Get it? A big serving bowl decorated with a big crowd...for when you are entertaining a big crowd.
Who needs a deep porcelain bowl loaded with robots?
Top quality. A true work of art. Like the previous Calamityware dinner plates, this platter is fine porcelain produced at the award-winning Kristoff workshop in Poland using the in-glaze technique. Final production will feature white porcelain with a rich blue image. Food safe, microwave safe, and dishwasher safe.
A close look reveals scads of robots and some other surprises.
In-glaze porcelain is fired at extra-high temperatures to allow the image to melt slightly into the surface. Connoisseurs will appreciate the beauty of the in-glaze technique which the artists at Kristoff have been refining since 1831. This is the look of porcelain you see in museums. Sweet.
With in-glaze production, sharp, detailed decorations are permanently fused into the surface.
Oodles of Robots Bowl is bigger than previous Calamityware plates and bowls.
The Oodles of Robots Bowl measures 12" (30 cm) in diameter. Big enough for duty as a serving bowl or extremely generous individual bowl. The bowl will hold 2 cups of liquid (16 oz, 500 mL) with room to spare. Stuff like mashed potatoes, veggies, or pasta can be piled high. 
Ideal as a serving bowl when you have lots of hungry robots to dinner.
Caring for porcelain is easy. How much pampering you give your porcelain should depend on how long you want it to last. I wrote a blog post that offers practical advice about living with porcelain. Read it and follow the advice if you want to keep your porcelain pristine.
When can I expect my reward? Assuming nothing calamitous happens, you should be dining with the robot gang by the end of November 2019.
Robots galore—on rim, in center, and even some on the back.
Free shipping in the U.S.
International shipping. Oodles of Robots Bowls can ship anywhere in the world. Orders outside the U.S. have a postage charge that varies depending on where the package is going. We apply the amount we budget for U.S. shipping to reduce how much you pay for international shipments, but it is still expensive. Porcelain is heavy, so postage costs are shockingly high. But for a treasured heirloom that may last generations, perhaps you can justify the expense.
Read this if you are outside the U.S. In some countries, customs duties may be applied to porcelain shipments. I have no way of predicting if they’ll apply to your shipment. Customs inspections are very arbitrary and willy-nilly. Most packages sail through without any duty, but some are selected by chance and the recipient gets hit with a duty fee. So if you can’t tolerate the risk that your shipment might get selected for extra costs, you should probably not support this project. Or arrange to have your reward shipped to a friend in the U.S. who can bring you your porcelain in their luggage next trip.
We’ll be using the U.S. Postal Service for these shipments because that seems to minimize the number of packages that get hit with customs fees, and there are no extra broker fees added. 
Pay attention. If you are an international sponsor and receive a tracking number when we ship, track your package daily to make sure it doesn’t get hung up in the system and returned to us. Don’t just assume it will show up. Shipments have a way of getting stalled, and monitoring the status of the tracking number allows you to intervene promptly.
********
Big enough to share doesn’t mean you must share.
Project updates. Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds but not so often that I’ll feel like a pest. You can also receive a trickle of news about designing, producing, and enjoying Calamityware plates (and the other projects Don is working on) by joining the email list at Calamityware.com.
Questions? Send me your questions and I’ll add them and the answers to the FAQ section of this page.
More than 40 Kickstarter projects have sprung from the drawings in my sketchbooks.
Previous projects. If you missed my previous Kickstarter projects, you’ll find leftovers from all my previous projects at Calamityware.com. While supplies last. Not just porcelain—there are some other unusual products there, too, that began as Kickstarter-Don projects.
Want to see more of Don’s drawings? I post a new drawing of something almost every day on Flickr. You can see my preliminary Calamityware sketches and drawings in this Flickr album.
Don
Pittsburgh, August 11, 2019
Load them up. These bowls are ready for the big time.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Countless things could go wrong to delay this project. But the design is done and the pre-production proofs have been approved. So if I get enough sponsors, I will green-light production right away.

I’m using a workshop that produces porcelain for monarchs and potentates and has perfected production techniques over 180 years. So technical problems are unlikely. (The greatest danger is that our project might get bumped by some other order for an omnipotent potentate.)

If you have supported my previous Kickstarter projects, you know I always come through. Frequently, I complete my projects ahead of schedule. In any case, you’ll get updates so you know what’s going on.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Für die deutsche Version, klick hier  //  Para la versión en Español, haz click aquí
Fifty years ago, on July 20th, 1969, the entire world held its breath. Five decades later, man's most outstanding milestone continues to thrill us as if it had happened yesterday. Apart from loving flip books, we are passionate space enthusiasts, and this enormous achievement has always been an inspiration to us, so we thought it would be amazing to create the ultimate flip book edition on the Apollo 11 journey, to mark the 50th anniversary of this event in history.  
The first volume of the Apollo 11 Flip Book Edition is based on original footage from the NASA archives, shot during the different stages of the mission. It wasn't easy  to decide which sequences should go into the flip book, since there’s really a lot of incredible material available, but after some back and forth, we chose 6 sequences that reflect the most significant maneuvers of the Apollo 11 mission. Some of the sequences are edited  in multicam shots to show the action synchronized from different angles. You’ll find 3 sequences on each side of the book.


After testing the first prototypes, we were fairly satisfied with the result, however we still missed  some of the most important events that took place. What about those crucial moments that helped to make this journey a success, but couldn’t be filmed because they happened out there in space? We wanted to create a flip book that not only tells this story, but also really makes you understand what happened out there. That’s how Volume 2 came up. 
Luckily, as we have our own flip book and animation studio, the solution was not too far away: during our research we learned about the original concept art, created by NASA artists in 1966 to explain the main stages of the mission to the broader public, so we decided to select the illustrations of the stages we were missing and turn them into animations. 

As a result, Vol 2 has 6 more sequences depicting the moon landing from a more technical and informative point of view, whilst maintaining an artistic approach through the handmade paintings. They are some of the most important maneuvers performed by the astronauts, such as the stage separations and docking procedures and the lunar orbit insertion of the CSM-LM module. Here they are in detail:
Concept art created by NASA artists in 1966 to help the public understand the principal stages of the mission
Both flip books are intended to complement each other, so if you switch between the real footage and the animated sequences, together they become a powerful educational tool that explains the whole process of the Apollo journey.

Because we like challenges and really want to take flip books to the next level, we decided to add an interactive component to the edition. That’s why we added an exclusive Augmented Reality feature to the flip book edition that gives you more insight into the three main spacecrafts used by the astronauts to accomplish this remarkable mission.
Each of the flip books includes a different 3D model that can be displayed on your mobile device right above the flip book. On Vol. 1 you'll see the powerful Saturn V rocket, on Volume 2 the Command and Service Module docked together with the Lunar Module and when both flip books are packed together in the Anniversary Edition slipcase (Flip Book Set), you can see a real-time 3D animation of the last exciting moments of “The Eagle” before it touches the surface of the moon - well actually before it touches the surface of the flip book. :)  
Each of these 3D models will incorporate extra detailed information about the technical specifications of each spacecraft, combining videos and additional text. This way, you can not only engage with your Apollo 11 Flip Book, but most importantly, you can learn more about the mission and the vehicles the astronauts used throughout their journey.  
For the development of the AR content we work hand in hand with our friends from the British studio Seymour & Lehrn, specialized in creating AR and VR content for virtual experiences. With their help, we will develop our own Flipboku Apollo 11 AR app, which you can easily download for IOS and Android.  
Those of you familiar with our last flip book project Molecularis, may already have an idea about how the magic works. If you observe the flip book in closer detail, you will notice that the edges are cut in a specific way, so that you can swap between the different sequences. This is the key to the optical illusion that gives the Apollo 11 Flip Book its unique feature of showing you six different animations, one after another - you'll have a blast watching people's faces when they see the flip book for the first time and try to understand how it works! :D 
And here's the secret: it all depends on the position of your thumb. You can switch between the sequences by placing your thumb either in the upper corner, the center or the lower corner of the front edge of the book. 
As there are 3 sequences on each side of the book, the images are arranged alternately. This means that you will have sequences 1, 2 and 3 on the A-side and 4, 5 and 6 on the B-side of the book, when you turn it around. This works the same for both flip books, resulting in a total of 12 different sequences. 
With the aim of providing you with maximum enjoyment of the whole epic Apollo experience, we have developed a complementary educational tool for those of you wanting to gain additional insight, not only about the Apollo 11, but about the entire Apollo Program. 
Who were the astronauts, which spacecraft did they use, and which experiments did they perform during the different lunar explorations? To answer these questions, we created a deck of 70 neatly designed Commemorative Cards, representing three different categories: 32 astronauts of all the Apollo missions, 18 of the science experiments set up by the astronauts at the landing site of each of the five Apollo missions to land on the moon, and 20 cards showing the vehicles and hardware that brought them there – and back to earth. 
Each of the illustrated cards includes basic information of the displayed subject, and also includes a QR code that takes you to the specific page on Wikipedia where you can find out even more about each of the many components of the Apollo Program. 
You can also combine the cards into different groups by joining all the astronauts of a specific mission as well as their scientific experiments and vehicles, or turn it into a question-and-answer game and not only learn from it, but have a lot of fun with your friends and family.

We couldn't help but include a little flip book feature in the card deck! If you hold all the cards in the correct order, you will be able to see a 360º animation of the Lunar Module while flipping the cards with your thumb. :D 

For all those passionate space lovers out there who want the full experience, we’ve created an exclusive bundle with 250 units available only for our Kickstarter backers. This one of a kind Limited Edition tier includes a real fragment of mission-flown Kapton Foil that protected the Columbia Command Module during its re-entry to Earth. 
This unique piece is preserved in a small commemorative acrylic container that comes individually numbered and with your name on it. A unique collector's item for those who want to hold a real piece of human history in their hands. 
The Limited Edition Foil Bundle will come in a sleek packaging that we’ve created especially for the occasion, along with the Apollo 11 Flip Book Set (which comes with all three 3D AR models) and the Apollo 11 Commemorative Cards. The limited edition includes a Certificate of Authenticity with additional information on the origin and traceability of the foil. 
We are passionate about great packaging, which is why all our flip books come in their own sleek slip case which not only looks attractive, but also protects them from wear and tear. 
Furthermore, the Apollo 11 Anniversary Edition (Flip Book Set) has a double slip case with a stunning  gold embossing we’ve created for this special occasion,  so that you can keep both flip books together.
We only use environmentally-friendly materials, such as acid-free sustainable forest paper. All materials are from local providers to keep our project as sustainable as possible (this means European materials for us). We have chosen a semi-gloss coated paper with the perfect thickness and elasticity so that the pages slide smoothly when you flip them with your thumb. 
Every single Apollo 11 Flip Book is largely hand-produced and the whole process requires a number of steps that rely on careful supervision, which is why the entire production process will be carried out in our very own printing studio in Mallorca, Spain. Our experienced printing technicians will take care of the complex manufacturing process which requires absolute precision to ensure that the sequences perform perfectly.  Here you can see a small making-of video of the Apollo 11 prototypes:

Vol. 1 and Vol. 2 are two separate flip books in their own right but they complement each other beautifully. When combined, the real footage and the animated sequences provide extraodinary insight into the entire Apollo 11 mission.
You can choose between the following combinations: 



As the campaign's rockets gain height, we have created a series of stretch goals that we will include for all our backers once we reach certain marks. 
65K EUR! We will design a Digital Pack that includes 3 items: a gorgeous Infographic with background information about the Apollo program, plus 2 Commemorative Posters: Mission Events, with the full explanatory illustrations made by NASA, including the most relevant stages of the entire mission, and the Commemorative poster for all the 6 landed Apollo missions. These files will be sent to all backers as soon as they receive their surveys and can be downloaded in high quality, in order to be printed in large format or used as desired. 
85K EUR! As a second stretch goal, all of you will receive a Set of 6 fabulous Apollo Stickers. It will include the original Apollo 11 patch, a lunar map with all the Apollo landing sites, the Lunar Module based on original NASA artwork, Lunar Orbit Rendevouz, Buzz Footprint and Translunar Injection. Here is a sneak peek at some of the designs:
Despite their small size, a great deal of work goes into the design and development of  a flip book like Apollo 11. We have spent months on the design board, illustrating, animating and collaborating closely with our printing technicians, cutting, binding and testing to achieve this result. Since the Apollo Flip Book has almost twice the number of pages as any other Flip Book we've made so far, we had to find a new technique to get the magic trick to work perfectly. 
Printing projects such as this one are only cost effective if you reach a certain quantity threshold, which is why we need your help to complete the final step – to finally bring the flip book to life and get it into the printers.
The funds will also be used to develop the AR feature, in collaboration with the British studio Seymour and Lerhn.
Flipboku is the brainchild of animator and designer Jossie Malis and music composer Julie Reier. Besides loving animation and flip books, we're also huge space enthusiasts, so we are thrilled at the idea of creating something unique for the 50th anniversary of this memorable achievement. With Flipboku, we want to bring flip books to the next level and create unique editions, that are not only fun, but also useful either in a creative, artistic or educational way.
Since our last project Molecularis, the Flipboku team has grown and now consists of 6 members, all working in our design and printing studio Boku Lab. The team is completed with the invaluable hands of illustrator and graphic designer Noemi Aiolo, and the 3 members of our irreplaceable printing crew Gustavo Berdayes, Tomás Pons and José Ramón Pineda, who are responsible for the development of the prototypes and for leading the entire production process. 
We are extremely grateful for your support and would love to welcome you on board!
We would especially like to thank NASA video librarian Sheva Moore for her support through the incredible film archive and Bert Ulrich from the NASA multimedia and content department, to Andy Bernstein for his support with the video narration and Victoria Amengual for her help with the writing.  Also special thanks to our webmaster Israel and our dearest Angel, Mireia, Anselm, Marcos, Raquel, Angel, Nuria, Naru, Yui, Yuko, Nadal and Alejandro for their participation in our video. 
 This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped 5,000+ creators make their projects a reality, raising over $250MM through crowdfunding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
During our last project we learnt the hard way that you can never be prepared enough when it comes to producing something that has never been done before. No matter how well prepared you are, you will always have to reckon with unexpected situations as long as you are dependent on third-party providers. For this reason and because we not only want to give ourselves, but all our backers the certainty that everything will run smoothly, we’ve set up our own printing workshop, where 100% of all the production steps are carried out. Our experienced printing technicians will personally take care of the production process to ensure that production is executed to perfection, so that all our backers receive a product of the highest possible quality and as quickly as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear backers!
This is a brief reminder to let you know that our latest campaign "The Pioneers - A Cinemagic Flip Book Collection" is 24 hours away from ending. If you have not seen it yet, we invite you to discover it here.
As always, it would be a great honor to count on your support! ❤️

Dear Apollo backers!
We have just launched our new Kickstarter campaign The Pioneers - A Cinemagic Flip Book Collection!
This time, we want to take you to the magical world of film, namely to the very first beginnings of cinema. We want to introduce you to the work of 10 outstanding pioneers who paved the way to what would later become one of the greatest cultural revolutions of our time.

Hello friends!
We want to celebrate the exciting Starship launch with you, so we have made a flip book for the occasion! Actually, the idea came to us in the middle of the night after watching the successful flight and landing (and explosive ending) here in Spain, so we are excited that we were able to make it within less then one day, in hyper speed :). In our survey during the Apollo campaign, many of you have asked for a SpaceX flip book, and because we appreciate your continued support, you are the first to know. Here it is:

Dear backers,
This is a brief reminder to let you know that our latest campaign "Do You Realize How Much?" is 24 hours away from ending. If you have not seen it yet, we invite you to discover it here.  As always, it would be a great honor to count on your support!

updates.update_userinfo: New campaign release and Apollo Foil winner!
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
We hope you are all well and enjoying your weekend!
We are finally back to announce the winner of our Apollo 11 Limited Edition Foil Bundle! Many of you have written lovely reviews for our Amazon page and although not all of them got accepted by Amazon (they allow only a limited number of non-verified purchase reviews) we have received them all and can use them for our website or other places. A huge thank you to everyone!

updates.update_userinfo: Win a Limited Edition Foil Bundle!
updates.update_content:
Hello dear backers, Happy Anniversary!
Last week one year ago, our campaign was successfully funded thanks to all your incredible help. Thank you again! We sincerely hope that you and your loved ones are all well and healthy and that you can keep your spirits up in spite of the complicated global situation.
Flipboku continues its flipping journey and although our sales and distribution channels have been severely affected, we have managed to collaborate with several distributors and resellers around the world, such as in Japan, Taiwan, Switzerland, Germany and some other countries that are already selling our flipbooks to their customers. However, in order to weather the storm and ensure that our publishing project can persist, we need to improve our online sales channel and since we know that you are our loyal supporters we would like to ask you for a little favor.

Dear backers,
Our new Kickstarter campaign DOTS & LINES - A BRAIN BOOSTING PUZZLE FLIP BOOK ends tomorrow, so this is your last chance to join us there!
To all our loyal supporters who have already stopped by, THANK YOU SO MUCH! We hope you will enjoy Dots & Lines as much as the Apollo 11 Flip Book :).

Dear backers,
We hope you've all had some lovely holidays and a great start into 2020; may this year bring new happiness, new goals, new achievements and a lot of new inspirations on your life!
All Apollo 11 Flip Books have been shipped by now and we have received so much incredible feedback from you guys, thank you!! We are both proud and gratified that this campaign has gone so well and that we could make so many people happy with their Apollo 11 Flip Books and extras, but the best thing is that thanks to all our loyal supporters we are able to realize our dream of having our own flip book publishing house, which is a wonderful experience.

campaign.story:
This Kickstarter is for the funding of at least 100 books.
Four Dime Novels From The Old Sleuth 1896 - 1898.
This crowdfunder is to get four 120 year old pulp dime novels back into print into one book;  Four Dime Novels From The Old Sleuth.
My name is Darren Nemeth and I published three other books so far.  How To Film Moving Pictures in the 1910's, which was funded here successfully in early 2018, 1907 Chicago Projecting Co.'s Entertainer's Supplies Catalog No. 122; Deluxe Edition (printed in 2015) and a reprint of the 1907 pulp novel The Great Express Robbery, funded through Kickstarter in June, 2019. 
Why Reprint These?
Dime novels from the 1890s are extremely scarce. Ever hear stories from older family members who regretted the loss of entire boxes of baseball cards and comic books that were thrown out?  The main readers were adolescent boys who's collections oftentimes were discarded as "junk" by someone in the family.  Somethings do not change!  Also, the pulp paper doesn't survive well under certain conditions -- after many decades the paper can become brittle to the point they can't be read from cover to cover without shedding.
All four dime novels are from The Old Sleuth series, which numbered in the hundreds of published original and reprinted books and magazines from the 1870s into the 1910s.  However, a scant few of them are available today in an easy to read form.
If this book is funded it will reprint...
 Amzi, The Detective; or, Morning, Noon and Night In New York. A Detective Tale. (1896)
 A Detective's Daughter. An Extraordinary Narrative. (1898)
 A Struggle To Win; or, A Gypsy Boy's Secret. (1898)
 Seth Bond; or, A Lost Treasure Mystery. A Startling Detective Narrative. (1898)
The plots move along swiftly, are full of action and I believe will be enjoyable to most readers.  
If the funding goal is reached the pledges will pay for a print quantity of one hundred books plus the cost of shipping from the printing company. 
How Was This Reprint Created?
The valuable dime novels needed to be taken apart so the pages and cover could be individually scanned at 600 dpi laying completely flat on a table scanner.  The covers have been extensively retouched and readability of illegible text restored.
One example of the thousands of print corrections made to the text.
Most of the retouching was to reduce the yellowing on the pages, being careful that none of the printed ink was removed.  Some of the characters in the printing press had too much ink and left blotches.   Some were barely readable due to too little ink.  These were fixed by moving legible characters from other areas of the page on top of them then erasing the surrounding smudge.  The skew of the pages was also corrected and centered.  With these thousands of touch-ups the easy flow of reading has been restored.
More info on how this was done will be in upcoming updates!
If funded I endeavor to restore and reprint even more crime, adventure and romance novels from the 1860's-1910's period.
This proof was ordered after the novels were read and scanned. It was used a guide to fix unreadable text. The cover is temporary and is not going to be used on the finished book.
Well over a thousand corrections were made to all 430+ pages of the four Old Sleuth dime novels.
When Does It Ship? 
If the goal is reached, all rewards will ship September, 2019.  
As soon as they are delivered to my house all will be packaged and mailed to backers.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Low risk. The book is nearly finished and the cover needs to be created. The printer of the book is already lined up and ready to go. 

If funded all rewards ship in September.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
TLDR: We are publishing the ultimate edition of Agatha Christie’s masterpiece, DEATH ON THE NILE — the first ever fine press edition. Over the course of the campaign a Mystery will unfold for you to solve. A one-of-a-kind prize volume that money can't buy will be awarded to the first person who cracks the puzzle and prizes may be given to ALL backers to reward participation in the project and help us break new frontiers on Kickstarter. 
Presenting DEATH ON THE NILE — A handmade, limited edition from Thornwillow Press.
The Thornwillow Edition of Agatha Christie's DEATH ON THE NILE
Having written more than 70 novels, 14 short story collections, as well as the longest running play in history, Agatha Christie is the most widely read author of all time. Her murder mysteries, above all, brought her fame and have endured in the public consciousness for nearly a century, earning her the undisputed title of the Queen of Crime. The popularity of these novels is no real mystery at all. As Dame Agatha Christie wrote in her introduction to Death on the Nile, “If detective stories are ‘escape literature’ (and why shouldn’t they be!) the reader can escape to sunny skies and blue water as well as to crime in the confines of an armchair.”
Yet for all that she has been celebrated, with television, film, and even video game adaptations of her work, she is not the household name that she once was. Now, we aim to honor her legacy, and shine a spotlight once again on the enduring brilliance of her work. It is with great pleasure that we announce that Thornwillow Press, with the blessing of Agatha Christie’s family and estate, is publishing the first ever fine press edition of one of her most iconic works—Death on the Nile.
Like all of Thornwillow's books, DEATH ON THE NILE will be printed letterpress and hand bound in limited numbers. Please help us create the most beautiful edition of Agatha Christie's masterpiece ever.
A bibliographic excavation...
We are joined by archaeologist and crime fiction scholar Dr. A.T. Reyes of Groton and Oxford University. With a brand new original monograph and exquisitely reproduced collection of maps and ephemera from Christie’s travels, Dr. Reyes is our guide as we walk in the footsteps of the great Queen of Crime through a world of ancient tombs, evil curses, and archaeological discovery. For after all, what is an archaeologist but a reader and detective of the ancient past? 
Celebrated archaeologist and crime fiction scholar Dr. A.T. Reyes of Groton and Oxford University presents the novel in the context of Christie's life... and has created a mystery puzzle to test our sleuthing skills.
The novel stars Hercule Poirot, the archetypal detective and one of Christie’s most beloved and enduring characters. As Sophie Hannah, best-selling author and scholar of crime fiction describes him, Poirot is “a miraculous blend of opposites. He is the perfect memorable caricature, with his luxuriant moustaches, egg-shaped head and fussy ways ... but he is also a real person with depth, and past pain, and a third dimension that will forever remain hidden, which makes us believe in its presence all the more.” Of the more than 30 Poirot novels, Death on the Nile is among the best. Upon its release in 1937, The New York Times Book Review wrote “You have the right to expect great things… and you will not be disappointed.” 
We are offering DEATH ON THE NILE in a number of different versions — from copies bound in letterpress paper wrappers, half-cloth, half-leather, and full-leather as well as a few very special collector bindings. All of the half-leather and full-leather copies are individually hand-numbered and signed by Dr. Reyes and Luke Ives Pontifell.
“Christie’s books are so much more than great puzzles,” said Sophie Hannah, best-selling author and scholar of crime fiction, “Each of her novels demonstrates a profound understanding of people–how they think, feel and behave–all delivered in her crisp, elegant, addictively readable style.” 
Over the ensuing decades, the popularity of the novel has never waned. Death on the Nile has gone on to inspire countless stage, radio, television, and movie adaptations; it has even been made into a computer game and a graphic novel. In 2017, it was announced that 20th Century Fox is developing Death on the Nile as a sequel to their film adaptation of Christie’s Murder on the Orient Express, with the great actor and director Kenneth Branagh returning as Hercule Poirot.
The edition features maps, photographs, artifacts and ephemera from Agatha Christie's travels in Egypt with her archaeologist husband that also set the stage for the novel.
A MYSTERY for you to solve. A Spectacular PRIZE to Win:
Over the course of the campaign a Mystery will unfold for you to solve. Created by Dr. Reyes, we present this mystery to connect you to and celebrate the spirit and legacy of Agatha Christie. 
A magnificent, one-of-a-kind prize volume that money can't buy will be awarded to the first person to crack the puzzle. But take note... the spirit of the contest is the more the merrier!
There will be prizes for ALL backers that reward participation. Join the contest. Get the word out. Invite others to take a shot. Build your crack team. Work in groups. The more who get involved, the more rewards there will be for everyone. Help us break new frontiers on Kickstarter.
THE MYSTERY CONTEST is open to all. Over the course of the campaign, 21 clues will be revealed. They will be sent to all people backing and following the project and will be posted on the project page and on Thornwillow's website. Anyone, regardless of whether you back the project or not, is eligible to win the grand prize. Additional rewards will be given to all backers of the project based on participation in the mystery and the success of the project.
STRETCH GOALS:
GET 250 PARTICIPANTS BEFORE THE END OF THE CAMPAIGN (August 8, 2019 at 11:55PM New York Time) AND WE WILL RELEASE THE ANSWER TO A SECOND CLUE.
AND/OR... 
IF THE CAMPAIGN BREAKS $100,000 WE WILL POST WHETHER TO USE THE FIRST OR THE LAST LETTER FROM EACH CLUE'S ONE-WORD-ANSWER.
Here are the parameters for THE THORNWILLOW DEATH ON THE NILE MYSTERY:
Each clue leads to a one-word answer. Some are more difficult than others. All clues have to do either with Archaeology or with Agatha Christie.
There are 21 clues in all and therefore 21 one-word answers.
Take EITHER the first OR the last letter of each of these words. These 21 letters will then unscramble to form three words.
What links these three words?
HERE ARE ALL 21 CLUES:
CLUE 21: The best will include an Egyptian city 
CLUE 20: Sounds like goodbye in part of old Ethiopia 
CLUE 19: Witness’ suspect is a rodent 
CLUE 18: Heaviness in Mary’s novel (14 Correct / 17 Submitted)
CLUE 17: Christie’s man “who knows about money” with “over-large very white teeth” (16 Correct / 22 Submitted)
CLUE 16: Egyptian temple site derived from Arabic “fortress” (19 Correct / 32 Submitted)
CLUE 15: Hastings’ favourite issue (21 Correct / 25 Submitted)
CLUE 14: “Dear love, I have your ------- and your heart” (5 Correct / 17 Submitted) = promisE
CLUE 13: To a Sister, there is, within, respite from the desert (15 Correct / 31 Submitted)
CLUE 12: Jessica and Jane share the same name? Not the first one!  (21 Correct / 37 Submitted)
CLUE 11: A likely name for a Christie maid (10 Correct / 57 Submitted)
CLUE 10: Common ground for a lighthouse and a library (44 Correct / 54 Submitted)
CLUE 9: Whither they came (46 Correct / 57 Submitted)
CLUE 8: What Christie’s portrait was (58 Correct / 60 Submitted)
CLUE 7: Egypt’s most famous stone (66 Correct / 70 Submitted)
CLUE 6: Jordan’s most famous rock (63 Correct / 63 Submitted)
CLUE 5: What P, a foreign character, is (9 Correct / 86 Submitted)
CLUE 4: Writer of “The Mirror Crack’d From Side to Side” (39 Correct / 109 Submitted)
CLUE 3: A mound, say? (51 Correct / 81 Submitted)
CLUE 2: Old Alexandria? (79 Correct / 118 Submitted)
CLUE 1: Christie’s fruity secretary (117 Correct / 167 Submitted)
NOTE: 
The number of correct submissions and total submitted is as of 1pm New York Time on August 2, 2019. 
The number of submitted answers are not necessarily from unique participants  
CLICK HERE TO READ MORE AND SUBMIT YOUR ANSWERS
The PRIZE Book:
This precious volume is worth many thousands of dollars, but money cannot buy it. Only one will ever exist. This spectacular prize book will be stored at the press until the mystery is solved, at which time it will be presented to the winner. 
It is bound in Scarlet full leather and hand-marbled end papers. It is hand tooled in genuine gold, set with a cabochon opal, and is presented in a suede-lined clamshell box. Only one copy will be made exclusively for the first person who solves the mystery. 
THE PRIZE BOOK will be awarded to the first person who answers all of the questions correctly. The Prize Book is bound in Scarlet full leather. It features hand-marbled end papers and is hand tooled in genuine gold. It is set with an opal cabochon and is presented in a suede lined clamshell box. Only one copy will ever exist.
How our books are made:
All of the design, printing, and binding are done at Thornwillow in our workshops in Newburgh, New York. We are perhaps the only fine press publisher in the world to unite these related arts and crafts of the written word under one roof, and we are committed to teaching and perpetuating them for readers today and for years to come.
PLAY

We start with a beautiful layout.  The text is set using classical ratios of type to page, giving each book luxurious margins and elegant proportions.  
We set the type with an eye towards proportion and scale.
Once the book is laid out, the text is printed letterpress on our Heidelberg Cylinder Press. The type is literally pressed into the heavy archival stock, so that you can feel the letters as you run your fingers across the page. This is an ancient art—the same process by which Johannes Gutenberg printed his books 500 years ago.
The pages are printed letterpress on our Heidelberg flatbed cylinder press. You can feel each letter as you run your fingers across the page.
Each book is then folded into eight page signatures, collated and sewn together. 
The books are sewn into "signatures" which assures their durability and makes them open more easily for a beautiful reading experience.
The books are then bound by hand by our master craftsmen, who create the highest quality bindings in the world.
The binding of every volume is made by hand at the press. At Thornwillow we are committed to teaching and perpetuating the arts and crafts of the written word.
The skills involved in gold tooling and decorating a leather binding take years of practice.
 THE EDITION: 
We are offering Death on the Nile in four distinct bindings: letterpress printed paper wrappers, half cloth and letterpress boards, half Morocco and handmade paste papers, and magnificent full leather. Each copy will also include a letterpress printed list of subscribers in recognition of their generous support and to let future generations of readers know how this book was made possible.
Death on the Nile is Christie at her best. Whether you are a Christie fan, a mystery reader, or a collector, the Thornwillow edition of this great novel is the one to own.

We are giving a copy of our "Mystery, Magic & Maps" Portfolio Slipcase to the first 30 backers of the Half leather tier. The Portfolio Slipcase includes THIRTY letterpress printed broadsides.
The Archaeologist's Notebook: A Special Reward Exclusively for our steady supporters on Patreon
We are pleased to give all of our monthly supporters on Patreon (at the "10pt Garamond" level or higher) a handmade notebook with any version of Death on the Nile that they back. This notebook is sewn, uses the same heavy archival stock of our fine press editions, and features a letterpress printed paper wrapper based on the cover pattern of Death on the Nile.  30 years ago to commemorate the 20th anniversary of the first Moon Landing, Thornwillow published REMEMBERING THE MOON with Walter Cronkite. This book has long been out of print, but we are releasing 3 copies of the full cloth binding from our archives to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the Moon Landing and will give them to the three backers of the Scarab Deluxe Full Leather edition of DEATH ON THE NILE. 
Released from our archives are 3 copies of Walter Cronkite's REMEMBERING THE MOON which we published 30 years ago to commemorate the 20th anniversary of the first Moon Landing. We will GIVE one to each of the Kickstarter backers of the Scarab edition in celebration of the 50th anniversary of the Moon Landing.
REMEMBERING THE MOON was set in monotype Poliphilus and printed letterpress. These copies are bound in full cloth and feature original illustrations by Irena Martens. 
The Scarab Edition: Bound in Black Full-Leather with hand-marbled end papers. Hand tooled in genuine gold. Set with two cabochon carnelians. Presented in a suede lined clamshell box. Only 3 available. The 3 reserved copies of the Scarab edition are currently being held for archival collections.

If you back The Deluxe Full-Leather: Anubis with Millennial Cities Print Portfolio you will receive TWO incredibly rare Thornwillow publications. First is the special binding of Death on the Nile bound in full sand leather, hand tooled in genuine gold and set with a cabochon garnet. Second, you will receive a copy of our Millennial Cities portfolio of photogravure prints that present some of the earliest photographic images of the ancient world. We are making these three copies from this edition available at a very special price when combined with this project to help our best subscribers add important titles to their Thornwillow collections and to help us raise funds to support our Thornwillow Institute and Makers Village project. thornwillowinstitute.org.
The Anubis Edition: Bound in Sand Full-Leather with hand-marbled end papers. Hand tooled in genuine gold. Set with a genuine cabochon garnet. Presented in a suede lined clamshell box. Comes with Millennial Cities photogravure portfolio. Only 3 sets available.
Millennial Cities features hand-printed photogravures of some of the earliest images of  Cairo, Beirut, Mecca, Medina, Jerusalem, Bethlehem, and Constantinople presented in a half-leather and pastepaper portfolio along with essays by Harvard University archaeologist Dr. Carney Gavin about the 19th Century photographers and the ancient cities in a half-leather bound volume, all presented in a suede lined clamshell box. 
Millennial Cities features 10 hand-printed photogravure prints of the ancient world presented with essays by Harvard University archaeologist Dr. Carney Gavin. This was one of the most ambitious projects Thornwillow has ever undertaken and remains one of the rarest and most special of the press. Click the image above to learn more about this edition on our website.
Super Deluxe Full-Leather: Nile River Boat with Agatha Christie GENUINE AUTOGRAPH  |  $5,000  |  Only 1 available, Edition of one.
This unique volume is bound in blue full leather and hand-marbled endpaper. It is elaborately hand tooled in genuine gold with the image of a nile river boat and presented in a suede lined clamshell box with a gold tooled leather spine label. This one-of-a-kind volume will also include a photograph portrait of Agatha Christie among her books and a GENUINE Agatha Christie autograph.
The Nile River Boat Edition: Bound in Blue Full-Leather with hand-marbled end papers. Hand tooled in genuine gold. Presented in a suede lined clamshell box. Comes with a portrait photograph of Agatha Christie among her books and a genuine Agatha Christie Autograph. Only 1 available.
This unique, one of a kind volume includes this portrait of Agatha Christie among her books and...
... and a genuine Agatha Christie autograph. There is only ONE copy of this unique full-leather binding with these unique artifacts. By subscribing to this very special copy, you are not only securing the rarest version of the edition for your collection, you are also dramatically supporting Thornwillow's mission.
About Thornwillow Press:
Thornwillow Press was founded in 1985 by Luke Ives Pontifell, when he was just 16. During college he ran the press from his Harvard dorm room and the barn at his parents’ 18th century farm in Western Massachusetts. Over the years, Thornwillow has grown to become one of the preeminent fine presses in the world. Thornwillow has published the original works of John Updike, President Barack Obama, James Merrill, and more. Thornwillow publications can be found in the permanent collections of the Metropolitan Museum, the Smithsonian Institution, the Morgan Library, the Vatican, and the Bodleian Library at Oxford, among many others.  
Thornwillow books are collected by individuals and institutions the world over. They are heirlooms that appreciate in value and are made to last for generations.
To learn more about Thornwillow Press please visit thornwillow.com. To learn more about the work of the Thornwillow Institute and Makers Village — a 501(c)3 public charity committed to supporting craft, culture and community — and how you can help support our mission, please visit thornwillowinstitute.org.
Founded in 1985 by Luke Ives Pontifell, Thornwillow Press is dedicated to perpetuating the related arts and crafts of the written word.

We have successfully conducted twenty-six past projects, and are confident in our ability to manage any unexpected challenges. We do not anticipate any with this project. That said, we will always communicate them to our backers if they do arise.

updates.update_userinfo: A parable to sow... and a deadline TONIGHT!
updates.update_content:
As backers of Death on the Nile, I wanted to make sure that you are aware of our newest publication, which is currently live (and thriving!) on Kickstarter.
Thornwillow proudly presents, for the first time ever in a fine press edition…
 Parable of the Sower by Octavia E. Butler

updates.update_userinfo: As one journey ends, a new one begins...

updates.update_content:
Greetings from the Press!
I am happy to report that shipping of paper and half cloth copies of Death on the Nile is nearly complete! Thanks especially to those of you who have written in with your feedback.

updates.update_userinfo: Happy Holidays on the Nile and Last Minute Gift Solutions
updates.update_content:
Dear Friends,
As we pause to celebrate the holidays, to visit with friends and family, and to reflect on those things that truly matter in our lives, I want particularly to thank you for your support of our work at Thornwillow. By being a subscriber, a customer, a donor, an advisor, an ambassador, and a friend of the press, you make it possible for us to do what we do every day. You are integral to our mission to teach and perpetuate the arts and crafts of the written word, to make beautiful things that last in our increasingly ephemeral lives, to celebrate the written word. Thank you.

updates.update_userinfo: Announcing our most ambitious campaign to date...
updates.update_content:
Announcing our campaign for THE THORNWILLOW MAKERS VILLAGE
Dear Friends,
We have big news from the Press—we have just launched a new campaign, and it is our most ambitious to date!

Dear Friends,
Hold on to your horses... brace yourselves... take a deep breath...
We have a winner!

updates.update_userinfo: Updates on the Nile! Here’s what’s new with the book and our mystery contest…
updates.update_content:
Greetings from the Press!
Over the course of the week, we received several more submissions of letters in the mystery scramble, and we have returned with good news, both about the contest and the progress of the book.

updates.update_userinfo: MYSTERY UPDATE, News from the Press, and "The Mark on the Wall"
updates.update_content:
Greetings Readers and Sleuths!
Apologies for our radio silence—the Press has been buzzing and we have had our hands quite full. 
The Great Gatsby is coming out of the bindery. All paper and cloth copies are almost fully delivered and the leather bindings are moving along beautifully — they take considerably longer because of the additional work that goes into crafting them.

updates.update_userinfo: Announcing our next Bibliographic Exploration - The Book of GENESIS
updates.update_content: We are pleased to announce THE BOOK OF GENESIS in a Fine Press Edition as it has never been seen before.

We have another winner
Dear Friends,
I am happy to report that as of September 23, we have a winner of Phase 2 of the Mystery! 
ADAM SMITH was the first (and so far the only) person to submit all 21 correct letters, and as he also submitted correct answers to all 21 questions, he is assured of claiming  a half-cloth copy of DEATH ON THE NILE, even if he makes it no further in the Mystery. Congratulations to Adam Smith! And to Sarah Miles who was the first to get all of the one word answers correct.

Wow!! My book arrived yesterday and it’s a beauty!! Thank you! My second campaign with you was as wonderful as the first!!!
Thanks!

campaign.story:
Big idea: Create stoneware cookie jars decorated with dragons eating cookies.
She’s a beauty.
These cookie jars have the five qualities that make a cookie jar great:
1. Genteel but scary. Decorated on all four sides with fearsome, cookie-loving dragons to scare away timid snack pirates and discourage unauthorized withdrawals.
2. Weighty. Heavy enough to be a murder weapon. Even before you put stuff in it, this cookie jar weighs 4.25 lbs (2 kg). Will not blow away in typical household windstorms.
3. Food ready. Easy to clean. Dishwasher safe. Air-tight lid with silicone seal to preserve freshness. 
4. Capacious. Can hold 90 Oreo cookies! Exterior measures 5.125"D x 5.125"W x 10"H (13 cm D x 13 cm W x 25.5 cm H). Opening measures 4" (10 cm) diameter. This cookie jar may actually be slightly bigger on the inside than it is on the outside! (Research into this possibility is still underway.)
5. Not just for cookies. Makes an excellent storage place for all your snacks. And because it looks like an innocent cookie jar, you’ll find it an excellent place to conceal caches, hoards, and stashes. For example, some people have said they plan to use the cookie jar to hide secret accumulations of contraband, gemstones, antique coins, and chocolate. No one will suspect.
A close look reveals cookie-loving dragons.
What you’ll get. Sponsors of this project will receive stoneware cookie jar with lid. All decorated with cookie-loving dragons from Don’s sketchbook.
Schedule.  Assuming this project reaches the funding goal, production will go fast and we should be ready to ship by the end of August 2019. 
********
Makes a great gift. There are several pledge levels that allow you to get multiple cookie jars. You don’t even have to bake cookies to fill the jar, but we have included some proven cookie recipes for inspiration in case you want to go that way.
Is there also a cat? Yes
Animals? Don’t forget that a handsome cookie jar is also an ideal way to store dog treats and cat rewards.

ODE TO A VIGILANT-DRAGON COOKIE JAR
Losing treats to cookie pirates is the worst of aggravations.
Get a jar to hide your treasures from unwanted observations.
All four sides should be embellished with dragon decorations.
That’s the best you can do to stop misappropriations.
Lid includes more dragons and a silicone gasket for a tight seal.

Shipping. There’s a shipping charge that varies depending on how far away you live. It’s relatively small in the United States but goes up dramatically overseas because the cookie jars are heavy. Some places are shockingly high. But for a treasured heirloom that may last generations, perhaps you can justify the expense.
Read this if you are outside the U.S. In some countries, customs duties may be applied to ceramic shipments. I have no way of predicting if they’ll apply to your shipment. Customs inspections are very arbitrary and willy-nilly. Most packages sail through without any duty, but some are selected by chance and the recipient gets hit with a duty fee. So if you can’t tolerate the risk that your shipment might get selected for extra costs, you should probably not support this project. Or arrange to have your reward shipped to a friend in the U.S. who can bring you your cookie jar in their luggage next trip.
We’ll probably be using the U.S. Postal Service for these shipments because that seems to minimize the number of packages that get hit with customs fees, and there are no extra broker fees added.
Pay attention. If you are an international sponsor and receive a tracking number when we ship, track your package daily to make sure it doesn’t get hung up in the system and returned to us. Don’t just assume it will show up at your door. Shipments have a way of getting stalled, and monitoring the status of the tracking number allows you to intervene promptly.
Capacious interior is a good place to stash your false passports, ray gun, gold bullion, or other treasures.
********
Project updates. Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds but not so often that you’ll think that I am a pest. You can also receive a trickle of news about Don’s projects, sketchbook, and ridiculous blog by joining the Calamityware mailing list. Sign up for our newsletter here.
An enhancement to any domicile.

Questions? Send me your questions and I’ll add them and the answers to the FAQ section at the bottom of this page.
Previous projects. If you missed my previous Kickstarter projects, you’ll find extras from the production run from most of my previous projects at Calamityware.com. While supplies last. Not just porcelain—there are some other unusual products there, too, that began as Kickstarter-Don projects...including the world’s most delightful shower curtain and the groundbreaking book, Monster Etiquette.
Want to see more of Don’s drawings? I post a new drawing of something almost every day on Flickr. You can see my preliminary Calamityware sketches and drawings in this Flickr album.
Don
Pittsburgh, June 6, 2019
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Countless things could go wrong to delay this project. But the design is done and the pre-production proofs have been approved. So if I get enough sponsors, I will green-light production right away without waiting until the project closes.

I’m using a workshop that has produced countless cookie jars for many years. So technical problems are unlikely.

If you have supported my previous Kickstarter projects, you know I always come through. Frequently, I complete my projects ahead of schedule. In any case, you’ll get updates so you know what’s going on.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
WE REACHED OUR  STRETCH GOAL....AFROFUTURISM DANCE CLASSES ONLINE FOR ALL BACKERS PLUS A 1951 PLAYLIST INSPIRED BY OUR CHARACTERS' IN BRONZEVILLE!!!!
STRETCH GOAL #2 - If we get 400 backers by the end of our campaign Ytasha will do an Audiobook!!!
This Kickstarter project is a set of 3 short books about characters traversing through time in one of America's most iconic African-American communities. We explore a fantastic and speculative world, where people in the past and present are engaged in creating compelling new futures! 
SYNOPSIS: It’s 1951 in Chicago’s Bronzeville and a spaceship sighting has everyone buzzing. Bonnie, a 20something  artist/columnist with the Chicago Defender, covers a not so secret society of people who dissect speculative science theories and the realm of the paranormal. 
Bonnie’s fascinated by this world of eccentrics introduced to her by a mysterious, handsome poet named Mandalay whose freedom she envies. The society meets in the basement of a slaughterhouse. However, when a blue haired pansexual pleasure activist from the future presents the attendees with the opportunity to live in the 2020s, Bonnie must decide whether life in the Alter Destiny is real or a dangling fantasy. 
A Spaceship in Bronzeville is a project published by Mouse Books and is was written by Ytasha L. Womack.
ABOUT YTASHA
Ytasha is an author, Afrofuturist theorist, filmmaker, dance therapist and champion of the imagination. She's author of the book Afrofuturism: The World of Black Sci Fi & Fantasy Culture, a Locus Awards Nonfiction Finalist. She's also author of the Rayla Universe series. as well as the nonfiction books Post Black and Beats, Rhymes and Life, What We Love and Hate About Hip Hop. She's lectured at numerous colleges and festivals all over the world. 
She is a Spring 2019 creative-in residence at Kickstarter and 2018 writer-in-residence with Emerson College in Boston. Much like Bonnie, she got her start as a journalist at The Chicago Defender. Although her families Chicago roots began in Bronzeville, she personally has not seen a spaceship there... although she's met people who claim they have. 

 EXPLORING BONNIE'S WORLD 
Chicago South-side, 1950s
Chicago's Bronzeville neighborhood was one of the great destinations for African Americans escaping hardships in the South during the first half of the 20th Century.  
Our story's protagonist, Bonnie, lives and works in Bronzeville. Esoteric ideas and new philosophies were hotly debated as people looked to create new futures in the face of new opportunities. Those who came during the Great Migration created a unique culture; a blend of the aspirations and beliefs rife with robust civic and nightlife. The Chicago Defender (where Bonnie works), is one of the leading black-owned papers and was instrumental in attracting people north. 

1951: POINT OF TRANSITION 
Musician and poet Sun Ra was a resident of Bronzeville in the 1950's
It's after WWII and the African American population in Chicago has nearly quadrupled, the Red Scare is in it's early years, housing segregation is being challenged (think A Raisin in the Sun) and  the country is on the cusp of both a civil rights movement and cultural renaissance. The Regal Theater, Savoy Ballroom, and Club DeLisa were among the popular hang outs and Washington Park and the Southside Community Arts Center are hubs for the exchange of ideas. Chess and Vee-Jay Records were on the rise. Chicago's meat packing plant (where the characters meet) was at an all time high. 

Custom Slip Case for 3 Book Set
 Mouse Books offer a convenient alternative to reading on your phone: a phone-sized book. 
Mouse Books are approachable, carefully curated, beautiful, durable, real paper books. They are small enough to go with you anywhere. They don’t ring, buzz, vibrate, need batteries, and there are no screens to break. They are ideal for people who want a break from relentlessness of the attention economy.
SPECIFICATIONS
Mouse Books are carefully crafted to optimize the reading experience in a very compact format. When you are working at a small scale, every detail matters. 
OUR FIRST LIVING AUTHOR!!!
Ytasha being a good sport during late night work session planning this campaign!
Mouse Books launched by publishing  classic literature by celebrated authors like Joyce, Dostoyevsky, Austen, and Melville. All along we have been waiting for the opportunity to partner with a contemporary author on a special project. We are delighted that Ytasha agreed to work with us, and has created this set of novellas specifically for the Mouse format. 

 WORLD-CLASS PRINTER 
This is the actual Heidelberg Speedmaster XL 105 at eDOC that prints Mouse Books!
Mouse is obsessed with making these books extremely high-quality. We've partnered with one of the great printers in the USA, eDOC Communications from Mount Prospect, Illinois, to bring Mouse Books to life. And since our printing partner is local to our Chicago-based team, we know our quality standards are upheld during every print run.  
THANK YOUUUU!!!!
THANK YOU for making it through the whole description! We sincerely hope you pledge and help bring this project to life!!!!!!
Anything you can do to help spread the word is greatly appreciated by Ytasha and the Mouse Team :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Mouse Books is, in our estimation, a very low-risk project. We have two major costs: printing and shipping. We have a keen understanding of both. In the last year, we have printed and shipped tens-of-thousands of books. If we hit our funding threshold we will be able to fulfill these orders in a timely manner.

Ytasha has already drafted the books and they are in the process of being edited and typeset. We have an excellent relationship with the printer and anticipate no barriers to timely delivery.

campaign.story:
This Kickstarter is for the funding of 80 books. If pledges go above that, the more the better!
The Great Express Robbery (1907) crime pulp novel.
This crowdfunder is to get a 102 year old pulp crime paperback back into print.  The Great Express Robbery (1907) by Grace Miller White is based upon the play by A. H. Woods. It's protagonists are two young women who live near their father's coal mine somewhere outside of Old San Francisco and they deal with rough outlaws.  Including a husband with bad intentions for everyone!  The setting is barely more than a decade after of The Old West era (1865-1895)! And as you can figure from looking at the cover, train robbery is involved!
Hello!  My name is Darren Nemeth and I published two other books.  How To Film Moving Pictures in the 1910's, which was funded here successfully in early 2018, and 1907 Chicago Projecting Co.'s Entertainer's Supplies Catalog No. 122; Deluxe Edition (printed in 2015).  Both are about early motion pictures and filled with carefully retouched ephemera, some are very similar in printing as The Great Express Robbery.
I found The Great Express Robbery a few months ago and never saw a pulp novel going back that far in person. Especially with a color cover.  While reading it the story and language was surprisingly fresh, not “ye old timey-wimey.” The plot is brisk and I believe is enjoyable for modern readers. 
Why Reprint It?
Paperback pulp novels from over a century ago are hard to find.  Even more rarer is finding one that isn't shedding paper flakes and even more rarer than that are ones that can be read from cover to cover without coming apart.
The 128 pages story is fast paced and full of action.  I rarely read fiction and had a hard time putting it down.  Read nearly all of in one sitting which is something I've never done before.  I think that most everyone will enjoy it also.
If the funding goal is reached it will pay for a print quantity of eighty books. If above the goal, the more the better! 
How Was This Reprint Created?
The binding of The Great Express Robbery was taken apart so the pages and cover could be individually scanned laying completely flat at 600 dpi.  The cover was extensively retouched and readability of illegible text was restored.  I doubt anyone will be disappointed. 
Disassembled so the pages can be laid flat on the scanner.
Most of the retouching was to reduce the yellowing on the pages, being careful that none of the printed ink was removed.  Some of the characters in the printing press had too much ink and were blotchy.  Some were barely readable due to too little ink.  Those were fixed by moving legible ones from other areas of the page on top then erasing the surrounding smudge.  The skew of the pages was also corrected and centered.  With these minor repairs the easy flow of reading is restored.
More info on how this was done will be in upcoming updates!
If funded I endeavor to restore and reprint more crime, adventure and romance novels from the 1890's-1910's period.
When Does It Ship?
If funded, all rewards will ship July, 2019.  As soon the printer, Blurb, delivers the books they will be mailed to backers.  
The interior pages are 100% finished, the cover is 99% finished (the bottom part shown below will be changed) and the spine is done.  The only thing left to do is the back cover! 
The first proof. The text at the bottom will be changed.
After the back cover is designed "The Great Express Robbery" will be finished and ready for the printing press.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Low risk. The book is finished except for the back cover and new text at the bottom of the front. I have the printer of the book already lined up and ready to go. All rewards ship in July.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
For ten years now, the World's Smallest Post Service (WSPS) has been sending big love via tiny mail. Whose love? Our happy customers! The tiny letters and packages transcribed and crafted by Lea Redmond and her pals have charmed tens of thousands of people in the US and around the world. Y'all have asked for more and more tiny mail, so here we are!
The truth is: as much as people love their smartphones, they miss real mail. The world needs more letters and care packages. People want to slow down, to reflect, and to appreciate each other. Tiny mail offers one small way to do just that.
Tiny mail is a double-delight. It's as much fun to send a tiny letter or package as it is to receive one! Tiny mail is for anyone and everyone. It is most certainly for all ages. Some people love tiny mail because it's cute, while others are in it for the absurd. Whether tiny mail is adorable, hilarious, wonder-full or just plain strange, you're bound to make someone's day when your tiny letter or package arrives. (You should see our happy customer email folder!)  
To send tiny mail, you type out the info for your custom tiny letters and packages on our website, add real-world shipping addresses, review your order, and go through checkout. Then we wave our magic wand and turn it into a tiny version before shipping! (For reals, it's actually a careful process involving a fancy laser printer, very steady hands and excellent craft skills!)
Why doesn't it get lost in the mail? No worries! We package up all tiny mail (with a magnifying glass!) and ship it in a larger mailer so that it arrives safely.
Over the past ten years, the World's Smallest Post Service has been bursting with creativity. We've released dozens of new formats to spread the magic of tiny mail: DIY stationery sets, "Keep Me Posted" 6-week serial stories, tiny seed packets and trowels from the Easter Bunny, anonymous "Secret Spider" letters, tiny chocolate package sets, patches, tiny postal ink stamps, letters from the Tooth Fairy, advent calendars containing antique postage stamps, and big batches of tiny mail as invitations and promotional mailings for art museums and other organizations. We've even transcribed wedding proposals!
But there's ONE thing that Lea has been daydreaming about for years...
Lea visiting the antique post office counter that she found on craigslist in Drytown, CA. Score!
With this Kickstarter project, we want to put even more tiny mail magic and wonder into the world. We propose to create an enchanting, museum-like, open-to-the-public brick & mortar home for our World's Smallest Post Service. We want to make a place, a magical coordinate on the globe where people can count on wonder and kindness.  Here is an illustrated list of the special moments we want to create there:
A hot air balloon on a pulley descends from the P.O. ceiling to delight a visitor with a treat! (Thank you to the ever-talented Lauren Nassef for these animated illustrations!))
A diorama of our postal office hiding inside the mail slot inside our postal office!
We'd love to put on puppet shows about the history of mail in our postal counter window!
Send a Bay Area pal to us to redeem a birthday treat in a wall of antique brass P.O. boxes!
We'd like to create custom apron postal uniforms for us to wear while greeting visitors.
New Bohemia Signs is excited to paint our sign and windows for us!
We'd love to offer pressed penny souvenirs with custom imagery on the pennies!
Our pals at Year Round Co have designed this gorgeous certificate for us!
To go along with our new postal storefront in Downtown Oakland, we want to make our online tiny mail experience extraordinary too! What we do is unusual, which means it requires custom programming. And Lea has a long list of cool ideas to make the web interface more user-friendly and powerful. These include: a code redemption system for gift certificates and pre-paying for response mail, better editing and preview tools, etc.
We are re-vamping our online ordering system with Ryuhei at Y Designs.
We have a quote in hand from our programmer and plan to use about half of our Kickstarter funding to pay for custom code upgrades for our site. The rest will be used to create as many magical moments (see above!) as we can afford, and to set up the new space with the amazing antique post office counter that Lea found in addition to work tables, lighting, and shelving. The more funds that we raise, the more magic we can make! (Our current monthly sales will be able to cover rent, payroll, and insurance, in case you're curious.) 
Choose a reward that you love! 
See below for visuals of all the options in the list to the right. 
Oakland artist Michael Wertz has created a sheet of faux postage stamps celebrating 10 years of the World's Smallest Post Service. They're not real postage, but you can add them to the postage stamp area on envelopes as long as you have enough proper postage too!
All backers will receive a WSPS patch and commemorative faux postage stamp sheet.  
A Little Support! ($15)
The tiny mail certificates -- good for one classic custom tiny letter or package -- are discounted from our regular prices (once you add shipping, in case you're comparing). We hope you'll stock up for the next few years, giving us the boost we need right now to stretch into our new storefront and website. Please note: these certificates will arrive in September, once our new code redemption website is built, making the codes functional. (And between now and then, you can send tiny mail via our current website like usual.) 
Who are you excited to send tiny mail to? Who needs a little love? For what occasion or sentiment? Which packages? What custom messages? Letters? Cards?
Choose from 40+ different tiny package objects. Use our messages, or write your own!
Choose from 20+ different letter and card designs.
Reward tiers:
Send ONE + goodies! ($25)
Send TWO + goodies! ($40)
PEN PALS: ONE for you, ONE for a friend! (Sent to 2 different addresses.) ($45)
CHOCOLATE tiny package set + goodies! ($50)
DIY set + goodies! ($70)
Send FIVE + goodies! ($85)
DIY "pen pal" set + goodies! (Sent to 2 different addresses.) ($85)
Send FIVE + DIY set + goodies! ($140)
Send TEN + goodies! ($160)
BULK tiny mail - send 50! (+ 1 goodies set) ($750)
Brick & Mortar Party in Oakland! (with goodies & a certificate for 10 guests) ($500)
Our business philosophy is to make good, meaningful things that bring people joy. That's it. No advertising. Very little social media. No gimmicks or flashy sales bombarding your inboxes, just illustrated email newsletters from Lea. Our working assumption is that you, our customers, want to be treated like real human beings -- like intelligent, kind people with excellent taste. We put our energy into making wonderful things, and hope that the rest takes care of itself. We count on word of mouth to bring us our future customers, and we're counting on YOU today. Thank you for all the support you've given us over the years, and we look forward to making tiny mail for you and yours for years to come!
If you know people who you think would LOVE this project, we'd be happy to mail them a free tiny postcard from you letting them know about it. Just email Adrienne (ant@leafcutterdesigns.com) with a list of names and addresses. (We'll put your name in the "return address" area of the larger envelope.) Special Delivery!
Lea in the early days, transcribing by hand for passers-by.
Lea Redmond started the World's Smallest Post Service on a whim back in 2008. The idea just popped into her head and she thought it was so hilarious that it must be done. So she sewed herself a postal uniform, crafted tiny envelopes, bought a roll-top doll desk and a fine tipped pen, and biked down to Sweet Adeline Bakeshop where the owner gave her permission to set up her tiny post office in the corner all afternoon. To her great surprise, people loved it and actually bought transcriptions from her - wow! She then set up shop monthly with the good folks at the old Curiosity Shoppe on Valencia Street in San Francisco. After being featured in Ready-Made magazine, Lea started offering tiny mail through a website. One thing led to another, and with the help of a very thoughtful Boing Boing post and a Design Sponge feature, a tiny business was born. 
How it all began...
PLAY

How to make a DIY tiny package from our kit...
PLAY


Lea on NBC!
PLAY


A few years ago, Lea built a tiny PO diorama into a knothole in a tree at Tilden Park in Berkeley. Hikers leave trinkets and notes as they pass by. If you want to visit it, here's a map.
Lea has loved making things since she was a wee one, such as this tiny paper soda pop machine. You can explore her world at LeaRedmond.com. Her participatory art projects, such as With A Pencil In My Pocket and Sugar Books invite people to find the extraordinary in the ordinary. Lea dreams up and designs whimsical goods such as Seed Money and Matchbox Theater for her business, Leafcutter Designs. Her World’s Smallest Post Service has charmed tens of thousands of people with teeny tiny mail. Lea also creates books, journals, and games via various publishers, including Letters To My Future Self, Knit The Sky, Paint Chip Poetry and Everyday Offerings. She dreams up new worlds and tries to make them at Lucky Penny Parlor, her tiny 250-square-foot studio / tea room in Downtown Oakland. Her most recent Kickstarter project funded a set of quirky activity cards called Lively Matter. She was recently the first  "Artist In The House" at Chronicle Books, where she turned the publishing house's elevator into a tea room.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Honestly, we've done our homework and are confident that we can accomplish our goals if we get the funding we're seeking. This is Lea's 9th Kickstarter project since 2011 (all successful so far) and she's very good at follow-through! The riskiest part of the project is probably the time-line of the custom computer programming, which is estimated but can't really be confirmed until we're well on our way into the review process. As such, we've built a cushion of time into the schedule to be sure we can deliver the tiny letter/package certificates by September. In terms of the brick and mortar aspect of the project, the trickiest part is getting enough in-person customers to justify paying someone to run the register, but our plan for that is to add hours and days as we are able and work our way up to being open all the time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: the new brick & mortar - FULL TOUR (videos!)
updates.update_content:
Dearest Backers,
I'm delighted to present to you our shiny new tiny postal office as a series of 7 mini videos. Enjoy!
xo, Lea

WOW. The party was a glorious zoo and my cheek bones are sore from smiling!
After about 100 little finishing touches over the past week - from paint to signage to apron sewing - suddenly it was party time and something like 200 people showed up over the course of the evening and I didn't get a chance to take my video for you yet! I do, however, have some still photos to hold you over till a video is ready. Video tour of the new P.O. with all its fun surprises coming in a few days!

Dear Backers - - - I very much hope to see some of your shining faces at our BIG TINY PARTY this Saturday here in Downtown Oakland, but for those of you who are too far away to attend, please know that I'll be posting a special sneak-peek video here for you on Saturday afternoon before the party starts! I want you to see, for example, the world's smallest PB&J sandwiches before they all get eaten up!

updates.update_userinfo: Photo tour: Lea's mail slot DIORAMA!
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers & Tiny Mail Enthusiasts! I've got a bunch of fun updates to share over the next week or two! The new tiny PO is really starting to come together! Our hanging sidewalk signs will be installed this Friday and we're almost ready to officially open our doors to the public! In fact, we're doing a "sneak peek" holiday shopping thing THIS WEEKEND. Friday 5-8pm and Saturday 10-6pm at 337 15th Street, Downtown Oakland, CA. We hope to see a few of you there!
Today, I want to show you the MAIL SLOT DIORAMA that I made. Here's a tour of the process!

Dear backers,
Just a quick note to let you know that we are indeed a few weeks behind schedule, but we've been doing the last few rounds of testing on our new tiny mail ordering web pages and everything is looking great! We'll be shipping your tiny mail certificates and other reward goodies THIS COMING WEEK. 
all lovely things,

updates.update_userinfo: Another try for a PRESSED PENNY MACHINE!
updates.update_content:
Dear Tiny Post Office Backers,
I wanted YOU to be the first to know. While we didn't raise enough via the post office Kickstarter to buy a souvenir pressed penny machine, I've been developing a side project involving a machine as well, so I've tossed it up on Kickstarter as a mini project for Lucky Penny Press, to see if we can obtain a pressed penny machine for our storefront after all! (Once we have the machine, we can make tiny post office pennies too!) I just launched the project a few minutes ago and I'm hoping it might delight you and warm your heart. What would you do with a handful of penny poems? Please scatter this news freely!

updates.update_userinfo: Behind-the-scenes: designing our new tiny mail certificate!
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers!
We hope you're having a fantastic summer.
As we mount shelves to the walls, fix cabinet hinges, and hunt down vintage knobs and thingamabobs, I thought you might enjoy a peek into the process of designing our new tiny mail certificate with our good pals Jacqui and Scott of Year Round Co.!

Dear Backers,
We're now deep into construction in the storefront, and hoping to open our doors by the end of the summer!
While you wait for your rewards to arrive in September, we want to give you a 15% off code to use in our online shop: KICK2019. This works for sending tiny mail or purchasing any of Lea's other creative goods, like her Letters To My journal series, her Paint Chip Poetry game, or her beautiful new book in the shape of a hand: .
