campaign.story:
The 300% stretch goal has been reach ! I am please to present a 4th edition to the family ! Here is the silver and black hot foil on white paper. This special deck will be exclusive to Kickstarter and later only available in the box set edition. It won't be available alone or on whole sale.
How to get this new edition ?
You can just update your pledge and add 20€ or upgrade to the new pledge with the 4 decks. Look for this button and do the upgrade. No posts costs extra !

IMPORTANT : 
>> if you pledge with any early bird price, just add 20€ to not lose your special price. 
>> this new edition will be included in the box with coins edition, no need to change anything. 
>> if you want more than 1 deck, the price is 20€ by deck so just do your maths ...
>> if you pledge for 3 decks you can upgrade to 4 decks. 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Following the success of the first edition, here is a precious metal edition. Each tuck case will be letterpress printed with gold, silver or copper hot foil. A special box set will come with real metal coins to play poker like a pirate.
EPHEMERA: any items such as tickets or cards that were originally meant to be discarded after use but have since become collectibles. / EPHEMERIDE: French name of a paper calendar that gave you daily information all over the year.
From this idea and my collection of Ephemera over the years, I get the idea of the EPHEMERID playing cards: each card comes with a unique design based of my thousands of hand-letters, invoices, bills, tickets, and photos! 
The tuck cases are printed with letterpress printing by Studio Pression in France. We us a copper plate which makes amazing details. During the process of printing the first edition, we took time to do some test of hot foil printing and paper colors, that bring me the idea of this new edition.
The card are printed by Noir Arts NPCC who already print the first edition. After the tuck cases are printed in France, they are sent to them and the finalize it with a seal.  
As a dyslexic kid, it was always complicated for me to make the difference between the hearts and diamonds, and between the spades and clubs. So the contrast between them will be more obvious like this.
I am also ambidextrous and I hold my cards like a left-handed ! Which means I do not see the numbers when they are only on 2 corners!
Not only the tucks cases will be different, but also the cards colors. Here are the details.

 The silver edition will be limited edition, and only available with set and boxes editions.

You can choose from 100 coins or the ultimate edition with 200. It contains all the items produce for this edition : deck, dices and coasters.
COINS
I am not a poker expert, but I like to play with my cousin and nephew when we have a family dinner. But I always wanted to play with real coins. I want to have a going all with the sound of metal... I will be working with Fantasy Coins, as I love the coins they made. 
As the project reach the 400% stretch goal I will design and produce 6 different coins : 1 / 5 / 10 / 20 / 50 and 200. You can choose pledge with set of 20, 40 and add on of 80 coins (mixed). Box set edition comes with 100 or 200 options.
Here what you will get :
20 coins : 10x1 / 5x5 / 2x10 / 1x20 / 1x50 / 1x100
40 coins : 20x1 / 10x5 / 4x10 / 2x20 / 2x50 / 2x100
80 coins (add on) : 40x1 / 20x5 / 8x10 / 4x20 / 4x50 / 4x100
100 coins (with boxset) : 30x1 / 20x5 / 20x10 / 10x20 / 10x50 / 10x100
200 coins (with box set) : 60x1 / 40x5 / 40x10 / 20x20 / 20x50 / 20x100

DICES
I will also produce special dices with numbers on them. 
4 letterpress coasters 
I am french (did I tell you that?). On French decks, face cards are associated with historic or mythical personages. King of Spades is David, Queen of Diamonds is Rachel and the Jack of Clubs is Lancelot!  It gave me the idea to propose you to giving your name to a card! Be a jack, a queen or a king ! Or make this an opportunity for a great gift! 
12 spots are available : 4 GOLD Kings, 4 SILVER Queens and 4 COPPER Jacks. If you pledge this reward it will include a super deluxe 100 coins box edition. If you a specific card, contact me as soon as you pledge!
It will states your First name and the initiale (first letter) of your last name. Here is how it looks on previous edition of the deck.
UNLOCKED - 15 000 - 150% funded >> inside printing
UNLOCKED - 20 000  - 200% funded >> deck seal printed in hot foil 
UNLOCKED - 25 000  - 250% funded >> 58 cards decks
UNLOCKED - 30 000  - 300% funded >> exclusive kickstarter limited edition new deck !
UNLOCKED - 35 000  - 350% funded >> special triple sleeve for all pledges with 3 decks
UNLOCKED LOCKED - 40 000  - 400% funded >> 3 news coins : 20 / 50 / 100


You pledge Add-ons. The Early price could be applied before april 22th, after that only the normal price will be accepted. You may finalize your order at the end of the campaign with Backerkit. 
Here is how to pledge with add-ons :
1. Click "Back this project"
2. Select a Reward Level
3. Edit Pledge Amount to reflect the cost of your reward + shipping + additional items wanted according to the following price list.
EXAMPLE:
3 decks (39€) + US Shipping (10€) + 1x dice set (18€)  = 67€
4. Confirm your pledge
You do not need to add any extra money for shipping now. And that’s it, you’re done for now. No need to do anything else until the funding period ends. In the weeks following the end of the Kickstarter I will send every backer a survey via Backerkit. In that survey, you will tell me which specific items you want to add on to your reward. There may be a shipping surcharge depending on your order but it will be finalized after the campaign.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With the first edition of the EPHEMERID, I had no idea how a playing cards deck could be made, but I know I wanted to do it! I get amazing support and success with it, and I learn a lot during the production process. Knowing a lot more open me new doors for creations and to do an even better project. I am really excited about the coins idea and having a full game set up. I hope I will have as much, or even better more support with this new project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Some news from my side of the world...
It always seems impossible until it's done
Happy new year and shipping update
They arrived. Shipping start this week.
updates.update_content: This is what you expect to read for months and I am so happy to finally write it! Today, after one more week than announced, the playing cards arrived! It was a surprise as I called someone yesterday who told me "we do not know where they are"... So today I visit my grandmother to celebrate her 91st birthday and during dinner, the ring bells... The delivery guy was surprised by my enthusiasm! Some photos.

So why an update? Because I am so tired of this situation, it is so frustrating to have everything slows down while I so want these decks to be in your hands (and mine). 
For now on I try to do all the other things to have everything ready... I am tired to say this Covid-19 reasons over and over, but I believe this affects very many layers. What should take 1 week take 3, why should take 3 take 9... Images are better than words even you may be tired of teasing you but it's all I can do by now.

updates.update_userinfo: The cards are... not arrived yet

I paid for these cards on May 10, 2019 and a year and a half later you are still making excuses.

Taking everything into account, from the very beginning when I followed your instructions after making my pledge, and you didn't respond for weeks, and when you finally did, the card I wanted was no longer available, and if I remember correctly, nor was my 2nd choice, in my humble opinion, I've been EXTREMELY patient, even by your quotes definition. I'd love to ask who ever said that if they meant for an indefinite time. My guess is no. Unless you quoted a Saint I'm unaware of. And I am not a saint, or perfect. But I do expect truthfulness from the people in my life....
Scott
Reading it again, even now, I STILL don't get it
And please don't give some BS Corona excuse! The project was almost 9 months over due when the virus hit!
I may need help figuring out what I added on, it’s been a while
Mr Cup - NOW what's your estimate on backers of the ORIGINAL project getting their rewards...vs backers of the project AFTER the original one?

Out of the 149 projects that I backed, I only lost my money from three of them. Kickstarter let's you know that if you don't think you can trust the creator, then don't back them. They tell you to try and research them before you back a project. I decided not to back many other projects, because I thought I was a scam. Some of them were and some weren't. And I did ask if I could get a refund for the three projects that I backed that I did lose my money, however I didn't get anything. Sure I'm upset about it, but I know that a refund isn't guaranteed, so I cant do anything about it. I just deal with it. One project that I back in 2015 and I still havent gotten the full reward yet. However he still post updates just about every month. And he shipped out half of the rewards. It's just one item from the rewards that hasn't been shipped yet. And no. It's not NEVER the creators fault. Sometimes it can be but this time and most of the times it's not. There could be problems with the manufacturer, but that's not something the creator can fix. They can't just walk in the factory and fix the machine that broke. Or completely rebuild a factory that burnt down to the ground. (Yes, both of those have happened to projects I backed.) Sure you can use the Corona virus as an excuse, because shipping and manufacturing has been very difficult to do since its started. However, that wasnt the only excuse Mr. Cup has provided since the campaign ended. For example on July 31, 2019 he asked us the backers for feedback about the back design. And he changed it to please us the backers. On November 16, 2019 he told us about the problems with his idea of wanting to hot foil the cards. And in that same update he mentioned about a few items shipping in early next year (2020). In January he mentioned he had to redesign the seals to have then printed and cut differently. He also showed all of the tuck boxes being printed. In February he announced that everything has been printed. Later in February he said the tucks and seals were being sent to Noir, and he mentioned the problem with the coin company. They told him they could make the coins but then dropped all communication with him and now he has to find a new company to make them probably at a higher price that the other company offered. In March he said the ESTIMATED time of shipment would be in April for everything except pledges that included coins, since they had just started production. Since then I'm sure that everything has been a huge pain, because everything around the world has slowed down for the Corona virus. And in his update on April 17 he said the likely shipping time will be June. He has been giving honest answers, however thing change. And unfortunately he can't predict the future.

You guys need to be patient. Especially with the corona virus going around. Mr Cup is an amazing artist. He has created many successful campaigns that have been delivered. I have also bought many things from his website and recieved them all in a timely manner. Except one where usps destroyed it, but Mr Cup replaced it free of charge. I have complete trust in him and do expect him to deliver this project. I'm sure this project will be very late because of the corona virus, but there is nothing he can do about it. Also you can not get a refund from kickstarter. When you pledge to a kickstarter, you are putting your trust and money into the project the creator is making. If the project somehow fails then it's your loss and your money is gone forever. However, some project creators are kind enough to give a full or partial refund even though they dont have to.

Richard, I am a Superbacker and I understand Kickstarter just as well as you do. Don't treat me like I am ignorant just because I question these delays. I shouldn't have to be following the creator on other social media to get updates. He should post them here.

I'm not trying to treat anyone like they are ignorant. It's completely fine to question delays, but asking for a refund just because it's being delayed is unreasonable. You are treating kickstarter more like a store and that's not what it is. Also the updates hes posting on social media arent worth making a whole new update on kickstarter. And the updates on kickstarter cover the little updates on his social media. For example he showed some little videos of the tucks being printed and he has already stated in a previous update saying they were done being printed. Once again I wasnt trying to offend you or anyone else in the comments. I was just trying to explain the rules of kickstarter to the people who didnt know. If I did offend you or other people, then I am sorry. That wasn't what i was trying to do.
Is it possible to get a refund? I have zero confidence I will receive something.

campaign.story:
Hi. I’m Shing Yin Khor, and for the past several years, I’ve been painting strange and wonderful creature friends. They appear in my webcomic, Otherworld Science, in gallery shows across the United States, and at several conventions and events annually. I’ve often been asked to compile them into an art book, and I finally have!
finished paintings on my workbench(technically a work floor, in this case).
Strange Friends is a postcard book featuring 20 paintings of odd creatures, furry, scaled, blerpy, and/or horned. It will be offset printed on a lush felted paper, and each postcard will be a art-print quality piece of art. The cover will be a lovely thick cardstock, with foil printing! I make beautiful objects, and I intend to make this one as fancy as I can!
Of course, I am a very practical person, so they are also nice postcards that should be sent to people you like. 
Here are some of the creatures that will be in the Strange Friends postcard book.
Good friends. Much friends.
This is a very straightforward Kickstarter - you can buy the postcard book, or buy multiple copies of the book. That's because I just want to make this book, and I want to make it a beautiful and special object! There is a one fancier option, where I'll hand-wrap the book for you so you can give it as a very thoughtful gift. For Kickstarter's Make 100 program, I am also making a care package edition, which allows me to indulge in telling weird little narratives through ephemera and other objects.
Here is a draft of what the cover will look like! I'll be hand painting it, and updating you on its progress in Kickstarter updates. The pink bits will be rendered on the cover in shiny foil! 
Digital First Draft - Strange Friends cover.
The Make 100 Care Package edition
I love making care packages, as my long-time Patreon subscribers can attest to, and this is a lovingly hand curated care-package of the Strange Friends postcard book, limited edition prints, heartfelt letters from fictional girls, and other delightful handmade ephemera and found objects. I don't want to spoil the arc of the tiny-story-in-a-package, but the keywords are: mysterious disappearances, summer camp, and special beasts. 
I’m using this as a platform to experiment with new found object narratives that won’t be available anywhere else!
Combining pledge levels
Please pledge at the highest pledge reward level listed that you would like, and add the additional cost of other reward levels you want to your pledge. 
Costs, and other details.
Printing costs for this book, including proofing, fancy foil printing, felted paper, and shipping from Malaysia, will cost approximately $11,500.00. I'll be printing an initial run of 2000 copies, and have budgeted an additional $4000 for shipping costs, print consulting fees, and production of the care package items. I'm requesting a little bit under this as my goal, as I will be funding approximately 1/3rd of the project myself.
The print consultant for this project is Rhiannon Rasmussen-Silverstein and music used in the video is Lobo Loco's Glueworm Evening Blues, from the Free Music Project.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've successfully run and fulfilled multiple Kickstarters! This will be my first time working with an international vendor, but I have a great print consultant, and have a lot of padding with my promised ship dates.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: As of today, we have put every single package that we have an address for in the mail! If you're international, give it about 2 weeks to get there. If you live in the US, you should have it in a week! Fulfillment COMPLETE. Mostly complete - there are about 31 of you that have not filled the backer survey, if you think this is you, log in to Kickstarter and you will have a notification up top telling you to do so. My fulfillment vendor and I will be checking monthly for new addresses and shipping packages, and fixing any errors, for at least the next six months.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping update, and some frequently asked questions!
updates.update_content:
As of this update, the Kickstarter is 86% fulfilled! That means that the majority of you have received your packages, and there are only 124 packages left to go! I am so grateful for my fulfillment partners at White Squirrel for handling the majority of this shipping and getting them all out to you safely! 
The ones that are left are:
Some in the gift wrap tier that have special requests like writing gift tags(I do this personally!)

My pallet of books is here!! There is another pallet headed to my fulfillment partner in a week or so, which means that books are going to START heading out very soon! I hope to start mailing the gift-wrapped books this week, and then we’ll get to the other tiers real soon.
They look so so good! I am so excited and happy and thankful!!
This is a reminder to fill out your surveys and check your addresses(I’ve allowed address updates)!!

I wasn't planning on putting a little sketchbook together this month, but it turns out I won't have my Strange Friends books in time for SDCC. I expected the shipment to arrive in late June, but with some deadline slippage on my end, the shipments will arrive in late July instead. This means that generally, all Kickstarter shipments promised for June are delayed by about a month, although I think that the ones promised for August and September will ship on time. I am sorry! It is hard to predict printer and cargo ship schedules.
However, surveys to get your address will be going out this week!

I got the bound proofs of Strange Friends in right before I left for some travel, and they look GREAT! The spot foil on the cover turned out beautifully, and it is exactly what I wanted!
Now, I wait for all the books to be printed, and then they will sit on a large cargo vessel for some weeks. I think we are still on track for the first batch to ship in July(give or take a couple weeks, which in the grand scheme of Kickstarter projects...I hope you will forgive me if they arrive in very early August!).

Getting into longer term projects means a lot of waiting, which is a very new thing for me. I've really gotten used to the cycle of making something, getting it up on the internet, and then getting it printed within weeks for a convention or show....my conception-to-product cycle is usually only about two months at longest! But, I do want to do more involved work, both with publishers and independently, and it is...a lot of waiting. I funded Strange Friends back in February(yay, we are awesome), and we are on track for printing soon and shipping in July(the books will spend over a month in a boat), but I JUST got the digital proofs for Strange Friends and they look great!

updates.update_userinfo: We did it! (And a cover preview!)
updates.update_content:
I'm late on this "yaaay, we funded" email, but I didn't want to dump an essentially meaningless update in your inbox, and I figured we could celebrate together once I got a little bit more progress to show you!
Yesterday, I started painting the cover for this book, and I thought you might want to have a look, as well as get a peek into my painting process.
I usually start with blue outlines on already primed watercolor paper, but in this case, I was less confident about all the elements that went on the page, so I did the sketch first(it is difficult to erase even the blue pencil on painted paper). You can see the start of the brown wash that form the background of most of my paintings.

I've had a few questions about what the back of the postcards look like. I wanted them to be simple but thoughtful, match the front of the postcards, and feel like they were custom made by a crypto-naturalist sending postcards from the field. 
The postcards will all have a short description of the creature on the front, as well as a few small spot illustrations. There are five different illustrated backs, and some of then have some extra drawings(like surprise mushrooms and worms!) peeking out.

campaign.story:
We are surrounded by rude, loud, smelly, selfish creatures who don’t know how to behave. Let’s do something about it.
This book offers 50 principles to help the ill-mannered behave with civility and grace. As a public service, I’ve illustrated these principles to make them vivid and easy to remember.
Full disclosure. Actually, I wrote the book so I’d have an excuse to draw strange creatures doing rude things.
Books don’t need to be big to be useful.
Rewards. Each sponsor of the project will receive one or more copies of this rare, collectible, hardcover book. I urge you to pledge at a level that gets you extras so you can share with friends. It also makes a perfect gift for young people whose behavior leaves room for improvement. Because the books are little and easy to wrap, they make superb gifts. 
Already perfect? If your behavior is already sophisticated and leaves no space for improvement, each page of the book will allow you to enjoy a delightful feeling of smug superiority as you contemplate how far below you most creatures are. Priceless.
Specifications
The size is A6 size (4.1" x 5.8", 105 mm x 148 mm). 68 B&W pages plus color end sheets and a color dust jacket. 
Illustrations. There are more than 50 drawings in Monster Etiquette and I created each of them especially for this book. It’s a visual extravaganza.
Dubious poetry. Each of the captions in this book is a small poem. It has been said that a good poem helps change the shape of the universe. Well these aren’t that kind of poem. These are like the poems Mrs. Katzenbarf taught me to write in 7th-grade English class...but worse. But they get the job done and may make you smile.
Getting started with advice about introductions
Spread addressing some airy topics.
From a chapter on mealtime behavior.
Includes topics to help build character.
Missed the previous book? If you missed my Kickstarter project to create the book Stay Home: The Ugly Truth About Space Travel, there are pledge levels to get them too (B and D). 



What the critics are saying...
“Farting is wrong? Who knew?”
“Nice drawings. They haunt my dreams.”
“Excellent gift for friends—especially those unaccustomed to Earthly ways.”
“A perfect blend of silly and practical.”
SCHEDULE
When will you receive your rewards? The book is written and the drawings are done. The page files are complete. I feel safe to promise July 2019. There’s still a lot of proofing, printing, binding, inspecting, and packing to do. I’ll push to make it sooner, but cannot promise.
SHIPPING
Where to? Kickstarter will add the cost of shipping to your pledge based on where you live. 
International shipping. In some countries, customs duties may be applied to print shipments. I have no way of predicting if they’ll apply to your shipment. Customs inspections are very arbitrary and willy-nilly. Most shipments slide through without any extra duties, but a few sponsors may find that a customs fee has been slapped on. I can’t predict it or avoid it. 
Pay attention. If you are an international sponsor and receive a tracking number when we ship, track your package daily to make sure it doesn’t get hung up in the system and returned to me. Don’t just assume it will show up at your door. Shipments have a way of getting stalled when they are nearly at your house, and monitoring the status of the tracking number allows you to intervene promptly—before the authorities send the package back.
LOOSE ENDS
Updates and progress reports. Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds but not so often that you think I’m an obnoxious pest.
Questions? Send me your questions and if I know the answer, I’ll add the Q and A to the FAQ section of this page.
Leftovers from my previous Kickstarter projects are available while supplies last at www.calamityware.com. Not only is this a good place to find some unusual gifts, but it is the only place you’ll find the world’s greatest shower curtain.
Don
Pittsburgh, February 15, 2019
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my 38th Kickstarter project. I’m starting to understand how they roll so the risk is relatively small. The book has already been written and illustrated. The page files are complete. If I get enough sponsors, I’ll be able to justify a production run. All the production steps are conventional—basically unchanged for hundreds of years. No dubious technological innovations are needed.

Of course, the project is still vulnerable to all the problems that fickle fate can throw at us (meteorites, wrinkles in the time-space continuum, fallible human beings, etc.).

I assure you, this project will get my almost-full attention until production is successfully completed. I haven’t let any of my Kickstarter sponsors down yet. Stick with me.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hello, my name is Ben McCain and I am a woodturner/woodworker living and working in Lincoln, NE. I have been a woodturner for around 6 years now. I am blessed to make works of functional art for a living. I am a grateful husband to the most wonderful person I know, my lovely wife Kiley. I am a proud dog father of the cutest german shepherd you have ever seen, and tender of three sassy chickens. A chicken tender if you will..... 
All jokes aside I am obsessed with what I do for a living. Few things bring me as much satisfaction as finishing a salad bowl that I have crafted from a tree. That being said I firmly believe that trees are best served as living organisms. Removing carbon dioxide and depositing oxygen into our atmosphere, as well as providing shelter to diverse ecosystems and being darn pretty to look at. It's easy to see why so many people are in love with trees and how important they are to society and the natural world. 
It is vital for me to convey this importance to every person who purchases one of my wares. Most of the trees that my products are crafted from lived much longer lives than any human and were planted/grown decades before I was born. It is my upmost desire that the honor and respect I put into this raw material is evident in the final product.
For this campaign, I am raising funds to incorporate a custom bowl drying kiln to my shop. This will create a much quicker turn around time for my salad bowl production as well as adding more control to the process overall. The funds will be used to purchase a small dehumidification kiln unit as well as foam insulation to craft the kiln chamber. This campaign offers a unique shopping opportunity, as I have marked the prices down substantially from my usual retail price. I have added reward levels for varying sizes of bowls. If you pledge at that level, I will turn a custom bowl of that size for you specifically. Each bowl will receive my usual brand as well as a number specific to this campaign. You will receive this bowl packed carefully with a free tin of board butter as well as care instructions and a hand written thank you note.  You will find more information about the different sizes of rewards below this section as well as in the rewards menu on the right. 
It all starts with the material. Here is a photo of some pieces of sycamore I harvested last summer. Almost all of the bowls I turn are made from salvaged trees in the Lincoln area.
As you can see here, I have to make design choices from the very beginning. Starting with how to process the raw material or log.
PLAY

Here you can see the initial shaping of the bottom of the bowl.
After rough turning, bowls are coated with a green wood sealer to help prevent cracking during the drying process.
A pile of rough turned bowls before getting stacked and sticker for air drying. The air drying process takes anywhere from 6-18 months. This is where the kiln comes in. Drying times can be reduced to weeks instead of months and years.
After they are dry. I put them back on the lathe for final turning. You can see the color difference between the fresh exposed wood and the exterior that has been exposed for months. The bowls are then sanded to a smooth finish.
The final step is the oiling process. I oil all of my bowls with a high quality walnut oil made specifically for salad bowls. The pieces are oiled a number of times and then polished using a walnut oil and beeswax paste.
Here you will find a section of finished products. The first being this figured Ash Bowl
Deep Honey Locust Salad Bowl
Black Walnut Salad Bowl
American Sycamore Salad Bowl
I hope that I have given you a glimpse into the process of making handmade salad bowls. It is a labor of love that is it worth it every single time I get to see a bowl come to life. Each and every piece is a unique tribute to it's host tree and the conditions it lived through. If you choose to support this campaign, I thank you from the bottom of my heart and promise that you will receive the very best product I am capable of making. Please feel free to visit us on social media to learn more, as well as our website. Thank you for looking!
Facebook - www.facebook.com/heartwoodhandcrafted
Instagram - www.instagram.com/heartwoodhandcrafted
Website - www.heartwoodhandcrafted.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Working with an organic material comes with its own interesting challenges. As badly as you wish to control the process, sometimes nature does what it wants to do. Drying bowls quicker than they want to dry naturally can lead to cracks or warping. The chance of this happening is the reason that I always expect to get 80% of the bowls I rough turn to survive. Planning this way ensures that anyone who has ordered a bowl will get one, and if I happen to have more than 80% survive, that's a bonus. Please feel free to reach out with comments, questions, or concerns. I would be delighted to answer any you might have.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Pinch Pot
support.descp: A small pinch pot measuring approximately 4"x1.5" Excellent for keeping fine cooking salts in a convenient location as well as many other spices/seasonings. Hand turned on the lathe and finished with walnut oil and beeswax.

support.title: French Rolling Pin
support.descp: A beautiful addition to any kitchen. Our tapered rolling pins are a joy to use and lovely to look at. They are hand turned on the lathe from a single piece of hardwood. (No glue seams here!) They measure 18" in length and approximately 1 3/4" in diameter. Finished with walnut oil and beeswax.

support.title: Single Serving Bowl
support.descp: A small individual eating bowl measuring approximately 8"x2.5" These bowls make for a perfect eating bowl for one. Treat yourself to a fresh salad or even serve a small side dish for two. Hand turned individually on the lathe and finished with walnut oil and beeswax.

support.title: Small Salad Bowl
support.descp: A small salad bowl measure approximately 9"x3" This small salad bowl will cheerfully serve two people. The depth to diameter ratio makes for a pleasantly deep bowl suitable for mixing a salad or serving a side dish for a larger dinner. Hand turned individually on the lathe and finished with walnut oil and beeswax.

support.title: Set of 4 Nut Bowls
support.descp: A set of four matching nut bowls. See description above for Individual Nut Bowl

support.title: Natural Edge Bowl
support.descp: A natural edge bowl measuring approximately 9"x3" This bowl has a wavy rim where the outside of the tree was. A beautiful center piece or small fruit bowl. Hand turned individually on the lathe and finished with walnut oil and beeswax.

support.title: Medium Salad Bowl
support.descp: A medium salad bowl measuring approximately 11"x3.5" This salad bowl is a go-to size for any home. It will happily serve 4-6 salad portions. It may also be used as a smaller fruit bowl. Hand turned individually on the lathe and finished with walnut oil and beeswax.

support.title: Large Salad Bowl
support.descp: A large salad bowl measuring approximately 14"x4" My largest bowl size for this campaign. A wonderful statement piece for any home. Serves 6-8 and can double as a fruit bowl or my personal favorite, popcorn bowl. Hand turned individually on the lathe and finished with walnut oil and beeswax.

support.title: Large Natural Edge Bowl
support.descp: A large natural edge bowl measuring approximately 13"x4" This large bowl features a wavy rim where the outside of tree used to be. Use as a statement piece, large fruit bowl, or salad bowl. Hand turned individually on the lathe and finished with walnut oil and beeswax.

support.title: Extra Large Salad Bowl
support.descp: A monster salad bowl, enough to feed an army! Measures approximately 17"x5" This salad bowl will serve 12-16 salad portions or one very hungry popcorn eater. Hand turned individually on the lathe and finished with walnut oil and beeswax.

support.title: Three Bowl Nested Set
support.descp: A nested set of three bowls. The Large Salad Bowl, Medium Salad Bowl and Small Salad Bowl. This set will be turned from one piece of wood and feature matching grain throughout. This is a showstopper to have in your kitchen and home! Finished with walnut oil and beeswax.

support.title: Small Nut Bowl
support.descp: A small bowl approximately 6"x2" These small bowls come in very handy around the kitchen. You can use them to keep nuts in, but they also work great when you are cooking and need to keep ingredients separate. Hand turned individually on the lathe and finished with walnut oil and beeswax.

updates.update_content: Hello all, I apologize for my lack of presence as of late. It has been a hectic time of year! I am happy to say that the first few reward levels are getting oiled as we speak and will be shipped out first thing next week. I will post some photos of the oiling and waxing process in a separate update. I apologize for the tardiness of the rewards as I seemed to be a bit naive with how long it would take especially considering the overwhelming success and over funding that the campaign received. If you pledged for multiple reward levels, your package will be shipped when the largest item is finished. If anyone has any further questions please message me. Thanks again everyone!

Hello everyone! Happy Monday/Earth Day! I just realized due to a respectful reminder from one of you lovely backers that it has been some time since I've posted an update. I apologize for the lack of behind the scenes info. I am a one man show and sometimes trying to make a living as a craftsperson can be overwhelming. I own up to the fact that I am running behind on shipping pledges, but rest assured I am working on your lovely items. If you have any questions comments or concerns please reach out. The spice bowls and rolling pins will be shipping soon! I will post a few photos of the productions and packing. Thank you all again so much and have a wonderful Earth Day!

Hello everyone and Happy Thursday! I wanted to update you all on where we are at. I received the funds from Kickstarter a few days ago and have ordered all of the listed supplies and equipment. Some if it has already arrived! I am very excited to get the kiln built as soon as everything gets here. As for the March rewards, I will post another update when they are sent out. Since they are smaller items, they can be made from previously dried timber. Thanks again for all of your support and please reach out if you have any questions. I noticed there are a few people who have not yet filled out their survey. Please do so as soon as you can. It has the option to select your preferred wood type but more importantly your shipping address! I hope everyone has a great weekend!

updates.update_userinfo: We did it! Thank you all so much!
updates.update_content: Hello everyone, We did it! WOW! I honestly can not believe we hit $10K. You guy have been awesome and I can't wait to get all of your rewards sent. There's just one more day left so we will see who else wants to join in on the fun, but I wanted to thank all of you who have made this project possible. I thought I would share what I feeling like last night seeing that we went over $10K so here is a gif that best captures that emotion....

We hit 100 backers! You all have been so amazing and I am forever grateful. We have just about 5 days left in the campaign and I wanted to offer a special reward for hitting 100 backers if there was any interest. I originally intended to only do salad bowls on this campaign, but seeing as it has been so successful, I wanted to ask all of you if there would be any interest in rolling pins. This would be a $30 reward level plus $7 shipping to US. I am limiting this reward to 15. If you are a current backer who would like one, you can add $37 to your current pledge for US backers and $50 for International backers. Then send me a message to let me know you would like to add one. Below is a photo of some examples. Happy Weekend everyone!

This has been a crazy few weeks you guys. I am humbled and overwhelmed from the support of you wonderful people! This is my last goal update. Whatever happens from here, I am more than grateful.  As an enticing reward for you guy, I have decided to include a wooden kitchen tool in with every backer if we reach $10,000. If everyone shared the link to some friends I have no doubt we would reach that goal. Below you will see a picture of one of the kitchen tools. They work well as a spatula or kitchen scraper, mixing together dough, or using as a grill scraper. Thank you all again so much for your support! It means the world.

I keep setting goals I believe to be lofty or unattainable and you guys keep crushing them! This experience has been so humbling. I decided to set another goal just for kicks. You all have been so amazingly generous and I can't thank you enough.

updates.update_userinfo: Walnut Oil finish and substitute options.
updates.update_content: Hello everyone. Thank you all again for your tremendous support. I have had an inquiry about the oil I am using for these bowls. I use Mahoney's Walnut Oil, which is a heat treated walnut oil wood finish. This process removes the protein causing nut allergies and is completely safe for food use. However, I understand some people have extreme and even lethal nut allergies. If you are not comfortable with the bowl being finished with walnut oil, I will gladly finish it individually with mineral oil instead. If you have any additional concerns not answered in this update, please feel free to message me.

Thank you all so much for your generation support. I have posted two sizes of natural edge bowls in the rewards list. Below you will find some example photos of what they look like. Some will have the bark still attached and others it will be stripped off. There is limited quantity available so snatch them up while you can! Thanks again to everyone who has already backed this campaign!

campaign.story:
The  project is simple... I guess.   
These are paintings of disappearing animals..  If we don't preserve them you and your family.. and future family ..may never get chance to see them....   These are Endangered Animals.
 This project is more to remind folks how quickly these animals are disappearing and  to honor them in each painting.  
 I hope you will enjoy each of these disappearing  guys and girls...and yes they have hats!
This year, If this project is successful..  Proceeds from this campaign  will go to help support the WWF (https://www.worldwildlife.org/).  Let's make some great art and do something meaningful.
 Now that we have reached our Campaign Goal!!  Let's have some FUN!!  
 If you are in the $16- $40 range it will be the Art Card size! If you are 50 or above it will be the 5 x 7 size!! 

NEW REWARD!!                BOOBY  Love!!! To celebrate getting 1/4 through the series!!
Booby Love
NEW REWARD!!                Manatee Love!!! To celebrate hitting the 1 week mark  in my MAKE 100!! 
Mantee Love.. New Reward!!
You can custom your Manatee Love... just tell me what you want.. or make it a surprise!
Please READ MY 2/3/2019 UPDATED to see how each on of these are made and painted!!  Thanks you for the support and all the kinds words!!  


Check my Post Updates for the latest in the collection!

Hello Art Friends,
All of the rest of originals paintings from this project have been listed on Etsy.  I know a few of you were interested in getting another painting to add to your collection.  I hope to list some prints on Etsy soon as well.  Here is a link to my page.  www.poordogfarm.etsy.com
  Thanks again for those of you that have checked out my latest project!  If you haven't followed along, I am having a lot of fun with this new Amphibian and Reptile project! updates.update_userinfo: Thank you and a NEW adventure begins!!
updates.update_content:
Hello Friends,
Another huge thank you hug  for helping me with this project!  I truly appreciate all the kind words and patience during the process.  Kickstarter is a great place for artists and just some great folks.  At this point we are down to 2 backers and mailed them today..  
I also wanted to share that I started a new adventure !!  Make 100 Amphibians and Reptiles You Will Never See Again.  It is a lot like the bird project a few years ago, but I thought these little ones should get a voice as well. There are too many of these creatures that are not around anymore.. I hope to honor each one in a little painting ( and yes in a hat).    I hope you come check out my new project and stay for the fun!!

Thought this might be cool to see... 
                        …. as well as easy for those of you that are picking the originals.  ( :

All of the final 5x7 matted prints have left !! I had over 200! Wow! Thank you again.
There are about 6 folks should hear from me this week about originals.. I am mailing them out as soon as you pick!!
Thanks again for making this project happen and everyone for the kind words!!

Happy New Year!! Just a few updates! Thank you again for your patience as I get all your artwork to you! — All of the Manatee Love paintings and Booby Love painting have left the farm! I am excited to see what you all think. Each one had your hats and scarves you all requested !! That was some work!!
— I am hoping to get the last of the matted pick 5 prints out in the next week or so... I have about 8 of you left..

Thank  you x 100!!!
Thank you all for the messages and checking in.  There is a saying "when it rains it pours"..  The past 2 months were a bit rough.  I had an unplanned surgery, and right after that we had an ACL tear and surgery for my daughter..   
The good news is I got out and was able to get  a bunch of art out in the mail last week and this week.  Most of it was already packaged.. just need to be sent.  I am hoping to get the remaining work out to you in the next few weeks.  Thank you again for all the great replies and messages about the art.  I am glad those that have gotten theirs are enjoying it!!  I am working on all the rest.  I am excited to hear what you all think about the Disappearing Animals series.

Just a quick update. All 5 x 7 prints are out as well as the single surprise small prints. The rest of the Random pick 5 and random pick 10 are leaving today!! I am almost finished matting all of the You Pick prints as well! Focusing on originals and the custom painted Manatees this week!! Thanks again for all the great feedback and support. Even my little beta fish is liking her art! Take care.

The first batch of prints have left the farm!!  Single surprise Disappearing Animals went out yesterday.  The 5 x 7 "You Picks" are leaving today as well as the 10 surprises!
  The prints turned out amazing!  Hope everyone enjoys the art!  More to leave the farm tomorrow!
Thanks again for the support of my artwork!!

Let's get some Artwork delivered!!  Thank you for all your kind words and messages.  It was a slow recovery.. and I can  paint and hold brushes!! 
Everyone should have received your surveys by now.  Please respond with your address and for some of you your "picks".  My hope is to start shipping out some artwork by next week!
Thank you again for your patience and understanding !  I am looking forward to hearing what you think about the art!

Hello all! Just a quick update...sorry it’s been a bit. I had a few issues including 7 stitches to my hand. I am healing..and hoping no nerve damage. Never fun...
I will be sending out some information to you in the next few days about print and painting information. I hope to start mailing art out by next week! Thank you again for the support! Take care, Sam Georgieff

campaign.story:
I discover letterpress printing 10 years ago. It basically change my way of designing. My first items were my own business cards, and soon I created a set of 4 coasters to explore the possibilities. Limited (as all my products) they are sold out for a long time.
With first printing, I create prototype of a wood box for a set of 8 coasters, but it never goes further, only 5 were made to see how it looks like. 
To celebrate the past 10 years, I decided to reprint the original coasters, create a set of 4 more coasters and an edition of 100 with the wood box as the part of the Kickstarter MAKE 100 project.
WOOD MAKER
The wood box will be strictly limited to 100 copies, and made in France by Thibault Malet, who work with me on other projects. Based on 1st prototype created 10 years ago, he will handmade them in his workshop.
Here is the prototype we did and want to produce. 
THE LETTERPRESS PRINTING & STUDIO PRESSION
The coasters will be printed in France, at Studio Pression, my printing partner for the past 6 years. Letterpress printing has the ability to create relief into paper by adding tons of pressure while printing. It’s called deep impression. And it’s done at the same time, printing AND debossing, always one color at a time. The thicker the paper, the deeper the impression. For a crisper effect, we use much harder magnesium plates instead of photopolymer. Here come some pictures of last year printing.
THE REWARDS
THE LETTERPRESS CALENDAR
Added of the coasters I will add copies of both edition of my 2019 letterpress. They will be send right at the end of the campaign, while the coasters would be produced a little later.
The calendar is created with 11 others worldwide designers, each creates an unique design based on an inspiring sentence.
The STANDARD edition of the calendar comes with black cover with gold and black hot foil, pages are letterpress printed in black on white an grey paper. The DELUXE edition comes with a gold cover with gold and black hot foil, all the pages are hot foil printed on black paper.
More picture are available here.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every new Kickstarter is challenge, but also an experience. Hope it will be another nice success. I will use backerkit at the end of the campaign to have the address as soon as possible for the calendars and send them as soon as possible. The coasters will be produced according to both Studio Pression and Thibault Malet planning but May seems a good timing, right in time for summer !
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

comments.content: Thank you for my beautiful coasters and the wooden box is fine cheers.

I like the coasters, very nice, well done. Top marks. Definite minus in the B-Vote: The wood-box is just that, a box of raw, untreated wood, so no oil, no lacquer whatever, applied. It is also quite rough, so not a lot of time spent polishing either. Aaaand last - but not least - it is a very tight fit. Which may be intended, but a mm more for a bit of wiggle room would have been nice, but maybe that's just me. So: box needs a lot of TLC and elbow grease with sandpaper and a nice oil. Weekend project. Why am I nagging? Looking at your project pictures, I expected at bit more from the box. Sorry for nagging :-)
29 days since last update, any word on this? I received a shipping notice from LaPoste, but now sure if it is this campaign or your other one :)
No updates for 3 months, any now?

campaign.story:
The idea is simple... Make 100 Endangered Animals with TRUMP Hair! 
....yes #make100 endangered animals with trump hair! 
The Headlines in the news is all about the bipartisanship, the battle over "The Wall", government shut down, and Russia..  but there are other issues that need to be seen... bad hair..
The beginings of Painting no 1
Do any of these look natural to you yet ?
adding the details and hair... the most important part here!!
My goal is to make some great paintings with presidential hair as well as bring awareness to the disappearing ones on our planet... the focus are Endangered Animals.   They do not have a voice, but do need our support.  
In the studio
If this project is successful..  Proceeds from this campaign  will go to help support the WWF (https://www.worldwildlife.org/).  Let's make some great art and help out!! 
Check my Post Updates for the latest in the collection!
no 5 The Giant Panda with Presidential Hair
no. 6 Red Panda with Trump Hair
n0 7 A TRUMP Toad??
n0. 8 The Northren White Rhino
No 9 The Golden Cheeked Warbler..with Trump wig

updates.update_content:
In honor of this special day, I have posted all my originals I started for this project up for sale.  Let's just say, the TRUMP hairs have taken over a good part of my Etsy Shop!  You can check them out at www.poordogfarm.etsy.com

Thanks again for your support as we started this project!!

Hello Friends,
Thank you again for letting me take this project off-line and into a new directions.  I am excited and energized by this new make 100.  The idea is close to this one... Make 100 Disappearing Animals.  I hope you come check out this new beginning!  I am ready to take this to 100!  I have already started n0 4 in the collection!
Take care,

I hope everyone received my email I sent you.  I really do appreciate the support of my make 100.  But, to be honest the thought of painting 100 of these with Trump hair is wearing on me..  It really could be the Trump hair...  
I am hoping you will enjoy the new Make 100 / Disappearing Animals... much like this one, focusing on Endangered Animals,  but definitely not much Trump Hair!! ( :
Here is a sneak peak... I am hoping to launch something in the next 24 hours!!  I am very excited with these!!  Much like my 100 Birds You Will Never See Again!

Steady on with Trumpies... or a New Beginning?
Ok.. so there are 13 backers, as of today, and  I would love to hear your input.  I am not sure I can do 100 of these when I am against most things Trump.
I am considering restarting..    I want to give it a few days to think about..  If you are really wanting more Trumpies... I can go on... If you think a new direction.. ok..
The more I paint these, I have realized that this hair doesn't look good on anything. Even this Endangered bird from the state of Texas, looks wrong...

The hint to this Trump-ish Rhino is what the bird is trying to tell you.  
As of March 19, 2018, there were only two known  white rhinos left, both of which are female. There still maybe a few male northern white rhinos elsewhere in Africa..but not documented.
A Trump-ish Arroyo Toad.  Yep... they are native to California and only about 3,000 of these little toads left.
Red Pandas are found in the Himalayas in China and are also called red-cat bears.  They are considered Endangered due to habitiat loss and poaching...
Threated by poachers as well as habitat loss, pandas are considered Vulnerable Species a

comments.content: Very glad to see you back Sam. You are very talented artist! I enjoy learning about the endangered animals and seeing what you do next.

campaign.story:
Cards will be printed in the USA by USPCC, printer of Bicycle® cards since 1885.
Experience an art masterpiece like never before! This creative deck of playing cards gives you an up close and intimate relationship with the painting "The Starry Night" by Vincent van Gogh.  
The cards allow you to truly admire the work of the artist by showing you every stroke and color in detail, every decision he made to bring the vision to life. Hold the artist's story in your hands; linger on the subtle details.
Each card features a detail of The Starry Night by Vincent van Gogh.  Put the cards together to recreate the painting.  It is a challenging puzzle!
Play cards and have a great time with family and friends while admiring a wonderful piece of art.
The Personal Touch
The ranks are sampled from Vincent's own handwriting from personal letters to his brother, Paul Gauguin, and others. The suits are made of shapes found in his paintings.
The Starry Night
More pictures below.
The cards will be printed by USPCC, on their Classic Stock, with a linen finish and will include a custom tuck box.
Made in the USA since 1885 
Sustainable forest paper 
Starched-based laminating 
Vegetable-based inks 
Proprietary Bicycle® playing card stock means premium quality playing cards 
Visit the website to give the puzzle a try!
AceTwoThree.games
Drag and Drop the Images to Create the Painting
Add-ons
Add more to your pledge to receive additional decks
Would you like to order more decks or add an uncut sheet suitable for framing? Simply add the extra fee to your pledge and you can confirm your choices after the campaign is funded.
Receive an additional Masterpiece deck by increasing your pledge by $10 USD for each additional deck.  Before product is shipped you will be able to choose which deck you want to receive, van Gogh or Botticelli. Botticelli cards are limited!  I will post an update here if the quantity runs out. 
Receive an uncut sheet for display by increasing your pledge by $45 USD for each sheet.
Receive additional bricks of the deck by increasing your pledge by $100 for each brick.
Botticelli
I have a limited quantity of cards available from my first campaign, "The Birth of Venus" by Sandro Botticelli.  
Cards Ace through 10 of the four suits can be put together to see the painting as a whole.  Combining three court cards zooms in for a much closer look at 4 different sections of the timeless artwork. 
You can mix some of each deck in your pledge. For example, 6 Starry Night decks and 6 Venus decks in a brick.
Backer's say:
"Received today. Terrific! Never understood why people weren't lining up in their thousands to back this; it's a wonderful card deck. We are the lucky few. Bravo, Creator."
"It is beautiful. Absolutely beautiful! I look forward to your future campaigns."
"Very nice touches on the tuck box. I'm looking forward to your next project. Thank you again for your work on this one."
Visit this interactive page to drag and drop the cards and create the painting!
    More images of The Starry Night deck
The tuck box is a work in progress
Proposed uncut sheet, mock up.
Uncut sheet from production run.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have been a Kickstarter backer since 2012, backing over 50 projects to-date. This is my second Masterpiece Deck offered on Kickstarter. 

The layout and design of the deck are complete and the prototype looks amazing. I have chosen USPCC as the printer because of their strict attention to detail, quality of the card stock, and their decades of reliability. This will be my second project with USPCC.

Steps remaining: 
1. Finalize the design and color optimization. 
2. Print. 
3. Inspect. 
4. Ship.

The step most likely to cause a delay is #1, prepping the digital image for high-quality printing.

Print delays can also happen because of an error in the specifications, errors in scheduling, or not passing inspection (step #3).

In my previous playing card campaign I underestimated the amount of time it would take from funding to shipment of product. With this in mind, I have extended the delivery date for this campaign. 

The work by van Gogh and his handwriting are in the public domain. Video music track is provided by https://www.bensound.com/.

All images above and in the video are of a prototype and subject to change. Any changes made will only be to improve colors and layout.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: USPCC was able to quickly set up the updated tuck box and send a digital proof.  I approved the proof.  Files are ready to print!
I received and approved the digital proofs for the fronts and back of the cards.  I had to make a change to the tuck box.  Hopefully that can be reset quickly.

updates.update_userinfo: Today's lesson: Get a physical proof!
updates.update_content:
I received the digital proofs of the Starry Night deck and everything looked in order.  However, I couldn't quiet a nagging sense of something being 'off.'  I subsequently received a physical, uncut sheet and was not at all happy with what I saw. I couldn't spot any errors; I just knew that the images were not as stunningly beautiful as they should be.  I eventually went back to the source image to compare it with my image files.  The colors were off.  My files were skewed to a purple-ish blue and a bit muddy.  
I quickly made revisions and the files are on their way to the printer. I also changed the back of the cards.  See image.
Surveys will be launching later today!

updates.update_userinfo: Survey will be launching this week!
updates.update_content: I completed all the steps of setting up the project survey with CrowdOx.  It was reviewed by them and I have no changes to make!  They only had a few questions, which I answered, and am waiting for their final approval.

The art files needed some adjustments. I was able to make the adjustments right away and get them back to the printer. They followed up with this:
"Prepress just called and all the new files are good to go! I’ll put the job in the prepress queue for workup and send you the digital proofs as soon as I have them back."

campaign.story:
Introduction
Whether you are an art lover or an animal enthusiast, this is an exhibition that will arouse comments and passionate interest. 
This is the first exhibition ever made dedicated to animals in history of art, ranging from the Renaissance to the late eighteenth-century. It will feature over a hundred paintings, acquired from museums and private collections worldwide: we’re giving life to a congeries of animals of a unique kind, a species made immortal through the craftsmanship of its painters.
About the exhibition
In the history of art, animals of different kinds and species have been portrayed and many of them often concealed a symbolic meaning. As a matter of fact, the relationship between animals and art is a matter of iconography: for instance, did you know that the tiny dog of the Arnolfini portrait by Jan van Eyck represents marital fidelity? Did you know that the Unicorn in art symbolizes royalty and chastity? And think about the power of all those biblical characters like St Jerome and the lion, John the Baptist and the lamb... 
The idea behind the exhibition is to bring to the public’s attention the essential role that animals often had in the history of art as well as to raise awareness towards animal welfare. Furthermore, this is an opportunity to learn how the alliance between man and animal has changed - or stayed the same - over the years.  
Of the vastness of art history, we focused on a programme of ten thematic sections: 
Animals in sacred paintings: symbols and allegories
Animals in paintings with a mythological subject
Animals and man: a millennial relationship
Dogs
Cats
Fish, reptiles and insects
Birds
Farm animals
Dwarves against animals
Exotic and imaginative animals
Thanks to the partnership with the Department of Natural Sciences of the University of Pisa, we’ll include essential information on ancient races and their evolution throughout the centuries. 
The WWF cooperation and our help to the "Backing the Rhinos to survive" project
By virtue of its cultural, artistic and scientific importance, WWF gave us their patronage: so significant to us as we want to bring to the visitors attention our concern towards themes such as the conservation of biodiversity, the protection of wildlife as well as the fight against illegal hunting. We will donate part of the amount we will raise to the WWF safeguard project "Backing the Rhinos to survive", a conservation campaign to protect rhinos in Africa and Asia through microchipping and translocation to safer areas.
Why we need your support: the catalogue and the virtual tour project
We need a hand to help cover the catalogue printing costs as well as the virtual tour development. The catalogue will consist of 260 color pages and will be published by Silvana Editoriale, one of the most respected italian art-book editors, and it will include all these paintings as well as all the stories and curiosities behind each artwork. Furthermore, we want to bring all the backers, wherever they are in the world, along with us in a virtual tour of our rooms, to take a thorough look at all the paintings and give them the chance to learn everything about these masterpieces. An immersive, mesmerizing and very detailed virtual circuit among creatures, pets and beasts and the artful brush strokes of their painters.
The curator
The exhibition is curated by Davide Dotti, an italian art historian and curator from Brescia, Italy.
So far he curated 22 exhibitions in prestigious museums and cultural institutions both in Italy and abroad and today he’s in charge of Palazzo Martinengo’s exhibition space, where “Animals in Art” will be hosted. 
Opening dates and venue
The exhibition will run from 19th January to 9th June 2019 in Brescia (ITALY), right in the old city center, where the beautiful Renaissance Palazzo Martinengo dwells: that is our exhibition’s venue.
Thank you for your support and we hope you can come and pay us a visit in Brescia!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The only risks for this project are undertaken by the Palazzo Martinengo association, in charge of the exhibition. The catalogue layout as well as the virtual tour project are already being prepared. We still need to be sustained to cover these expensive costs and to be aided in the "Backing the Rhino" campaign associated to this exhibition. Thanks.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Take your pick from 200 rare travel photographs from 1870-1930 that I will restore to crisp perfection.....or select them all!  
Climbing Paradise Glacier in Mt. Rainier National Park, Washington ( 1911-1920 )- Curtis & Miller/National Photo Company
What is The Grand Tour about? 
Relive a bygone age of discovery and romance. Before the age of jet-travel and Eurorail, intrepid men and women explored the four-corners of the world via sailing ships, ocean liners, trains such as the Orient Express and the Trans-Siberian Railway, or via bicycle, camel, donkey, or foot. 
This was an era when traveling the world was a thrilling new possibility for those with the resources, time, and pluck to take those first steps outside of their home. Few individuals had even seen photographs of such exotic places as Bali, Kenya, or Brazil and yet were brave enough to embark on extended journeys to places unknown. 
This campaign is a celebration of that era. 
The Rameseum of El-Kurneh, Thebes ( 1857 ) - Photographed by Francis Frith / The Metropolitan Museum of Art
Two-hundred ( 200 ) rare travel images from archives around the world have been selected and will be brought back to their original splendor by being digitally restored to high-definition sharpness. You will be the recipient of these newly-restored photos and can enjoy them in digital format or by taking your pick with an 8x10" print. 
Last year, during Kickstarter's Make 100 initiative I chose to unearth 100 rarely-seen historic images for a restoration project entitled "The Past in Focus". The support I received from the Kickstarter community was tremendous and humbling, too. Little did I realize that so many other people were interested in seeing these rare images digitally restored!
This year, I am continuing the restoration work with this new endeavor - The Grand Tour. The Grand Tour is your passport to experiencing the romance, elegance, and adventure that enthralled passengers of the golden age of travel. Take a journey back in time along with me!
View of Venice, Italy ( 1890-1900 ) Photochrom/Library of Congress
What Kind of Images Are Being Restored?
The pyramids of Egypt, ancient ruins, Turkish mosques, the bustling Riviera, snow-capped temples of Japan, the Grand Canyon, the rushing falls of Niagara, ooh-la-la Paris..... you'll see all the locations that travel agencies such as Cook's Tours would have offered in the late-1800s. 
Coastal View of Brazil ( 1860s-1880s ) - Marc Ferrez/The J. Paul Getty Museum
At the conclusion of the campaign, all 200 of the restored images from "The Grand Tour" will be available for viewing online and you can then make your pick of which image you want to frame for your home. Enjoy a mystery? I can surprise you with a print! 
If you can't decide which photo you would like to own, then you can own them all - The Grand Tour Image Collection will include all 200 images fully-restored as downloadable hi-res jpegs ( 1200-5800px ) so you can make 5x7",  8x10", or 16x20" and larger prints yourself. 
Temple of Athena, Aegina Island, Greece ( 1850-1880 )/Library of Congress
The majority of these images will be unearthed from the largest and most magnificent photo collection in America - the Library of Congress - but I will peruse libraries from the far corners of the world as well... libraries such as the Rijksmuseum, the National Maritime Archives of Australia, The J. Paul Getty Museum, and The British Library. 
Promenade and Grand Salon, Trouville, France ( c1890-1900 ) / The Library of Congress
Libraries make it a practice to scan photographs and then upload them to their archives untouched and unrestored. Most need color correction, sharpening, and a great deal of spot cleaning to bring them to vibrant life again. It takes me anywhere from 10-45 minutes to clean and restore each photo. If "The Grand Tour" gets successfully funded, I'll be taking time off from my small business to focus on the digital restoration of these 200 images. 
The original image scans will come from a variety of different photo types: albumen prints, glass plate negatives, photographic prints, stereoviews, photochroms and autochroms. 
One of the photographs before restoration......
....and then after restoration!
My sister and I operate a home-based photo business, so making beautiful photographs is our specialty. All 8"x10" photographs will be printed and cut by hand in our home studio. They will be printed on Canon premium luster photo paper with Chromalife inks ( 150+ year lifespan ). All photos are archival so you'll have a print that one day will be as old as the image printed on it!  
THE GRAND TOUR COLLECTION 
This grand image collection contains all 200 photographs restored for this project. Each image is in JPEG format at 300dpi, ranging in size from 2500-5500 pixels ( 1.5-6mb each ). Since this makes for a very heavy file, they will be zipped up neatly in one downloadable .zip file. Since the project is not completed yet, I don't know what the full size of this zip would be, but make sure you have space on your computer! 
What could you do with these files? Just about anything you like. Almost all of the photographs are in the public domain meaning you are free to be as creative with them as you like. The few that are licensed as Creative Commons or Attributive will be marked as such. You could use the photos for a book project, make albums with them, frame them as wall art, or if you want to open up your own photography gallery and sell prints, you could do that, too! 
The collection will also include a listing of with each photo's title, the photographer ( if available ), date, and source ( this is especially useful if you want to browse more photos on your own! ). 
THE PAST IN FOCUS - SECOND EDITION
The second edition of The Past in Focus was completed last July but only offered as a pre-order to those who backed the first Make 100 project. Now it is available for everyone! 
This collection contains 100 rare historic photographs dating from 1851-1946 and, unlike the first edition of The Past in Focus, each digital file is sent in its largest hi-res size so you can make prints for yourself. All images are in the public domain. This, too, will be sent as one downloadable large .zip file containing all one hundred individual JPEGS. 
Here is a tiny sample of some of the photographs included in this edition: 
Leigh Brintnell outside his Fokker Super-Universal airplane ( 1935 )/ Provincial Archives of Alberta
Arizona. Grand Canyon, photographer suspended on climber's rope ( 1908 )/Kolb Brothers Photographers
Playing a game of "slå på ring" at Folkefjellet ( 1910 ) - Paul Stang/Fylkesarkivet i Sogn og Fjordane
Strongman Paul Remos hoists his son in the air to feed a giraffe at the zoo ( 1930s )/Library of Congress
Navajo Indian warming hands over fire in tepee ( 1915 ) - William J. Carpenter/Library of Congress
Dancing Lesson - The "Mazurka" ( late 1800s ) - Karl Karlovitz Bulla/The J. Paul Getty Museum
SAILS & SPARS COLLECTION
This bonus set of 25 photographs includes images of yachts, three-masted sailing ships, steamers and ocean liners dating from 1870-1930. All images are fully-restored hi-res jpegs sent in one downloadable .zip file. 
THE BONUS SETS
Take a peek at my first Kickstarter campaign - The Past in Focus - and you will see that as the campaign grew in size more and more photos were added onto it. These "bonus" images amounted to over 175 photos. With The Grand Voyager you will be receiving all of these bonus sets as well. Pretty neat, huh? 
Ready to embark on The Grand Tour? 
If this project is successfully funded than all images will be restored and available for download in March, 2019. Grab your ticket to the past now! 
A British tourist arriving in Sudan, Africa ( 1936 )/Matson Photo Service Collection
NEW STRETCH GOALS!! 
It's the final week of the campaign so it is time to spice up the set a little bit....
.....if the project reaches $7500 
Everyone who pledged at the $40 reward level and higher will also receive The Nordic Journey, a collection of 20 beautiful images of Finland, Norway, Iceland, Denmark and Sweden. 
.....if the project reaches $9500
....Great Britain in Color, a collection of 25 lovely photochroms will also be included. 
....and best of all, if the project reaches $12,000....
...then The Past in Focus-The Third Edition will be included FREE to everyone who backed at the $40 reward level and higher! This set of 100 hi-res restored historic images will not be available until Fall/Winter 2019, but you'll be the first to receive it once it gets released! ( a $35 value ).
MISSED THE PROJECT? 
THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO SUPPORTED THE GRAND TOUR! 
If you missed The Grand Tour campaign and would like to buy the set, check out the link at the very top of this page or simply click on this link below to make your purchase. - Diana
https://www.silverbankspictures.com/the-past-in-focus

This isn't a very risky project, is it?

campaign.story:
I love to draw. The drawings I like best make me laugh. The aim of this Kickstarter project is to find homes for 100 of my original drawings in art collections like yours.
Where do these drawings come from? These are drawings from my previous Kickstarter projects creating porcelain, textiles, t-shirts, books, and other nonsense. There are also some new drawings from projects that are not yet complete but may appear on Kickstarter soon. The suite of drawings has already been selected. It includes monsters, aliens, exotic creatures, and a few robots.
I draw characters every day. Get one to add whimsy to your art collection.
What is the reward for supporting this project? In addition to the warm glow you will experience from supporting the arts, you will also receive a unique, original drawing. These are signed ink drawings on heavy-weight, acid-free paper. You’ll also receive a lavishly pompous certificate of authenticity to document the drawing’s back story.
Your drawing will be matted (also acid-free) so you can pop it in any sufficiently elaborate 8" x 10" frame. Or you can have your framer redo the whole thing from scratch. Perhaps a gilded frame with cherubs?
Documentation will make it easier when you give your collection to an art museum later.
Why would someone want one of these drawings? That’s an excellent question. Here are three reasons:
• Like to have original artworks in your art collection.
• Like weird creatures doing inexplicable things.
• Like to receive packages from Don.
Here are some samples from the suite of 100.
[21] Bug-eyed alien with pipe
[17] Orc in a bunny suit
[14] Creature coping with inadequate gravity
[15] Enthusiastic alien with mismatched eyes
Let Fate decide
Will sponsors be able to choose their drawing? No. I have no way to manage individual requests without driving myself mad. Instead, sponsors and drawings will be matched up randomly by blind fate.
Each original comes in a mat like this so it’s ready to pop in a standard 8"x10" frame.
When will the rewards go out? This project will be active until the end of January. By the time the project ends on Kickstarter, all the drawings will be packed up and ready to ship. As soon as Kickstarter collects the pledges, I can send out the address survey. Shipping should be able to start around March 1, 2019.
International shipping. In some countries, customs duties may be applied to print shipments. I have no way of predicting if they’ll apply to your shipment. Customs inspections are very arbitrary and willy-nilly. Most shipments slide through without any extra duties, but a few sponsors may find that a customs fee has been slapped on. I can’t predict it or avoid it. 
Pay attention. If you are an international sponsor and receive a tracking number when we ship, track your package daily to make sure it doesn’t get hung up in the system and returned to me. Don’t just assume it will show up at your door. Shipments have a way of getting stalled when they are nearly at your house, and monitoring the status of the tracking number allows you to intervene promptly—before the authorities send the package back.
Updates and progress reports. Sponsors of this project will receive periodic updates through Kickstarter as the project unfolds but not so often that you think I’m an obnoxious pest.
Questions? Send me your questions and if I know the answer, I’ll add the Q and A to the FAQ section of this page.
Leftovers from my previous Kickstarter projects are available while supplies last at www.calamityware.com. Not only is this a good place to find some unusual gifts, but it is the only place you’ll find the world’s greatest shower curtain.
Don
Pittsburgh, January 4, 2019
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my 37th Kickstarter project. I’m starting to understand how they roll so the risk is relatively small. These drawings are done and already matted. So risk is small. 

Of course, the project is still vulnerable to all the problems that fickle fate can throw at us (meteorites, wrinkles in the time-space continuum, fallible human beings, etc.).

I assure you, this project will get my almost full attention until production is successfully completed. I haven’t let any of my Kickstarter sponsors down yet. Stick with me.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
