campaign.story:
Can you hear that? A faint tap-tap-tap at the window? A scratching at the door? Those are the sounds of my nightmares trying to get in. They want to tell their stories and delight in making you gasp. They've already filled one book full of mystery and now they are back and want to slide onto the pages of another book to make you shudder and snort in terror forevermore.
Hello! I'm the writer and creator of the Bertram Fiddle Adventure games and work as a children's illustrator and character designer at  Rumpus Animation in Bristol, UK. Last year I self-published 100 Days of Mystery - a collection of scratchy ink drawings set in a Victorian world full of crooked houses and creepy characters that I kickstarted as part of the Make100 initiative. It took me a lot longer to complete than I intended, but I was really happy with the result and have decided to try and make another book continuing the themes of befuddlement and dread. 
By backing this project you will help make this gloriously twisted book of drawings and stories become a reality and be the first to hold it. Hours of delirious rapture are guaranteed!
Some of the 100 Original Ink Drawings from my last project
She clutched the box to her chest, her heart trembling like a bowl of jelly being eaten by an unruly five year old
It was so much fun to get back to drawing with ink on paper instead of being hunched over a computer screen all day. The illustration ideas come from a strange and peculiar version of Victoriana which blends my love of comedy, Hammer Horror and Victorian novels and are heavily inspired by Edward Gorey, Arthur Rackham and Tim Burton. In this world anything is possible, although it will usually be soggy and/or flea-ridden. I found that once I started the ideas all came tumbling out and there were many I never got the chance to put in that first book. It seems a shame to waste them and I'd love the chance to make another volume binding them together for all to enjoy.
He stumbled towards a pot of inconceivably large onions and crouched down low behind it
I draw them with a scratchy old dip pen in Japanese ink I picked up in Tokyo on pure white A4 270gm card. The extra shading is done with a brush and the same ink. For printing purposes I will scan the originals and may alter the contrast to achieve the best print results but won't alter the drawing in anyway. This will be a book of pure inky, scratchy splodginess.
The accompanying stories will be no more than a page long and are written in the style of Victorian fiction, with nods to Edgar Allen Poe, Conan Doyle and a generous dollop of Lovecraft.
A spread from the 100 Days of Mystery book I self-published last year
As with the first book I am, once again, going to collect my drawings and put them in a book along with 50 short stories. A book guaranteed to make your bookshelf 35% more intriguing and one all your friends will covet. 
The money raised will cover the cost of printing the 150 page, perfect bound softback books in black and white. They will be A4 portrait sized with a 300 gsm spotUV cover to match the first book.
REWARDS
Backers will get a copy of the 100 Days of the Macabre artbook, which will be designed and printed to match the 100 Days of Mystery book that I have already completed.
Backers of the limited edition original ink drawing will receive a signed copy of the book and a hand-drawn original artwork that is featured in the book.
100 Days of Mystery
Unbelievably we’ve reached our total all ready and this book of dread and befuddlement shall now become a reality! Huzzah! As we’ve still got quite a few days to go let’s see how far we can go! 
If we are able to reach these stretch goals then every backer will have their pledge upgraded to include the new rewards. 
STRETCH GOAL 1 - UNLOCKED!
Now we have reached £8500 I will include a set of 4 Stickers in everyone’s reward. These are yet to be printed, so may vary, but will be characters from Mockum and Bray’s Victorian Freakshow.
STRETCH GOAL 2 - UNLOCKED!
A rough mock-up of the final Concertina Book
Once this Stretch Goal has been reached backers of ALL tiers will receive a bonus 8 page Concertina Book unfurling a scene of ghastly Victorian mystification. Printed on 220gsm paper and folding out to at least 420mm it shall thrill and beguile all who gaze upon it!
Are you trembling with anticipation? Can you feel the hairs on the back of your neck standing up? 
The above image is a rough layout sketch of one side of the final scene. It is likely to change and I am yet to decide what colours it shall be printed in. But rest assured it will be a thing of overwhelming beauty!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having completed a book of 100 drawings already I understand the amount of work and time it takes. I'm not going to try and draw one every day as I promised last time. That was much too ambitious.
I've given myself more time to make the book this time and I'm confident I know what I'm doing now.

Backers who pledge to get an original drawing will get one of the 100 originals selected at random. Unfortunately I can't guarantee that you will get your favourite, but will do my best to accommodate any requests.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello All - I know many of you are already backing my new Curious Crowd Kickstarter so I apologise for double-posting - but I just wanted to let anyone who might be interested (or wasn't aware of it!) know that the first Stretch Goal has been unlocked adding an extra 12 characters and making the book even more curious! https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/thecuriouscrowd/the-curious-crowd-artbook 

We've still got 11 days to go and 16 Original Drawings left so I'm hoping we will reach the next Stretch Goal and be able to give everyone a bonus Art Print.

Hello All

I have just pressed launch on the Curious Crowd Kickstarter! Huzzah!
It is an artbook full of spooky and weird characters - please do check it out and if you could help tell anyone who might be interested, I'd really appreciate it.

Hello All! Are you all as excited for Halloween as me? This time of year is definitely my favourite!

I’ve had some books get returned by the post office over the last few weeks and have informed the backers and resent them, but please let me know if you still havent received your book.

Thank you all for your support and patience, ALL books and drawings have now been posted and sent to all corners of the World.
lt is very exciting knowing that my illustrations are going to be causing befuddlement in so many different countries. Kickstarter really does provide a wonderful chance to make that happen - it has opened up the World to creators like me sat in their dingy little garrets and you, dear backers make it happen. I am truly grateful!

campaign.story:
TAKE A BREAK FROM YOUR PHONE AND PICK UP A (small) BOOK!!!
People are reading more than ever right now. The question is, "What are we reading?" If you are like us, you can only take so much social media and online journalism. Mouse Books offer a convenient alternative to reading on your phone: a phone-sized book. 
Mouse Books is literature for a mobile lifestyle. Our books are approachable, carefully curated, beautiful, and durable enough to go with you anywhere. They don’t ring, buzz, vibrate, need batteries, and the screens never break. 
HOW IT WORKS
STEP 1 - Subscribe and get a year of Mouse Books delivered right to your door. 
STEP 2 - Mouse Team cranks away making the BOOKS, BLOGS, and PODCASTS. 
STEP 3 - Enjoy literature without having to cart around huge books.
We launched last year on Kickstarter, and in Season 1 we grew the Mouse Book Club to 40+ countries and all 50 states, shipping 30,000+ books!!!  Mouse is back for Season 2 and we feel we have made nearly every aspect of the reading experience better!
SPECIFICATIONS
Mouse Books are carefully crafted to optimize the reading experience in a very compact format. When you are working at a small scale, every detail matters. 
QUARTERLY THEMES
Mouse encourages you to make connections between what you're reading and the larger world. This starts with the books we pick. Each quarter, the Mouse editorial team selects full texts, excerpts, short stories, speeches, poetry and more built around a theme.  Together they form a conversation around an important topic: a literary playlist. 
THIS YEAR :
 LAST YEAR:
KICKSTARTER SPECIAL: FOUNDERS EDITION
On the morning we first thought of the Mouse Books idea, the VERY FIRST book we tested was The Blue Hotel by Stephen Crane. As a special offer for the Season 2 campaign, we've created a limited Founders Edition of this book and will mail you a copy IMMEDIATELY when you make a pledge. This book is not for sale and available only to people who back this campaign.
MOUSE MICRO-LIBRARY
Get the first 15 Mouse Books in a sweet box set. Authors included are: Herman Melville, Jane Austen, Fyodor Dostoyevsky, Niccolò Machiavelli, Jonathan Swift, Walt Whitman, William Shakespeare, Andrew Marvell, John Donne, Charlotte Bronte, Gustave Flaubert, Homer, Frederick Douglass, Harriet Beecher Stowe, Henry David Thoreau, and Thomas Paine.
MOUSE BOOKS MAKE GREAT GIFTS!!!!!
Since starting Mouse Books, the number one comment we receive from people is, "I think this is really cool, BUT I KNOW SOMEONE WHO WOULD LOVE THIS!" If you back the Season 2 campaign at the gift subscription level by December 19th we will guarantee delivery of a GIVING Series 3-Pack with custom gift card by Christmas.  
MOUSE READER REVIEWS
"I love small things that are beautifully made." Clarissa in San Antonio
"I was reading the Murders in the Rue Morgue and another passenger was so very intrigued by the Mouse Book, I had to give it to them. It was the most wonderful idea, they were very happy. But now, I wanna finish reading it for myself. What are the steps to ordering another copy?" Joel in Austin (we gave him another copy...)
"“I am once again smitten with literature. This new medium (Mouse Books) offers a unique approach, an engaging appeal to consider, to ponder." Tim in Portland
“I LOVE being a member of the Mouse Club!! I smile every time I see my card in my wallet.... mostly because I think about what an amazing thing you’ve done. Experiencing the written word tactically is not only irreplaceable and difficult to articulate, but it is vital we read, caress and FEEL the power the written word possesses. We have strayed so far!!” Kelly in Walla Walla
"Congratulations on an awesome year of books! I love the surprise in this shipment and it's a great way to showcase the year. Looking forward to year 2!" J in Collinsville, OK
WORLD-CLASS PRINTER
We are obsessed with making these books extremely high-quality. We've partnered with one of the great printers in the USA, eDOC Communications from Mount Prospect, Illinois, to bring Mouse Books to life. And since our printing partner is local to our Chicago-based team, we know our quality standards are upheld during every print run.  
This is the actual Heidelberg Speedmaster XL 105 that prints Mouse Books!
THANK YOUUUU!!!!
If you are NEW to Mouse Books, THANK YOU for making it through the whole description! We sincerely hope you subscribe!!!
If you are returning to Mouse for another year, THANK YOU for believing in this project! We look forward to continually working hard to make your  Mouse Book Club experience better and better.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Mouse Books is, in our estimation, a very low-risk project. We have two major costs: printing and shipping. We have a keen understanding of both. In the last year, we have printed and shipped tens-of-thousands of books. If we hit our funding threshold we will be able to fulfill one year of quarterly shipments to all subscribers, and print/fulfill all 3-pack orders.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We shipped all books to people who got their surveys out on time. For those of you who are international, your books are in transit and may take a couple weeks.
I'm working my way through the backlog of emails from those who wrote saying they have not received books yet. Should have that done in the next day or two.

Hi All,
We have completed shipping almost all the books. Outstanding people are internationals who ordered micro-libraries. We accidentally printed labels with incorrect weights and customs forms, so they need to be redone. Top of priority list. 
PLEASE check to make sure you filled out your SURVEY. We have not sent final fulfillment to anyone who did not fill out survey. If you have any questions email me. WE ARE SUPER EXCITED OF THESE BOOKS AND WANT THEM IN YOUR HANDS. If you have NOT received them yet email me and we'll fix it. dewane@mousebookclub.com

Hi All - 
We still need SURVEYS from roughly 89 people.

WE ARE PICKING THE BOOKS UP FROM THE PRINTER AND THEY ARE GOING OUT IN THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS!!!

campaign.story:
The City Plate is an usable porcelain dish that resembles a city's unique shape and its main landmarks. Great for sharing food, storing items or just an awesome decoration piece.
Soy sauce flowing under the Brooklyn Bridge, NYC
Great as a decoration piece, or to organize some items
London: Royal Albert Hall, Big Ben, London Eye, Tower Bridge
         Rewards
We will be offering three options:
Landmarks - A set of four porcelain mini landmarks. Use as decoration or also perfect as a custom board game pawn. 
Set of 4 porcelain buildings
City Plate - Embossed - Porcelain plate that contains the cities unique shape of rivers and water embossed. 
Plate with embossed texture
City Plate - Landmarks - Porcelain plate that contains the cities unique shape of rivers and water embossed, including four main landmarks in 3D porcelain.
Plate with embossed texture and 4 landmarks
Custom Pinpoint
Each plate can be customized by adding a pinpoint on a specific place. Add €6,- to your pledge for each pinpoint (as many you would like!). After the campaign we will send a survey about the coordinates. Note that only the city center is included in the plate.
Reward Overview
              Available Cities
The list of cities will constantly expand. If the campaign reaches a certain amount of funds, additional cities will be added for all backers.
As the campaign continues we will expand the list. Let us know what city you would like to see next by filling in the below form:
https://goo.gl/forms/d1UmEDEPNpKaO3lo2
About the design
Designer of the City Plates, Sander Lorier tells: ''As our client base has grown exponentially all over the world, we wanted to create a project that celebrates all these cities, with its unique look and characteristics.''
Each city has its unique look, shape and details
Slib-casting in custom made molds
The glaze is non-toxic and food safe. It is even suitable for the oven and dishwasher
Approximate dimensions of plate and landmarks
                Timeline
The funds that are raised in this campaign will be used to scale our production facility and invest in all the different custom mold and materials. 
About Studio Lorier
Studio Lorier is a design firm that is based in the Netherlands. It specializes in the design and manufacturing of transformable furniture and handcrafted ceramics. In the last years we have grown exponentially and finished two successful Kickstarter projects. 
----------------------------
PRESS RELEASE
Porcelain plates inspired by the world's unique buildings and cities, now on Kickstarter.
Studio Lorier announces a new addition in their collection; the City Plate. It is a porcelain platter, shaped in the texture of a well known city and contains the main architectural landmarks. These trays can be used for presenting food, storing items or a great addition to any interior. By running a crowd-funding campaign, Studio Lorier tries to raise enough funds via Kickstarter for a diverse collection of the most popular cities around the world. 
Each plate and landmark is handcrafted in their Rotterdam based studio. All miniature buildings are slib-cast into self made molds. The landmarks are joined as a solid connection and all is finished with a non-toxic, food safe glaze that is even dishwasher proof. 
During the crowd-funding campaign, people can support the project by funding it. Rewards vary from a set of mini landmarks, to an embossed city plate including it's architecture. You can even get a fully customized plate, made to order. Supporters can choose from a list of the most popular cities, that will expand when extra funds will be raised. During the campaign, backers have the possibility to get the city plates for the lowest price ever until December 4th 2018. 
Studio Lorier is a design firm that is based in the Netherlands. It specializes in the design and manufacturing of transformable furniture and handcrafted ceramics. Designer Sander Lorier tells: ''As our client base has grown exponentially all over the world, we wanted to create a project that celebrates all these cities, with its unique look and characteristics.'' 
----------------------
NOTE FOR PRESS

High-Res Images: https://slorier.stackstorage.com/s/cH1Sy4l9m2G6CiA
Video: https://youtu.be/J0WXyZdxMEA

HOW TO PLEDGE FOR ORIGINAL ART OR SIGNED PRINTS
Add $30 to your pledge for each signed print of Jasper. Any quantity or combination is fine, just simply add $30 for each additional print. When you fill out the Backer Survey after the campaign ends, you will be able to select which particular titles you would like as prints. There's no need to let us know the specifics until then.
For each original ink on paper illustration of Jasper, please pledge the $1000 "Original Drawing of Me (from the book)" reward tier and message us through Kickstarter with the number and/or title of your selection. Originals are available on a first-come, first-serve basis only.

support.title: Original Animation Drawing + Book
support.descp:
It's kind of a secret, but it's kind of not... Brian Kesinger is planning to make a little motion picture movie about me. It's a special kind of movie where every moment is an actual drawing! Apparently it takes lots and lots of drawings to make even a few seconds of movie! So my friend Brian asked his friend Tina Nawrocki (who has drawn other motion picture movies like something about a guy named "Cuphead"... I guess she's good at drawing guys with "head" in their name) to help draw my movie about me. The first part of the movie she drew (as kind of an experiment) was called "Shot 10". Well, there were just over 30 individual drawings in "Shot 10", and we're offering 30 of them here as a very special reward (that comes with the 'Spiffy Book" and the "Shiny Object"). These are the first-ever movie drawings of me, from the very beginning steps of making the movie move. Available only here, only now, "Shot 10" won't be offered again. This is a piece (of paper) of motion picture history.

One-of-a-Kind Original Animation Drawing

updates.update_content: Shipping has begun for The Fabulous Contraptions of Jasper J. Pumpkinhead!

Two weeks ago we told you about a new Baby Tattoo / Brian Kesinger / Otto & Victoria Kickstarter campaign involving time travel.
Today, due to disruptions in the space-time continuum, that campaign has unexpectedly become a Baby Tattoo / Brian Kesinger / Otto & Victoria / Jasper J. Pumpkinhead  (Broken) Kickstarter campaign involving utter chaos!

Over the past few months, a lot of work has been put into this little book. Just as it was being prepped and sent to press a few weeks ago, a decision was made to add and fine-tune an animated image (an actual moving picture achieved via the magic of lenticular printing) on the book's cover. Tina Nawrocki, the lead animator on Brian Kesinger's forthcoming Jasper short movie, created a fittingly fantastic sequence of the always-inventing scarecrow doing his hands-on maker-thing. The cover image is the same picture we always planned to use,  but now it will be alive with motion just like Brian's Penned Dragons and Inked Tails books!

Click here for a PDF file for the "Fantastic Contraptions of Jasper J. Pumpkinhead" Acknowledgments 
The Acknowledgement Page is nearly finished! Please take a look and make sure your requested name appears on the list and is spelled correctly. If your name appears correctly, no action is necessary.

I asked Brian (the art guy) and Bob (the gets-the-book-made guy) about what's going on with the art and with gettin' the book made.
Brian did all the drawing of most of the drawings of me back in October, but he's finished the rest (enough to fill a whole book, I guess) now.
Bob just signed some fancy piece of paper with people somewhere far away who are in charge of making the parts of the book and then putting those parts together.

You did it! More to come... like information about whatever is going to happen next and question forms (Kickstarter calls them "Surveys") about the things you will be receiving and, of course, the things you will be receiving. But that's all going to happen in 2019 (except for needing to know what "Brian Draws Whatever" people want Brian to draw...  we'll contact those folks sooner)... so for now, happy holidays and a happy, happy new year!

Hi everybody.
Just a quick update to let you all know that Brian has added 5 more "Brian Draws Whatever (Just For You!)" rewards to the campaign. These are surely his last commissions of the year ('cuz the year is almost over).

Hi.
It's me Jasper. There's a thing called a stretch goal, and it happened. Brian's gonna do a few extra drawings and we're going to add eight more pages to the book than what we originally planned. It's good news and it's 'cuz of you!
And for the next stretch goal, if we get to the next chunk o' good news, we're going to add a story-time recording on a vinyl (or somethin') sound-spinner disk, for free, to every reward tier that comes with my book!

campaign.story:
Go to www.theWeedDeck.com to buy the deck.
How much do you know about marijuana? 
The Weed Deck is a great way to learn important cannabis information, in a fun and inviting way. It's a beautiful deck of playing cards that will be your indispensable companion in the new world of weed.
    Each of the 56 cards focuses on one key element of cannabis, providing a concise explanation and a detailed illustration. Whether you're new to cannabis, or an old hand, The Weed Deck will improve your understanding of the drug.
The contents of the deck have been painstakingly researched and designed to provide a deep and comprehensive overview of the cannabis field. 
And the casino-quality card stock with linen texture makes the deck perfect for all your favourite card games.
  The Weed Deck covers all of your questions about cannabis. From the basic (How long will I be high for? How should I store my weed?), to the more advanced (How does THC interact with my body? What is "dabbing", and do I dare try it?)
The main subject areas are shown below:
        The deck is being manufactured by Legends Playing Card Company, the producers of some of the finest decks in the world. They'll use state-of-the-art presses and top-end card stock to print a deck that both looks and feels amazing.
If you prefer to ingest your cannabis information in a more traditional format, The Weed Book is just the thing. It contains all of the same content as the deck, in an elegant hardcover book format.
The larger page area gives the beautiful illustrations room to shine. Take The Weed Book on your next dispensary visit, or put it on your coffee table as a conversation starter.
        Below are the items that are available. Your reward will ship in early December, 2018, once manufacturing has been completed.
        The Weed Deck and The Weed Book will be manufactured and ready to ship by early December. This means you can give the ultimate Christmas gift to any "canna-curious" friends or family members.
Ben Barrett-Forrest is the creator, writer, and designer of The Weed Deck, living in Victoria, British Columbia. This is Ben's third deck of educational playing cards launched on Kickstarter.
Celia Krampien is the illustrator of The Weed Deck. She lives in St. Catharines, Ontario, and has worked for clients like The LA Times, The Globe and Mail, and Scientific American.
The video was filmed and edited by the lovely Ben Kerr: http://benkerr.ca/
And social media is being handled by the talented Vanessa Elie.
 Previous Decks
In the past 4 years, Ben has released two educational decks of playing cards: The Design Deck, and The Font Deck. They have now sold over 10,000 copies, been shipped to 90 countries, and are used as curriculum aids in several colleges and universities. 
Your can purchase a deck for yourself at this link.
The Weed Deck works beautifully for card tricks. It has rotationally symmetrical card backs with a striking design, and silky finish for easy card handling. 
Watch magician Jason Verners bust some jaw-dropping moves with The Weed Deck below.
PLAY

        We'd love to tell as many people as possible about this new way to learn about cannabis. If you're excited about this project, please share it with your friends. Thanks very much!
If you want to get in touch, please send me an email at forrestmediaco@gmail.com. 
Thanks so much for your help. Let's learn about weed!

campaign.story:
CELEBRATING THE AMAZING EDGAR ALLAN POE
One of the greatest American authors, Edgar Allan Poe suffered throughout his life, losing anyone he ever loved. He is regarded as one of the fathers of science fiction and the detective novel, an indicator of his attention to the mysteriousness of life and death. 
The Mouse Book Club is celebrating Poe by creating TWO books. We've created a Mouse version of The Raven and Other Works. Also, for the first time, we are creating a Kickstarter exclusive book! This will be a super-special copy of Poe's groundbreaking work, The Murders in the Rue Morgue.
MOUSE BOOKS AND MOBILE LITERATURE
Congratulations! You are alive at a time when human beings are reading more than ever. But too often we choose sources of shallow information like news feeds, photo streams, online news, and email.
READ WITH A PURPOSE
Mouse Books brings great literature and makes it mobile. Our physical books are phone-sized, hand-selected, durable, beautiful, approachable texts that go with you anywhere. They never run out of battery life, they don’t have screens that crack, and they don’t ring, buzz, or vibrate. We also offer a podcast with additional analysis.  Click HERE to see the entire Mouse Catalog.
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE POE BOOK!!!
This is going to be our most beautiful book ever. Period. It is our homage to the greatness of Poe, and the main design elements of the book are subtle references to the text. What is most exciting about this book is that we will produce only a limited run. We will print a numbered series corresponding to the exact number of backers and your books will be stamped with your backer number! Once these are gone, they are gone. 
CAREFULLY CRAFTED
Mouse Books are meticulously designed. From the text size, to the thickness and color of the paper—every element has been considered, tested, and refined to give you the best and most portable reading experience.
THE RAVEN IS WAITING
We produced a hot Mouse version of The Raven and Other Works and will ship a you copy IMMEDIATELY when you back the campaign at any level! 
SUBSCRIBE!
 The best way to get Mouse is to SUBSCRIBE! With one click you get a year's worth of great reading sent straight to your mailbox. Our books are delivered in four quarterly shipments, each dedicated to a unique theme.
MOUSE MICRO-LIBRARY
Get the first 16 Mouse Book themed editions in a sweet box set. Authors included are: Herman Melville, Jane Austen, Fyodor Dostoyevsky, Frans Kafka, Niccolò Machiavelli, Jonathan Swift, Walt Whitman, William Shakespeare, Andrew Marvell, John Donne, Charlotte Bronte, Gustav Flober, Homer, Frederick Douglass, Harriet Beecher Stowe, Henry David Thoreau, and Thomas Paine. Not bad!!!  
ADDITIONAL ANALYSIS
One of the keys to the Mouse Books experience is unfolding the deeper meanings in each text. Here is an interview of Poe expert Stephen Rachman that might be useful to listen to before you plunge into your Mouse Book!
RAVEN READING
One of our backers, Jon Rehwaldt, was kind enough to lend his considerable talents to delivering a reading of The Raven for us all to enjoy!!! Back in Poe's time, this kind of performance of the poem was common and Poe himself read it publicly many times. Definitely worth 8:21 seconds of your day!!!
WORLD-CLASS PRINTER 
We are obsessed with making these books extremely high-quality. We've partnered with one of the great printers in the USA, eDOC Communications from Mount Prospect, Illinois, to bring Mouse Books to life. And since our printing partner is local to our Chicago-based team, we know our quality standards are upheld during every print run.
This is the actual Heidelberg Speedmaster XL 105 that prints Mouse Books!
CUSTOMER FEEDBACK   
"I tentatively examined these little iPhone-sized booklets, making sure to take them to a quiet corner of the house where I could enjoy the experience. I then proceeded to devour them, page by page, chapter by chapter, story by story. What an incredible experience."– Brian in Portland
"I GOT THE BOOKS! *people-dancing-emoji* *people-reading-emoji* They are BEAUTIFUL! Great job!" – Americo in San Francisco
"I purchased a Mouse Books subscription from Kickstarter last year. They are mailed to my daughter and she loves them – she just graduated with a BA in English with a minor in Writing. We talk about the books she gets as soon as she reads them and we both have great fun with the whole process." – Steve in Ohio
"I love the new quarterly books. You all do a terrific job. I eagerly await the new quarterly shipment." –Russell in Louisville
"I put my book down to go start dinner and my daughter (being a 14 year old) picked it up, laughed at the size, and made some “funny” jokes about books being obsolete. Twenty minutes later I walked through the room to find her curled up in the chair reading the book. It led to some interesting discussions, and she is now devouring a second book, taking notes and making interesting observations." –Shannon in Maine
“I just love this little thing.” – John in Oakland
T-H-A-N-K Y-O-U-! 
OK - you made it to the bottom of the page. Clearly, you have Mouse Fever and are coming on this adventure with us. Please take one minute and share a link for this page with anyone else in your life you think would enjoy Mouse Books!
Follow us on Instagram @mousebookclub
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Mouse Books is, in our estimation, a very low-risk project. We have two major costs: printing and shipping. We have a keen understanding of both, having printed and shipped more than 10,000 books in the last year. Sometimes books get lost in the mail. If they do, tell us and we'll replace them.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

ALMOST THERE!!!!!
Your books are being made as I type. 
Anyone want an uncut cover sheet? I snatched 10 off the press. First come, first serve. You can have the print for free but we'll ask you to pay $10 for shipping roll and postage. (INTERNATIONAL shipping might be more...we'll check if we need to) Email me at dewane@mousebookclub.com if interested.

Three Important Updates on progress of RUE MORGUE Shipment:
1. COVER STOCK IN...TESTS COMPLETE...WE NEED TO MAKE SOME ADJUSTMENTS
The covers of the Rue Morgue books are being printed on a premium colored stock: French Paper, Pop Tone - Tangy Orange. The paper itself feels great and has a subtle modeling to it. Easy to understand why it costs twice as much as our typical stock (McCoy 100# Silk Cover). Our major delay thus far was getting the paper from the mill. They were out of stock and were in the process of making more in September.
3 Important Updates

Here is a progress report in three quick updates: 
1. Box Prototype - We got the test box from the printer!!! Looks very good, but it was about 1/16" or so to short. So they are making a slightly bigger one. We've approved the second prototype for that and they are testing the wrapping now.
Three Important Updates

comments.content: In my intentionally slow reading of Mouse Books (so I don't run out of new ones), I'm finally up to this one! :)
When should the second shipment of yearly books have shipped? I received three books in addition to Raven/Rue Morgue. Has the second quarterly shipment been sent out yet?
Were we supposed to get the raven book already? I received rue morgue a while back but have not yet seen the raven.
@mousebooks Thanks so much. Looking forward to them!

I received my box of books which remained nicely packed through the mail. Thank you. Unfortunately there are 2 Raven. One of the books were taken off from the plastic package from the triad of books. I'm wondering if I'm missing one of the other books? A little disappointed somewhat...

Received my big pile of little books. Many thanks for delivering a great and easy way to get in TOUCH again with the written word. Keep up the good work. Though I want to say "I can't wait to get the next delivery of my subscription." I will have plenty of books now to read and keep me from wondering about that for a great while yet.
Received my books here in San Diego, California. They look great!

My books arrived today as well, and they look good. Having them in hand now, I have a better idea of the sort of difficulty you had with getting the cover of Rue Morgue the way you wanted. Personally, I find the cover text a little hard to read because of the kind of low contrast between the gold text and orange background, but it's not too bad and there isn't a ton of text to read on the cover. It's definitely a nice book and one I'm glad I didn't miss. Of course, since I'm still catching up on my past books, it may be a while before I get around to reading these new ones, but I will get to them eventually. I'm trying not to read them too fast so that I always have more on hand to read. That's partly why I'm eager to renew my subscription -- I love knowing that I've got more Mouse Books coming! :)
Beautiful books! And thanks for the extras!
Just got them!! Thank you!
Got my books thankyou !!!
Caren Matyckas - Backer 557
Thank you for such a beautiful mobile book. Arrived today and looking forward to train ride in to work Monday morning. Thank you for your hard work.
My Rue Morgue came today! Love it! Thanks for all your hard work and transparency.

For those of us who ordered the 16 book set & membership, I noticed there is a new book group "Time Series" on the MB site. Will this edition be part of the first shipment for new quarterly members or an entirely new purchase? Any update on website login for new members via this KS?
Thanks for continuing this wonderful project to spread classic literature in a more compact and portable form. I've been hooked since day 1 of the first campaign! ;)

I am interested to know how the offset press run went on the covers. I received one of the cover press sheets (thank you Mouse Books) and it is really hard to read the text printed in gold ink on the orange cover stock.
Yessssssssss Shipping Commences!!! <3 <3 <3

Sorry to hear of the cover challenges. When I was a letterpress printer I avoided gold and silver inks like the plague. They are very hard to work with to get even coverage, and very tough to clean off the press rollers.

I would also like to hear what @Mouse Books and others think of a Mouse Books Collectors Club with free membership and a PDF newsletter (say quarterly) which would include news, letters to the editor, and an auction of rare and out of print Mouse Books. I would be willing to be the newsletter editor if there was some interest in this.

So far we know that you are using gold ink on the cover and that you are numbering the copies inside and that the edition is limited to 710. Is there anything special about the text such as illustrations or fancy chapter headings?

Some kind of collectors club might be interesting. The Mouse Books web site does say to let them know if you're a collector, so they might already have a starting point for creating such a group. It could be worth considering, once some of the other things are worked out (e.g., I think they've mentioned needing to upgrade their customer service/management system).

As an avid collector of Mouse Books I am especially interested in the pre-launch experimental books. If you go to the original Mouse Books Kickstarter campaign they have a photo and description of a handmade edition of 100 Bartleby books with white, black and red covers that they sent to friends as a test market in late 2016. I would love to find one of those to add to my collection!

Seems to me, at some point, we should organize a Mouse Book Collectors Club. I am impressed with 73 backers going for the mini-library (and subscription) and 69 going for the two copies of Rue Morgue. Many of the early books were printed in limited editions of 1,500. When those sell out we are going to have to develop a secondary market of some kind. A club would be better than eBay for that.
Question: Ordered the 16+ books and subscription package. How do we go about setting up our Mouse accounts on your website? Will there be a push from your end to start/complete the process?

Finally, 5 of the 57 projects never delivered. Two creators gave up saying their projects was too difficult, only one of them gave me a refund. The other three projects were out and out scams, no product, no refund, no explanation. Just lots of angry backers leaving comments. For what it is worth that has been my experience on Kickstarter. Oh, and another 13 projects I pledged to that were unsuccessful in reaching their funding goals or were cancelled early.

I think your stats -- half on time, half delayer -- are better than mine. Out of the projects I've received, only about 1/3 were on time or early and the other 2/3 were late or had rewards spread out. If I look at everything, including what I'm still waiting on, then it's more like 60% delayed, 30% early/on-time/spread, and the other 10% not close enough to delivery to really tell. I only backed 2 projects that were canceled, and they were both successful when relaunched (1 delivered, but I'm waiting for the other). I'm sure the reasons for delays varied; I haven't kept track of them. I've seen at least one creator offer refunds due to a long delay. I've never request a refund for a project though. While I've waited quite a while for some rewards, they've all come through so far, and I hope that they continue to do so.
Thanks, I appreciate the responses. Nothing wrong with a little optimism. I am excited to see the finished product!

I think that they could have delivered in August if the books were both finished, ready to go, and they were willing to print the books before Kickstarter released funds to them. But knowing that Rue Morgue needed some work before it could be printed, the estimate probably should have been at least September to start, which is when I was expecting them anyway, honestly. As Mouse Books said, they were probably as little overly optimistic. Even if the original estimates were highly confident, I see no problem with adding 1 month to the delivery estimate just in case. Better to estimate long and deliver early than vice versa.

I am not trying to be difficult or critical. I am curious since I do Kickstarter campaigns myself. An October delivery of an August project is certainly reasonable. The very first Kickstarter I pledged to, the Vivian Myers DVD, I had to wait 2 1/2 years for the reward. I am interested in why you originally thought you would deliver the book even before you had the Kickstarter proceeds.

I certainly understand fulfillment delays, but it really begs the question of why your campaign promised an August delivery date in the first place? Especially since this is your third Kickstarter campaign. You have hinted around, about moving and such, but I would like to know what is the real explanation.
I really thought we would have heard something by now, such as an update about production, or an insight about the design and why Rue Morgue is going to better than any previous Mouse Book.

Here's a little something for fun. On our summer vacation, my wife and I visited a museum that had a portable writing desk owned by Poe. Here's a picture of it with a second picture of the sign about it. https://imgur.com/a/hRaK4rv
Just found out about the $15 add-on. I would like to do this as well, but am unsure how to go about it. There's no "send me invoice" option. I will complete the survey when this can be done.

@Peter: Hopefully Mouse Books can tell you for sure. It's possible that they mailed you a copy of The Raven and it's still in transit, but you're right that there's no way to know if that's the case. I guess the worst case is you wait until just before surveys are going to lock down and say "no" if Raven still hasn't arrived yet.

I'm a little confused with the survey - the question "Did you have a RAVEN?" - I haven't bought one before the kickstarter and haven't received one from the kickstarter but you did message me during the kickstarter for an address - however I'm outside the US so if one was sent it might not have arrived with me, I have no way to know if it was sent. What should I say on the survey? "No"?

I just did the survey, but what was the deal with an extra $15 for all the books and extra case, I didn't see anything about that. I pledged for the library and sub, is that all the books, or were there more?

@Crystal: As to your first question, Raven was going out early, so it's reasonable that you received that already. I'm not sure about the two copies thing though. From today's update, I believe Rue Morgue is currently at the printer, so no one should have that yet. About your second question, I'd expect delivery in early September. I think the August estimate here was a bit optimistic. Though if the printer gets Rue Morgue done quickly -- and I think they generally have a quick turn-around -- we could see shipping to backers start in August. I wouldn't bet on delivery this month though; I think we'll see them in our mailboxes early next month.
Thank you

So out of curiosity, how's the progress on Rue Morgue? I don't remember hearing too much about it during the campaign, and it seems to me that unless it's (almost) done so that it can be printed, packed, and shipped in the next week or so, an August delivery as estimated here will be hard to achieve. Not that that's a problem for me; I'm still working through Mouse Books I already have. I'm just curious (as always) to know when we can expect the rewards to arrive. Thanks!
Congrats on another successful project! I can't wait to get this ~*~ super fancy ~*~ edition.
So excited about overreaching your goal. Can’t wait to receive all the upcoming books.
Congratulations on a great campaign and funding!
Thanks and congratulations!

However, they seem to be pretty willing to work with backers, so I'm guessing there's a good chance that they can find a way to let people add the $15 for the library level add-on books post-campaign. We'll have to wait and see though.
Congratulations!
Slightly early, but congratulations on another successful campaign! You've got a great product here, and lots of us know it and support you! :)
How do I pledge "twice" so that another set can be sent to a different address?

As for The Raven, I don't know if there's any guaranteed date. You'd have to get it with the main shipment of Rue Morgue at the latest, but for early shipments, I thought they were doing them in batches as more backers joined. You might want to check with them if it's been a while.

If we subscribed in your first Kickstarter, when can we expect Love, Struggle, and Bullshit? Have I missed mine in the mail? Also, it seems like a lot of people already got their Poe book on here, but I haven't. Is there a shipment guarantee date?

The "Early Adaptor" edition is a typo on the Mouse Book Club website. It was the "Early Adopter" edition, which makes more sense. The first 500 backers of the first Kickstarter (this is the 3rd campaign) were the early adopters of Mouse Books. I hope that typo can be fixed.

Just updated my “library” pledge and added another $15 ... thank you for the option and opportunity!

Sorry I pushed it over 20k. Got the box set this is so cool.

Thanks I’ll wait till then

(I just read earlier comments about book damage after posting mine... glad to see you guys will resend damaged copies... kudos!)

The craft mailers should make a huge difference in the final mailing. Both copies of "Raven" (two different accounts) arrived bent on the spine causing four to six unsightly white chips in the cover stock.
Crossing my fingers that “Morgue” makes it here in better shape.

Raven came completely safe for me! Sorry just got home and got through the mail.
Reading comments I’ve concerns now in packaging and book arriving damaged. What actions are ye taking to avoid this?
Do these books have images/illustrations inside? Is it possible to see an example if so? Are these exact text conversions from an already published version? If so which version?

Oh, I hope my mini Poe book comes soon! My son made a raven that he sat on his shoulder during book week at school to see how many students would figure it out. Wish he could have had a mouse copy in his pocket. Would have been fun to give to whomever guessed :)

Got my Raven book and it's absolutely amazing. My kids are definitely enjoying reading it. Mine came a little damaged, but no worries. I'd suggest beefing up the shipment packaging, if people are trying to collect it for a mini library.
We need a stretch goal for $20K.

@Scmoore: Agreed. I've been a big fan of Mouse Books since their first Kickstarter. It's the kind of project I hope everyone at least takes a look at -- I think many people will support it if they know about it, because it's such a great idea and product.

My tiny Poe book arrived last week! The book is beautiful and it was so lovely to come home from work and find a hand addressed envelope waiting for me. I also really appreciated the book's encouragement to slowdown and absorb the full weight of the story. A good reminder to occasionally break away from the shallow but lovable dime store mysteries. If you are on the fence about backing this cool project, do it! You won't be disappointed.

I didn't go back to check the campaign page when I commented, where I now see it doesn't say US only, so I hadn't realized you were able to ship early worldwide now. That's good news for international backers!

To echo the chorus below; I was also blown away by Mouse Books' handling of this Kickstarter - absolutely phenomenal stuff guys, well done! I've already gushed about MB to as many people as I can get to listen. They've made a new lifetime subscriber out of me!

Yes, Mouse Books' offer to send part of physical rewards in advance (within the US) seems to be unique. I don't think I've seen that anywhere else; most of the time, you don't even get digital rewards before the campaign ends. I guess it just goes to show how eager they are to get these great books into people's hands -- they don't want to wait until it's all over to start sending them out! :)

I am truly impressed I received my copy of The Raven today from you guys it's nice to receive something before the campaign is funded I think I'm hooked I'll be buying more books from you love it's convenient size and the text is a good size and fits in my pocket thanks David and the rest of the team
Just received my copy of The Raven in the mail this week! Mouse Books are so awesome!
Thank you very much :)
will we have access to the commentaries and videos exclusive to subscribers (if we pledge for the subscription here instead on your website)? thanks a lot!
Congratulations on breaking $10K, 500% funding in just TEN days with twenty five days to go! Go Mouse Books!
Got my Raven and Other Works today...thanks for treating us backers so special...Good Luck
I must have counted my extra books in the total, in that case I’ll just wait to see what you guys have cooking up!

FWIW, IMO renewing annually is fine. Less frequently than that can make it hard to remember it needs to be done, though I expect you'll remind us about it. Plus if you're thinking of offering some sort of incentive each year for renewals, I wouldn't want to miss out on those. ;) But multi-year subscriptions can be a useful option if they offer a discount, protect against future price increases, or something similar. If it ends up being the same as ending one year at a tone though, it seems less useful to me. But if you can offer multi-year, it may be worth doing so. But I do think thatan annual subscription ought to be fine. In my experience, annual is common enough practice, but multi-year. In any event, as long as I can get all your books somehow, I'm good. :D

IIRC, backers of the original campaign who are in the US have one more quarterly shipment to come, while international backers should have received all of their books at once some time ago. As for renewals, they said they have plans for that, but I think they're holding them until after the fourth quarterly shipment goes out in a few months. So I don't think we need to get subscriptions here if we're really looking to renew our existing subscriptions.
I think I answered my own question as I just realized I’d gotten all four quarterly subscriptions already.

If I’m already a backer of the original book club would the option to get a subscription start after this full first years original subscription end or does it start immediately? Just thinking about ease of renewal for next year.

You have a point, but not everyone backing here may have read the story, or if they did, they might not remember it well. But I do agree with you: the "subtle references" line does seem like sort of a challenge for us to try to figure out how the design references the text. FWIW, I always challenge myself with trying to figure out new book titles from the preview images Mouse Books posts (when they do post them). However, they blur them really well, so I usually can't guess more than the number of words in the title, and I'm not even sure about that sometimes. :)

I took the campaign statement that "the main design elements of the book are subtle references to the text" as a challenge. I did not name the animal, but really, I don't think you can have spoiler concerns about a short story that was first published in 1841, is in the public domain, and is widely available on the internet and in libraries. In any event I was not going to comment further on the story itself.

As for spoilers, I'd agree we want to avoid them. But guessing red represents blood when the book title has "murders" in it seems like a fairly obvious connection to make, so it shouldn't be much of a spoiler. As for anything else, I think it would be harder to guess at without knowing more about the story. I've probably read the story before, but long enough ago that I don't remember enough details that would help me guess what other elements of the Mouse Book version are referencing the story.

The campaign says that "the main design elements of the book are subtle references to the text". My guess is that the red of the cover is for blood, and the orange of the cover refers to an animal that is an important character in the short story.

Agreed, and you're right that "The Dead" was a simpler case. One possibility here is that the books carry both the backer number and a print-run order number. For example, all of the books could be consecutively numbered as "The Dead" was, with each backer's books getting marked with their backer number as well. So to make up numbers, maybe your example backer #147 gets books 210 and 211 of whatever the total print run is, but they're both marked as being printed for backer #147. As you noted, possibly trying to track two sets of numbers complicates things, but something like this might work. I'm sure Mouse Books will let us know what they had in mind when they get a chance.

A good numbering system is important to the value of a limited edition, which is why I am asking Mouse Books these questions. "The Dead" had a straightforward #1 of 500 and so on. But using the backer number complicates things.

@Stuart: Good questions. I'm guessing for 1, something like what you said will happen to keep the backer numbers right while still identifying multiple books. For 2, it would be nice to know, but we should be able to calculate it from the pledges once the campaign ends as long (as there are no exceptions were unaware of, that is). And 3 would be a good idea, but numbering individual copies by backer and the total by number printed seems a bit inconsistent. Maybe there's a good solution to that though that I don't have off the top of my head.
Thank you MOUSE! I think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship... ;)
Thank you.

Oh, you're also right about add-ons. Since allowing them effectively creates customized orders, it can complicate things. If you wanted to offer add-ons, you might look into using a pledge manager such as Backer Kit (I'm sure there are others though). From a backer's perspective, it's kind of like a mini-store where your KS pledge gives you credit to use and you adjust things as you want, getting charged any extra funds if necessary. I would hope that on the creator's side, it helps handle fulfilling such customized orders, but you might have to look into it to see for sure how it works. Just a thought.
@Mouse: Thanks for the confirmation. I think I'll up my pledge then. :) Given the very limited nature of Rue Morgue, it might be nice to have two copies. ;)
Is there any way to increase my pledge amount for you to add a copy of Whitman to my shipment?!

@Rachel: You're right, even levels with two copies of Rue Morgue only list one copy of The Raven. Maybe they're limiting The Raven to one book per backer? If not, they might be able to offer extra copies as add-ons or via new pledge levels. I guess we'll see. Being fully funded with a month to go, they might have some stretch goals or something planned.
Is there any way to get multiple copies of the Raven book? I would love to do the Double Trouble tier as a present for a friend, but I know they would want a copy of The Raven too.
Back again for more Mouse! I really do love to keep these little books handy.

I believe so. The description says they will send The Raven "IMMEDIATELY when you back the campaign at any level! (US backers only)". That should be why they're asking for addresses early, but only for US backers; I think they can't afford to do this for everyone outside the US because of the higher shipping costs involved. International backers will get The Raven together with any other rewards the pledge for after the campaign ends though, so you won't miss it. It'll just take a bit longer to get a copy.
Your updates say first day people will be asked for address.... is this only for backers in the USA? Just checking I haven't somehow missed an email. :)
@Shannon: Same here. Although I'm still catching up on the books I already own, I feel like you can't have enough Mouse Books. :D
If I back for the subscription level and I already have a subscription, will you just extend my existing subscription, or will I end up with two simultaneous subscriptions?
@James: Good point about it being their third Kickstarter. I really missed the boat (well, the first two boats). Glad to finally be connected with this team, and this awesome community of backers.,

Another minor thing: all copies of Rue Morgue will be numbered as part of the limited printing here, as the campaign description says, right? Because in the pledge level descriptions, it looks like only the one explicitly says it's a numbered copy. So I'm just checking, just to make extra-sure. :)
I love my Mouse books, and am always so excited when I see more! I’m so proud to pledge.
Thanks!

That reminds me -- how probable is the August delivery estimate? The campaign doesn't end until August 16 and it'll probably be a while before KS releases the funds to you, which suggest shipping would be at end of the month at best. If it's late, that's OK, it happens (to a lot of campaigns); I'm just wondering. Thanks!

@Mouse: I just have to ask -- if we already have a subscription, should we choose a subscription here to renew, or will you be handling renewals separately later? As you know, this is one of my favorite things, and I don't want to miss out on anything.

I missed your first Kickstarter, so I'm thrilled at the chance to join your second. I'm looking forward to The Murders in the Rue Morgue. You had me at: "This is going to be our most beautiful book ever. Period."
Despite my past with Mouse Book Club, I am still a fan. Of course I signed up :) I can’t wait to get it!

campaign.story:
Robert F. Kennedy Funeral Train - The People's View  
June 8, 2018 will mark the 50th anniversary of the RFK funeral train. Up to one million Americans stood along the railway, paying their respects as the train slowly made its way from New York City to Washington, D.C. The book I intend to publish in spring 2018 will be a reflection on that day in the form of photographs, film stills, and the personal recollections of eyewitnesses. The beautiful color photographs taken for Look magazine by the photographer Paul Fusco from aboard the Robert F. Kennedy funeral train originally triggered my search for the reverse photographic perspective: What were these bystanders looking at and what did they see? The only way to find out was to look through their cameras and start searching for the people's views: the photos and films they had made of the events surrounding the journey of the RFK funeral train, including images of the very train itself, which remained outside Fusco's lens.  
My source of inspiration: 'Paul Fusco RFK' (Aperture, 2008)
  From early 2015 through summer 2017, I visited nearly every city, town, and neighborhood through which the train passed. I always had my copy of the book Paul Fusco: RFK (Aperture, 2008) with me. I knocked on many doors and hung around railway stations and bowling alleys. Thus I met many people and was able to collect their photographs of the event, including blurred snapshots, color and black-and-white photos, and Kodachrome slides, in addition to a handful of 8mm home movies. Furthermore, I recorded several personal interviews with people as they reflected on this particularly turbulent moment in American history, now almost half a century ago.
2 Elkton MD Photographer: Annie Ingram
For my book Robert F. Kennedy Funeral Train - The People's View I wish to link these images together, in the spirit of the people who stood side by side along the tracks in 1968.
The book will be an homage to RFK, the beautiful photo series by Paul Fusco, and the democratic tradition of the United States. I hope to make a contribution to the American collective memory. 1968 was marked by political and social upheaval, including the Civil Rights Movement, the assassinations of Martin Luther King and RFK, and the ongoing war in Vietnam. The world looked at America with a mixture of fascination and disbelief.
6 Baltimore MD_ Photographer: Herbert H. Harwood Jr
  5 Tullytown PA Photographer: William F. Wisnom Sr
This book also contains a section with 10 so far unpublished photos taken by Paul Fusco from aboard the funeral train. 
The acclaimed American art critic and poet David Levi Strauss has written a comprehensive essay for the book on the relationships between photography, history, and contemporary politics in light of the people's views of the RFK funeral train as collected for this project.
11 Elizabeth NJ Photographer: Rich Taylor
The book will be published in May 2018. At least three exhibitions based on this project are planned. The first will open in late March at the SFMoMA in San Francisco, combining this material with works by Paul Fusco and Philippe Parreno. This exhibition will also be shown in Les Rencontres d'Arles, France. I will also present this project at the International Center of Photography (ICP) in New York City in May 2018 and at the Dutch Photo Museum in Rotterdam, the Netherlands. At these exhibitions, I will present a film installation consisting of photos, film clips, and audio (recorded along the railroad on June 8, 1968), accompanied by narration of eyewitness accounts. 
3 Iselin NJ Photographer: Claire Leary
But I'm not there yet. I would really appreciate any financial support for this extensive project. Essentially, this is a collaborative project that could not exist without your help, about a subject and a time that has played such an important role within American society and far beyond, even to this very day.
Ardwick MD - Photographer: Alan Virta
Book details:
The photobook will be a joint publication between two non-profit publishers of photography and art books: Fw:Books (Amsterdam) and the Magnum Foundation (New York City).

Photographs and film stills: By Americans who stood along the railway on June 8, 1968
Texts: Essay by David Levi Strauss, letters and quotes from eyewitnesses
Preface and editing: Rein Jelle Terpstra
Graphic design: Jeremy Jansen
Translation and text editing: Felix van de Vorst, Hannah Vernier, and Taco Hidde Bakker.           
Photographs: approx. 140 color and black and white reproductions
Size: approx. 8 x 10.5 inches (203 mm × 267 mm)
Retail price: approx. $45

Publication date: May 2018 
All image rights belong to the owners of the images and are published with their full consent. 
tentative cover of the book
The book will also feature the names of all the participants who had confidence in this project and helped me by sharing their personal images, films, and stories. 
Rewards
As a special thank you, I offer several gifts in return for your kind support for this project.
See all gifts: 
http://www.reinjelleterpstra.nl/?key=e6ab5c11649a8d06010b12f3
(If the URL doesn’t link directly, please copy and paste the link into your browser window)
Of course, I would be delighted to meet those of you who are willing to help make this project a reality. If you decide to join me for a book launch, in either New York or Amsterdam (or another place in Europe), it would be my pleasure to personally hand the book to you. Please notify me beforehand and I'll refund the shipping cost. As soon as I know where the book launch will take place, I'll let you know. 
About myself:
I was born on July 4, 1960 (Independence Day), so I was nearly eight years old when RFK was assassinated. My father was very fond of the United States and all things American, in addition to being a true Kennedy admirer. He told us many stories about the Kennedys, which have left an imprint on me ever since. Later, as an artist, especially after a residency at the Rijksakademie van Beeldende Kunsten (Amsterdam), I began working with photography in relation to the theme of memory. My photo projects - slideshow installations and books - investigate the relationships between perception, memory, and the absence of images. My work is held in various collections, including the collection of artists' books at the MoMA Library (New York), The Royal Museum of Arts (Brussels), Yale University Library (New Haven), and the Getty Research Institute (Los Angeles). Furthermore, I was nominated for the Dutch Doc Award in 2014, and I teach fine arts and photography at Minerva Art Academy, Groningen (NL).
During the spring of 2017, I undertook a Smithsonian Artist Research Fellowship in Washington, D.C. to work on the project RFK Funeral Train - The People's View (2014-2018).
My website: www.reinjelleterpstra.nl
Project Facebook page: www.facebook.com/RFKfuneraltrain/
No part of this publication may be reproduced or transmitted in any form or by any means, electronic, mechanical, photocopying or recording otherwise, without the prior permission of the authors.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks and challenges when publishing a photo book include the possibility of delay, but as I am working with a professional publisher and a great team, we will do whatever we can to make sure the book is ready to be published and shipped in May 2018. 

Bear in mind that in accordance with the Kickstarter rules, the entire budget must be raised by the deadline in order for the pledged funds to be released. This policy protects the contributor and ensures that supporters will see a return on their pledge. It's all or nothing. 

Please share the campaign for this book project with your family, friends, and colleagues.

Thank you for your support! I sincerely appreciate it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear friends,  
I'd like to give you an update about the book Robert F Kennedy Funeral Train - The People's View and the more! 
 Many good things have happened in recent months. First of all, still 10 days to go to see the wall installation including original photographs, 8 mm home movies and a short film in the exhibition The Train at SFMOMA (San Francisco), which is on view thru June 10, 2018.  See: https://www.sfmoma.org/exhibition/train/

Dear all,
I know, it had been a long time since you heard from the book RFK Funeral Train-The People's View. I'm still in the turmoil, but I see a wonderful book ahead. And almost finished!
Some good news.                                                                                            
Thursday May 3rd the Dutch newspaper NRC Handelsblad will publish an article about the RFK funeral train project, very nicely written by Sandra Smallenburg.

Dear backers,
I want to thank you all for for supporting the realization of this book. It has been an exciting 4 weeks, but with your help it became possible. 
Coming weeks I am quite off line, but as soon as I am 'in office' again, I will take care of the administrative part of Kickstarter and keep you all updated about the moment the book is finished, the moment I can send you the book by post or invite you for the book launch, in Amsterdam as well as in New York City.

Dear all, 
I'like to send you an brief update about the book RFK funeral train.
Still 10 days to go, and I'd like to ask you to help me spreading the word, and bring this crowdfunding campaign to a happy end!
Meanwhile, they are doing a wonderful job at the SF MoMA, setting up The Train show, with Paul Fusco, me, and Philipe Parreno. All about the Robert F. Kennedy funeral train journey. It feels like I will come as a guest in the museum next week... everything will be hanged and painted on the wall! Thanks to the great museum team! I only have to concentrate on the RFK book and its funding now. Beware, still10 days to go, so don't miss the deadline to help this project on track!

campaign.story:
** UPDATE – we have hit both our stretch targets and are absolutely blown away. Thank you all for the support. 
So we will print 32 pages of beautiful colour photos and we will double the charity donation for each book 
Please continue to pledge and to share this project. And we will keep communicating in the 'Updates' tab, but if you're a first time viewer, please read on for more… **
The Rough Stuff Cycling in the Alps guide book was compiled by Fred Wright and self-published in 2002. 
It preserved the collective wisdom of generations of riders who pioneered riding the 'rough stuff' – riders who headed into the high peaks armed only with touring bikes and canvas rucksacks, sandals and floppy hats, crossing mountain ranges and joining up towns and famous cols on little-known gravel tracks, dirt trails and even icy climbs(!). 
This was gravel biking before gravel bikes – mountain biking before mountain bikes, in some cases. 
Fred's bike at the Fenêtre de Ferret, on his adventures in the late '80s.
The book contained nearly 300 routes, ranging from easy unsurfaced roads at little more than 1000m to steep footpaths above 3000m, and from the southern French Alps to Switzerland, the Dolomites and the Austrian Tirol.
Fred's original book
The entries often included detailed personal accounts of when the route was ridden, and the book also offered tips for beginners, advice on equipment and maps, and suggestions for routes not covered in the guide.
Original design and layout and maps
Only around 100 copies were made, and they are now impossible to find. But Fred does not want this information to be lost. With his permission we are reprinting Rough Stuff Cycling in the Alps, in a very limited edition, for the first time.
More and more of us are choosing to head off the beaten track with our bikes. Adventure touring, gravel biking, bikepacking – whatever you call it, we all want to get out there. The Alps are one of cycling’s ultimate playgrounds, and this guide is an invaluable resource of practical information about cycling in some of the most remote and beautiful places in Europe. 
Fred Wright at the top of the Arlscharte Pass, Austria, in 1992
Rough Stuff Cycling in the Alps is a springboard to adventure, something to leaf through and dream over, whether you’re planning your next bikepacking trip or simply sitting at home watching the raindrops run down the windowpanes and wishing you were out riding in the sun. 
We’re proud to offer a new edition of Fred’s book to the next generation of adventurers.
Above the Passo dello Stelvio, 1990
THE NEW EDITION 
The Isola Press Rough Stuff Cycling in the Alps will be a beautiful and functional object – a fitting way of preserving Fred's pioneering work. 
In it, we will reprint Fred’s work in its entirety. We will also improve and updating it. Fred typed his book at the library and bound it at his local branch of Staples. We will be using an art gallery-quality printer either in the UK or Belgium (depending on final order numbers). 
The new edition will be wiro-bound, and with rounded corners, for practicality, with a laminated card cover. 
Fred has also given us a large quantity of beautiful original photos from his travels, and we will print as many as we can. Have a look at the images in this campaign and the video – they are amazing!
The new cover – initial concept
 New for this edition there will be: 
16 new hand-drawn maps, showing the areas covered and the routes described, so that readers can easily locate the main towns and road passes, and the potential unpaved tracks and paths to navigate between them
A beautiful overall Alps map illustrated by Stefan Amato of Pannier.cc
An extended colour photo section. Fred included just four photos of his adventures. We will have at least 16 pages of original photos taken by Fred and other pioneers of rough stuff riding in the Alps. See the pics in this campaign for a selection.
A new introduction by Fred Wright himself, explaining the genesis of the book and recounting his riding life 
A new postscript by James Olsen (founder of the Torino-Nice Rally, who used the guide to create the TNR) on rough stuff in the 21st century. This will give advice for using the book in the age of mountain bikes and gravel bikes, bikepacking luggage, 3G and GPS 
Updated information – for example, on the availability of paper maps – and adding a few suggested routes where possible 
Every book sold on Kickstarter will include a £1 donation to the Rough Stuff Fellowship, and £1 split between Fred's chosen charity, the Salvation Army, and Smart Shelter Foundation. 
This new edition will mainly available via pre-sales. We will not be over-ordering stock and there will not be many available after the Kickstarter has closed – once they're gone, they're gone. 
Buy this book because you’re planning a trip, buy it for the incredible photos, buy it for inspiration – but please dig into your pockets and help us bring this amazing book back to life. 
A mock-up of the new text design and layout
Some initial layouts and tests for the new edition
 WHO ARE WE? 
Isola Press is run by me, Max Leonard. I have written books including Higher Calling, about why cyclists like riding in the mountains, and Lanterne Rouge, about the last man in the Tour de France. They’ve been published in multiple countries by Yellow Jersey (UK), Pegasus (USA) and others. In 2016 I set up Isola Press to make ‘adventures in illustrated books’. 
The first Isola Press book, Bunker Research, written by me and with Camille McMillan's photos of World War 2 bunkers in the Alps, won a prize: Best Self Published Book at the 2016 British Book Design & Production Awards. The second, The Men of Paris-Roubaix, was made in partnership with Rapha and presented beautiful archive portraits from the early years of cycling’s most beautiful one-day Classic. 
Bunker Research
The Men of Paris-Roubaix
Rough Stuff Cycling in the Alps will be the third Isola Press book. It will be designed by Andy Edwards. He’s also a cyclist, and a map geek. We’ve worked together on things including books for major publishers, like the Rapha City Cycling Europe guides for Thames & Hudson. 
We’ve been helped along the way in this reprinting project by Stefan of Pannier.cc, James of the Torino-Nice Rally and others. 
But mainly Fred Wright. Thanks Fred.
WHY ARE WE DOING THIS? 
I’m really passionate about riding my bike in the mountains. I do it to the exclusion of most normal things. I spend a lot of time, from snow melt to snow fall, on road bikes and on gravel in the Alps, mainly in France, exploring them. I love the mountains, and the people and the sights in them, and I have worked as a cycle guide with travel companies helping other people have these same experiences. 
Me! (photo: Antton Miettinen)
I wished I’d been able to find this book when I first read about it online – I searched and searched for it but couldn’t find one to buy – and now I’m in a position to help it live longer. That's a good thing. And Fred Wright, who made the original book, doesn’t want this knowledge to disappear as the surviving copies of the original edition disperse over time.
I also love making beautiful books. This will be a beautiful book. (On a slight side note, I also collect vintage postcards of the Alps, and I will give some away in the Kickstarter rewards, if you would like one!)
WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES
Our initial target basically covers:
Print costs for our minimum print run (I’m setting the minimum at 100 copies) 
Money to photographers for permission to use their photos 
Money to pay Fred and James to write new essays 
Money to pay Stefan to draw the new map 
 Kickstarter fees 
If we achieve our target, and I hope we will, we will set a range of stretch targets, which will include: 
An extended colour picture section
A bigger donation to charity
But more of that later as and when the time comes.
DELIVERY
Once the Kickstarter is finished, we estimate we are a month away from finishing the design, layout, proofing and other jobs.
We will then send it to print around the start of May for an early June delivery. So we anticipate sending it to backers then, in time for high Alpine adventures this summer.
REWARD DETAILS
Here's some more details about the different rewards offered.
Postcards: we took some of the best of Fred's images and made postcards of them, for you to send or display.
Some of the postcards we might send you
Vintage postcards: I've built up a collection of old postcards of the Alps, which I've used in other books. Some of them are unused, and if you choose the SPECIAL VINTAGE THANKS reward, Andy and I will sign and send one to you. 
Vintage postcards – someone has to buy them :-)
Limited edition Rough Stuff Alps x Pannier.cc cap: we designed this cap in association with Pannier.cc. It will be a one-time thing, and it'll be made through Rapha Custom, so the quality will be excellent. 
Proposed cap design
Café du Cycliste neck warmer: neck warmers are one of the most useful items to have on a mountain tour, and we love these stripy Merino ones from Café du Cycliste. More details here. Colours may vary.
Café du Cycliste Merino neck warmer
Isola Press books: Bunker Research uncovers the hidden history of modernism in the mountains through Camille McMillan's photography; The Men of Paris-Roubaix is a postcard book of beautiful archive portraits. For more visit the Isola Press website. 
Bunker Research and The Men of Paris-Roubaix
 The Pannier.cc Outdoor Coffee Kit comes with a titanium spork, 100g of premium Ember coffee and a limited edition Pannier.cc x Rough Stuff Alps dry bag to keep them in. 
The Outdoor Coffee Kit
The Limited Edition A3 print is being drawn by Stefan Amato of Pannier.cc.  It will be Giclée printed on archive quality paper. We will produce only 25and they will be printed by our friends at The Handmade Cyclist. Here are some work-in-progress images from the Alps map he is designing for us, which will be the basis of the print. 
•••
Thanks for reading
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As far as we see it, the risks in this project are fairly small. 

We already have permission from Fred Wright, who compiled and published the original, to reprint the text and the original photos, and we have already secured the rights to more images. 

We have a strong track record of writing, designing and producing beautiful, award-winning books about cycling and travel, and we will be working with a respected printer in the UK or in Belgium. 

We have set a low target – only 100 books – so I hope we will achieve this. However, we would like to print many more. 

As I said before, I am a small publisher and I can’t afford to over-order stock to keep sitting in my web shop (in my living room!). So please, if you want to own this unique, useful and fascinating book, support us now.

We are already working on the copy-editing and the layout, and we have printers lined up and ready. Please join us in this exciting journey!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
