@Paul I would look at the effects of impotence and depression as being useful for separate situations. If a player were hit with impotence multiple times, their hand would reach or exceed the six card limit, meaning they would have to discard enough cards to stay at six - this could reintroduce cards you may want to the draw pile. Depression would be more useful in the end game when you suspect an opponent may be close to treating everything in their psyche, or are worried they have a card they plan to use against you.

I agree with Aimee.. I would rather the terminology “Disease” be replaced with “Disorder.” I will back no matter what, but maybe a backer poll could help you make an educated decision on whether or not to change the words.

As a mental health professional, it would bother me immensely if you referred to mental disorders as diseases because that is not the proper terminology! I don't expect everything to be accurate, but that's a pretty simple one. One of the things that drew me to the game was knowing right off the bat that lorazepam IS a medication used for anxiety. The accuracy makes it extremely funny to me, and maybe even a learning tool. In closing, disorder, I think, is an easy chance and would avoid spreading the misconception I battle every day: mental illness is not cured. It's managed and something you work in an active process to recover from, if possible.

I want to add that I understand that the woman's doctor compounded the problem by telling her that not only did she have a disease, but it wasn't curable. I hope she found a new doctor! Thank goodness for help lines. Anyway, I have only looked up sites for anxiety so far, and none of them called it a disease. Just my 2 cents

This woman was clearly distressed by the use of the word"disease". Once her doctor explained it was a "disorder", she calmed down. Now, granted, I'm sure there are many things that upset her that wouldn't you and I, but I just included this as an example of how words, and their connotations matter, especially in a sensitive topic, such as this game.

As for me ... I have two mental illnesses ... I have ADD and OCD. Some few days they crush me as I feel I need to get everything done at once but don't have the ability to do it perfectly so I end up paralyzed and do nothing ... most days I harness them. I was asked by a newpaper interviewer how I was able to run an online company with two store fronts, have wholesale distribution and run 11 successful Kickstarters in the last 13 months. My response was that ADD and OCD are actually pretty powerful tools if you can harness them for good. And the more I've thought about my answer to that newspaper interview ... the more I realize my son's comments on the Side Effects game. I choose to have a laugh at my mental illnesses at that moment much like he was saying this game was seen by him. The Big Bad is not so big and so bad when you can laugh it in the face.

campaign.story:
We Read More Than Ever, But What Are We Reading?
Congratulations! You are alive at a time when human beings are reading more than ever. But too often we choose sources of shallow information like news feeds, photo streams, online news, and email.
Read With a Purpose
Mouse Books brings great literature to the mobile space. Our physical books are phone-sized, hand-selected, durable, beautiful, approachable texts that go with you anywhere. They never run out of battery life, they don’t have screens that crack, and they don’t ring, buzz, or vibrate. Mouse Books are all 48 pages.
GIVING COLLECTION
Since starting Mouse Books, the number one comment we receive from people is, "I think this is really cool, BUT I KNOW SOMEONE WHO WOULD LOVE THIS!" That feedback became the inspiration for this campaign. We created a collection of three books around the theme of GIVING that helps us take a reflective attitude into the holiday season. We're also designed a custom GIFT CARD to accompany the books!
HOW MOUSE WORKS 
CURATE: Our Mouse editors carefully curate selections of literature, short stories, speeches, poetry, and more, all structured around themes that are topical, challenging, and varied. Basically, we create a great literary playlist.
DESIGN: Each text is thoughtfully designed cover-to-cover to make the reading experience easy, fun, and beautiful. 
BUY: Readers can buy a single themed three-pack and/or a subscription of a monthly book shipment. 
READ & SHARE: Read Mouse Books on a plane, during your commute, in a coffee shop, at the dentist, at home. When you finish your Mouse Book, give it a home on your bookshelf, or pass it on to a friend, family member, or stranger!
REFLECT: Reading without reflection is like eating without digestion (Edmund Burke). Reading Mouse Books is just the first step: We organize online discussions, host weekly podcasts, support local book clubs, and provide thought-provoking questions at the back of the text. 
BUILD COMMUNITY: The Mouse Book Club brings people together around great works of literature. Join a movement of reading that demands we slow down, look around, reflect on how we are living, and imagine the possibilities of humanity.
Book reader or phone junkie? Mouse is here to help.
CAREFULLY CRAFTED 
Mouse Books are meticulously designed. From the text size, to the thickness and color of the paper—every element has been considered, tested, and refined to give you the best and most portable reading experience.
SUBSCRIBE TO MOUSE BOOKS!
  A one year subscription will get you one book a month, plus the corresponding audiobooks, podcasts, and surprises! Check out our page on Kickstarter DRIP! You can also buy subs as gifts!!!
SURPRISE & DELIGHT
Our team of editors and designers put a tremendous amount of care into the Mouse Book experience. Our objective is to surprise and delight you with every single shipment. From our in-house podcast book club to surprises slipped into your shipment, we are constantly scheming to create a mind-blowing experience. Basically, we want receiving your shipment of Mouse Books to be one of the best feelings in your life.
WORLD-CLASS PRINTER
We are obsessed with making these books extremely high-quality. We've partnered with one of the great printers in the USA, eDOC Communications from Mount Prospect, Illinois, to bring Mouse Books to life. And since our printing partner is local to our Chicago-based team, we know our quality standards are upheld during every print run. 
MOUSE FEVER
Some user LOVE:
“I received the package today! Wow, thank you!! I love everything!” —Russel in Louisville
“I just love this little thing.” —John in Oakland
“I love the concept. I toted my Flaubert book around town with me yesterday and enjoyed the break from constantly checking emails! ” —Carrie in Chicago
“I LOVE being a member of the Mouse Club!! I smile every time I see my card in my wallet.... mostly because I think about what an amazing thing you’ve done. Experiencing the written word tactically is not only irreplaceable and difficult to articulate, but it is vital we read, caress and FEEL the power the written word possesses. We have strayed so far!!” —Kelly in Walla Walla
TEAM
Brian Chappell: Ph.D, Teacher, Spiritual Philosopher 
David Dewane: Architect, Journalist, Social Entrepreneur 
Courtney Garvin: Graphic Designer, Runner, Epoch B All-Star
Chris Motley: Architect, Snowboarder, Smooth Operator
SPECIAL THANKS TO: Derrick Dodson and Derek Lee!
T-H-A-N-K Y-O-U-!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Mouse Books is, in our estimation, a very low-risk project. We have two major costs: printing and shipping. We have a keen understanding of both, having printed and shipped more than 5,000 books. 

The main risk in this campaign is timing. We have all the GIVING COLLECTION files ready to send to the printer and will order the books as soon as we reach the $10,000 threshold. We will ship the day the campaign ends to ensure that it reaches all backers in time for holidays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

With the 25th being Monday, a holiday, and USPS not working on Sundays, the real target date for delivery by Christmas is Saturday the 23rd. Since Mouse Books said they'll be using first-class shipping with USPS, as long as they get out by about the 20th, we ought to get them in time. Even sending by the 21st would probably be OK, but the 20th is a little safer. Worst case scenario is that we don't cross $10k until the day the campaign ends on Friday the 15th, and they only have a few days (that include a weekend) to get the books printed, sent to them, and shipped to us. We know they've started a bit on that already though (they showed us a cover in the last update), so that will help no matter what happens. But this is why the sooner we cross the goal, the better -- it gives Mouse Books more time to get things done in time. We've got to keep sharing and trying to get as many eyes as possible on this project; more views, more backers. I shared again this morning on Twitter. :)

Will you be shipping the holiday books the same way as previous orders? I believe it’s Media Mail which unfortunately seems to take over 5 business days to get to me in Los Angeles. Just trying to wrap my head around the total time from printing to packing to shipping if the books will arrive before the 25th.

I see that we're up to 250 backers now, and around 86% funded. I think we're still on pace to hit the goal early, which would be good because Mouse Book can start production before the campaign ends. And while I'm confident we can reach the goal, we're getting close enough that I'm getting anxious to see us cross the line. :) I'll feel better when we do get there; hopefully it'll just be a few more days.
I love the new look of the inside cover!

@Jamie: Thanks, but I didn't track and plot things out myself. I went to this project's listing on kicktraq,com where they have the info and just reported on that. BTW, those stats are still about the same, but the high projection is lower now. Still, we're 3/4 funded now, well on the way to a successful campaign. If we keep sharing this (I've been doing so probably twice a day on Twitter), hopefully it will bring in more backers to get us to the goal sooner rather than later.
@James...your posts are awesome. Mouse books are my favorite too. Love that you plotted out the funding!

200 backers and 2/3 funded. We're getting there! :)

FWIW, Kicktraq currently has us trending towards almost $14k with a projected total ranging from a bit over $13k to almost $22k. The projections have us crossing the $10k goal somewhere between days ~12.5 and 16 of the campaign, which would be about December 5/6 to the 9th, if I counted correctly. I know any sort of trend/projection has its pros and cons, but this seems like a good sign that we should be able to reach the funding goal before the campaign ends, giving Mouse Books a chance to get production started early, which would be good since we know they're willing to do that -- it would help ensure on-time delivery. If we keep up the sharing, maybe we can cross the goal within a week! :)
Thank you so much for these books!
Mouse Books is one of my favorite projects, so I try to keep up on it. :)
I hope this helps. Thanks for joining us, and help spread the word if you can! :)

I've been sharing the project on social media, and I hope others have as well, to try to encourage more people to back. I do have to be a little careful about annoying my followers with too many posts, but I'll continue to share as frequently as seems appropriate.

We're about 1/3 funded right now, and should have plenty of time left to reach the goal. Hopefully we'll get there sooner rather than later, because the sooner the goal is hit, the sooner Mouse Books can start production, thereby increasing the chances of delivery by Christmas.

Agreed that talking over ideas, questions, etc. can be quite helpful, but I'd still like to see them printed in the books themselves. Putting them online in a forum for discussion is great, but I'd prefer that going online not be a requirement for getting those questions, that's all.
So excited to find your new project & I can’t wait to give these as gifts to friends & family who are probably tired of hearing me go on & on about the original campaign! Thanks, y’all!!

I agree that backers of the original campaign should know about this one. I commented there, but an official update by MBC that gets e-mailed to everyone would be better. That would make sure everyone knows about this, and probably encourage a bunch of them to back here, too.
Just found you by "chance". As far as I can tell, no email arrived from mousebookclub...backer #41 :) Love the red covers and the theme...

True, both places could work and have their pros and cons. I would like to see questions printed in the books though, so that you don't have to get online to access them. After all, Mouse Books is kind of trying to get us away from our screens and into their books. ;) But you're right that having an online forum for discussing things, where the questions could also be posted as starters, could be way to build the community. That would be a nice option to have, too.
Great idea James. Or maybe post them on their blog so folks could discuss! It would be a nice way to build community.

@Jaime: Hi! :) I happened to be in front of my computer when I got the Kickstarter following e-mail about this project, so I was mostly lucky with being first. Normally, I'd probably be quick to back, but not *that* quick. And AFAIK, you're right about the back-of-the-book questions. I don't think they've been present since one of the earliest copies. It looks like all of the more recent ones have a "did you just find this book?" section that encourages passing the books along instead. I guess I can see that -- being a new company and product, they want to get the word out as far and wide as possible. But I agree that it would be nice to have questions in the back again to help guide thinking about the texts. The inside front cover is mostly empty: maybe questions could be printed there, or some of the inside back cover text could be moved to the inside front cover to make room for questions at the back?
Thanks for offering the ten sets of the Giving Collection. It is a great way to spread the news about Mouse Books! I love the cover colors.

Hooray! Good to see James! I would have been number 2, but I was at work! So quick question y'all...on the campaign it talks about there being questions in the back of the mouse books for reflection. I saw that in one mouse book, but there haven't been any in the subsequent books. Any particular reason? I also wanted to mention another use for these great little books-bibliotherapy! They are the perfect size/price to use with clients (another reason I was hoping for questions in the back-so helpful for folks not used to thinking critically about texts)! Love this project and LOVE ME SOME MOUSE BOOKS!

Oh, also, you should probably send an update about this campaign to backers of the original one. Being another one of your projects, it will likely be of interest to backers of the previous one. You might not want to advertise this one there a lot, but I see no harm in making one post to notify everyone about this related campaign.

Thanks, for both the welcome and the info -- always glad to be here! And I'm glad to see that this isn't a different-content subscription, so I'm covered already with my original subscription. I just have to make sure I get things like this that are outside of my subscription content. ;)

campaign.story:
TLDR: Storyteller Bill Gordh has collected myths and fairy tales from cultures around the world, which we are presenting in seven letterpress-printed and hand-bound volumes, each themed on a different virtue, with illustrations by John Hutton. We are offering them in a beautiful limited edition, and in ebook and audiobook formats.
Stories of virtue, stories of wonder.
Children's literature is the cornerstone of modern society. With it, we impart the wisdom of the past to the citizens and leaders of the future. Through story, through fable, through myth, through fairy tale, we teach the virtues upon which we build our society. There can be no more important role in literature than this—and in this, children's literature is supreme.
And so, we proudly present Seven Towers of Wonder, a seven-volume set of myths and fairy tales, collected by storyteller Bill Gordh and illustrated by John Hutton.
Stories from cultures around the world.
Each volume is a collection of seven classic myths and fairy tales on a theme. Gathered from around the world and imaginatively retold by Bill Gordh and illustrator John Hutton, each breathes new magic into old stories, and teaches lessons important to both the young and old. The stories are as follows . . .
Vol. 1 - Courage
Dewando and the Flying Head (Iroquois - Native American)
The Story of Tom Thumb (Germany)
Inchworm Mountain (Miwok - Native American)
A Bundle of Sticks (West Africa)
Mehmet, the Brave Little Mouse (Turkey)
Three Friends (Thailand)
Sumac and the Magic Lake (Ecuador)
Vol. 2 - Courage
The Woodcutter's Dream (Eastern Europe)
The Boulevard of Somersaults (Mexico)
Magpie and Milk (Turkey)
Hansel and Gretel (Germany)
The Peaceful Night (Scotland)
The Happy Man's Shirt (Italy)
Pandora and the Beautiful Box (Greece)
Vol. 3 - Justice
The Farmer and the Dragon or The Way of the World (Norway)
Snow-White (Germany)
Anacy and the Stone with a Beard (West Africa)
The Crow Ship (South America)
Kwame, the Parrot, and the Singing Canary (West Africa)
The Story Bird (Mongolia)
The Talking Eggs (African American)
Vol. 4 - Faith
Mr. Wanna Be Big (African America)
Daniel in the Lion's Den (Bible)
Time Will Tell (Middle East)
Frost (Russia)
Snow Babies (Arctic) 
Whatever Comes My Way (England)
Songs for an Egg (Africa) 
Vol. 5 - Wisdom
Turtle and Knowledge (West Africa)
Half a Blanket (Mexico)
The Emperor's New Cloths (Denmark)
The Frogs' Chief (Abenaki - Native American)
Jonah and the Whale (Middle East)
The Best King (Thailand)
Tomorrow Monkeys (Brazil)
Vol. 6 - Temperance 
The King Who Wished To Touch The Moon (Dominican Republic)
The Fisherman and his Wife (Germany) 
The Talkative Turtle (India)
The Purple Jackal (India)
The Fountain of Youth (Japan)
Henny Penny (England)
The Dragon's Eye (China)
Vol. 7 - Love
The Night Fisherman and the Mermaid (Indonesia) 
The Three Daughters (Kazakhstan)
Beauty and the Beast (France)
The Rabbit in the Moon (India) 
Strawberry Fields Forever (Native American - Cherokee)
Bread to Roses (Italy)
The Most Beautiful Gift (China)
These are no ordinary books. They are "fine press" publications (we'll get into what that means in a moment). Each volume is printed letterpress, and bound by hand by master craftsmen and each is offered in two different bindings: in letterpress paper wrappers, and in half Moroccan leather with handmade pastepaper - both hand-bound by our master binders. Each volume is in an edition of only 350 copies.
The books are printed letterpress using archival inks on fine paper stock.
Each volume includes a fold-out tower illustration, with seven floors corresponding to the seven stories of the volume.
The letterpress paper-wrapper bindings.
The half-leather bindings.
Half-leather volumes pledged for individually come in a clamshell box; the whole set of half-leather volumes comes in a slipcase.
Seven magnificent full-leather sets.
We are making only seven magnificent full-leather sets of Seven Towers. Each set is completely unique— one of a kind. The volumes are bound in full Moroccan leather and include gold tooling on the front. Each set uses a different dyed leather, so get your favorite color while you can! The sets are: Scarlet, Green, Vivid Blue, Purple, Yellow, Midnight Blue, and Crimson.
We are offering seven unique full-leather sets. Note: yellow set not shown.
Each full-leather volume is hand-tooled with decoration from the stories.
A master storyteller meets a master illustrator.
It has been an absolute joy to work with Bill Gordh and John Hutton who, together, created these seven towers of wonder.
Bill Gordh is an award-winning Banjo-playing storyteller, author, educator, and early childhood literacy specialist. He has studied and collected myths and fairy tales from across the world. He has performed countless times, including as the featured storyteller at the White House Easter Egg Roll on three occasions. Here's a clip of Bill reading the Turkish tale of Mehmet from volume one, The Tower of Courage.
John Hutton is a celebrated artist, illustrator and art historian. He was educated at Princeton, Harvard, and the Courtauld Institute and is fascinated by the art of storytelling. He has illustrated numerous children's books including eleven titles for Thornwillow Press and several projects for the White House Historical Association.
Audiobook and Ebook!
We have been working on these limited edition for nearly ten years now, and are thrilled to bring them all to the public. We believe that literature is for everybody, and so we are offering The Seven Towers of Wonder in audiobook and ebook formats - to be included with every tier.
The audiobooks present Bill Gordh reading the stories, and the ebooks present the illustrations of John Hutton. 
Backers will receive these monthly—that is, one volume every month—starting at the end of the project. It will something to look forward to in your inbox, every month through the end of the year and beyond.
What is a 'fine press' book?
Most folks have never encountered a 'fine press' book. It's truly something to behold! While most books are mass-produced in factories where machine spit out cheaply-made volumes meant to be discarded after a few reads, a 'fine press' book is made with master craftsmanship, with the finest materials, and with heart.
We start with the layout. While most publishers' first concern is minimizing page count (to reduce printing costs), ours is readability and elegant design. Our books are laid out by our team of master typographers, using specially crafted fonts and centuries-old design techniques based on the golden ratio. We aspire to creating an unrivaled reading experience, to enhance the relationship between the reader and the written word. In this digital age when you can turn a book on and off with a switch, we believe that typography and layout matters.
A few sample pages from 'The Tower of Courage'.
Then comes the printing. Each page is printed letterpress, a technique dating back to Gutenberg and the first printing presses. The words are literally pressed into the paper on our historic Heidelberg press. Reading a letterpress book is an experience like no other: you feel the text as you run your finger across the page. We use only the finest archival ink and heavy stock. While trade paperbacks yellow and wither away, our books will last far longer than we will. For this reason, Thornwillow books are included among many of the world's great archival collections, including the Smithsonian, the Vatican, and the White House, to name only a few.
Master-printer Sergio running our Heidelberg flatbed cylinder press.
And then we bind each volume by hand. The pages are sewn together, and then bound in leather, letterpress paper wrappers, and paste papers, depending on the version. A great deal of time goes into the binding of each book, the quality of which you can feel when you hold one in your hand. If you've never experienced a hand-bound book before, this is an excellent place to start.
Each binding is made by hand. Here the signatures are being sewn and glued together.
Using only the finest materials, and historic techniques. Throughout the entire process, we use only the finest materials, from archival inks to heavy wove paper stock. The presses and techniques we use are historic. In making books in this way, we continue a great tradition which has been passed down for centuries, and which is at the heart of culture.
A historic Chandler & Price printing press, hard at work using our finest archival inks.
But that's not all: we're presenting three other children's literature classics!
For those who can't get enough, or for those who aren't quite ready to jump head first into the world of fine bookmaking, we're offering three s-h-o-r-t titles, three little gems: Cinderella, The Walrus and the Carpenter, and A Visit From St. Nick - all classics of children's literature, printed letterpress and hand-bound.
Each of these editions feature illustrations from John Hutton, and are printed in multiple colors. They also offer a panoply of different bindings—if you're interested in fine bindings, we suggest picking up all three! Cinderella is bound in handmade pastepaper wrappers, with a letterpress title label. The Walrus and the Carpenter includes an essay by Adam Gopnik and is bound in letterpress wrappers. And A Visit From St. Nick is bound in green cloth and handmade pastepaper hardcovers.
A look inside 'Cinderella' and 'A Visit From St. Nick'.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have successfully completed several projects before, including an edition of Shakespeare's 'Sonnets' and Arthur Conan Doyle's 'Sherlock Holmes' stories. We will communicate with our backers in case any unexpected difficulties arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: There's One Week Left to back Agatha Christie's DEATH ON THE NILE
updates.update_content:
Dear Subscriber:
As you were a backer of our edition of THE SEVEN TOWERS OF WONDER, I wanted to be sure you knew that we are in the final week of the launch of our next book, Agatha Christie's DEATH ON THE NILE. If you are interested in her work, there is still time to reserve a copy at pre-publication prices. It will be the first ever fine press edition of one of Christie's most iconic works and we are honored to have been entrusted by Agatha Christie's family and estate to print and publish this special collector edition.

Friends,
We are immensely excited to announce that, at long last, the E-Towers are complete.  The final audiobook was sent to us just an hour ago, and it is with great pride that we present it to you now.
You can download all seven volumes using this link:

Friends,
Volume four, The Tower of Faith, is now available. Use the following link to access it and the past volumes. We are excited to announce that the next two volumes will be coming soon. Thanks again for all the wonderful comments we've received from you (and your kids)! 
E-Towers

Friends,
The second volume of e-towers will be available this week. In the meantime, I wanted to share some production photos of the physical volumes, and tell you about our newest project. First, the photos   .   .   .

Friends,
Thank you for your massive support of Seven Towers. To our new friends joining Thornwillow on a project for the first time: thank you! To our old friends who have joined us time after time: THANK YOU! Nearly three hundred of you have made this project possible, and we are thrilled to start sharing production updates.

campaign.story:
Expectations
 Tanera (Ar Dùthaich) depicts the intricacies of living and working in a tiny rural community. Exploring the continually evolving relationship between people and the landscape in such communities; Tanera takes its name from an island in the Summer Isles archipelago off the west coast of Scotland. The few residents there have forged a thriving business, which not only values the heritage of the landscape itself, but also has an eye on modernity and ecological sustainability. Though it sounds idyllic, managing the island is time consuming, weather-dependent and costly. 
Having made this work whilst living and working on the island, my intention was to elaborate on these difficulties, exploring widely held romantic notions about the Scottish landscape, whilst also trying to get under the surface to the vernacular level. The images attempt to show a ‘portrait of place’ through views, details and portraits of the people who contribute to the fabric of the island. I've always been fascinated by the way that humans leave traces and marks evident within the landscape; a calling card of their existence. Over time these traces build-up, layered on top of each-other forming a kind of catalogue of existence like a palimpsest. This becomes particularly evident in smaller, self-contained or continually populated landmasses, such as Tanera Mhor. With this work I wanted to explore both this rich past, as a Viking sanctuary, and a fishing and crofting community, and it's current state and the people who are leaving their traces today. I felt in a privileged position; neither outsider, nor truly local resident- engaged anthropologically but still able to access a degree of objectivity. The intention was to encourage the viewer to reflect on the relationships evidenced and challenge some tropes about rural life.
Escaping Hebridian
      Patricia
   Firstly thank you for stopping by the page and spending some time with my project. The aim is to produce a stunning photography book of a stunning place, which gives something of a flavour of the area and the contribution people have made to the island.
Steve
Combining my images with texts, both from my time on the island, and several perspectives from people who have long associations with Tanera, I hope to give a rich and varied understanding of Tanera as a place. This understanding will ideally be specific to Tanera but draws parallels to other rural areas. It was important to me to try and represent the multiplicity and variety of such communities and, for this project, not to be solely about my own viewpoint, as a half-outsider.  
Roslyn Bay
  Eleanor
Tigh-An Quay
       The book is not intended as a complete history of Tanera, nor a catalogue of everyone who has ever lived there or ever contributed to the fabric of the place. With a place like Tanera, periodically inhabited for over 1000 years, such a task would be impossible. It was my intention to create a small but timeless snapshot, focused on the particulars of how the island has been managed for the past 20 or so years. Perhaps also suggestive of other times, or places and of rural living generally. 
Derry
     
Jane
  
Tanera Bay - Looking South East
  
Scott
   This Kickstarter is an attempt to realise that goal. Much of the local area’s history and traditions (as with much of the Highlands & Islands) relies on oral traditions and passing knowledge through spoken word, from one generation to the next. As such, much of Tanera’s history remains sketchy, with the exception of the period when Frank Fraser Darling lived and worked on the island during the 1940s. I hope this book will be a modest, but more tangible contribution to the timeline of such an inspiring place.
Island Life
      Thank you again for spending some time with my project. Please feel free to get in touch with any questions you may have, or follow the page to chart the Kickstarter progress. You can also find the project page on Facebook: @taneraproject.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are very few risks associated with this project. The work has all been made, the images are all ready and I have the experience and drive to pull everything together.

I have been part of several other successful Kickstarter campaigns, but as a park of a group or collective:

updates.update_content:
Again a MASSIVE thanks for your patience whilst I've been beavering away! The book is currently at the printers. I had some proofs back over the weekend and I have to say, I'm REALLY excited to see the whole project in its final book form now...! Hopefully everyone has also received their backer surveys by now, please drop me a message if you haven't. As an extra thank you for waiting, I'd like to send out the prints and postcards ahead of the books, as I appreciate you've all been waiting for a long time!
I've had masses of help from my designer over the past 3 months or so. Huge thanks go to Sean Dooley (who's also an excellent photographer- you can check out his photography !), without whom the book wouldn't be looking anything like as clean and modern as it does.I'd also like to thank everyone who's agreed to be interviewed and spent evenings chatting to me over the last few months. It's been great to hear your thoughts and feelings about this incredible island and record them, so hopefully more people can enjoy, appreciate and understand something of what it's like living in this kind of remote place.

So we did it! We in fact more than did it- over a grand over target. Thank you so much to all of you for contributing to make this happen in such a spectacular fashion!
This is the last post of the two month campaign, but I'm not going to be doing too much looking back. Instead I want to tell you about the exciting things coming up. Obviously the first thing most of you will be thinking about is the book. I'm currently doing the last bits of research, quote gathering etc before finally committing to choosing the printer. Then I'll be working with a designer to finalise the sequence and bring the whole book together. I will of course keep you updated over the next few months as this progresses.

This is incredible.. I never expected to be saying this on Week 5 but we've made it! We've reached our target- thanks to all your contributions and sharing of the project!
Thank you all so much- this is incredible- I haven't stopped smiling all weekend! I'm really looking forward to putting this book together and making it the best it can possibly be for you all, and for the beautiful place and incredible people pictured.
By all means keep sharing the project- we've now moved on to taking pre-orders for a fully funded book! ;) Anything additional above the target we get over the next 25 days will go directly into making the book even better (better printing, binding, heavier paper stock etc.)

updates.update_userinfo: Final Campaign Post, First 'Bringing the book to Life' post
updates.update_content:
Given that you'd been hearing from me pretty regularly for the last two or three weeks, I decided to give you a bit of a break whilst I tried to sort out various exciting up-coming things for the Tanera project. Thanks for your patience on that!
So firstly, we're still steadily getting more interest and backers- please keep spreading the word! Your personal recommendations really do make all the difference!
If you're living in Scotland but can't make it up to Ullapool before the exhibition finishes, fear not! The show will now be going to the Sawyer Gallery at Inverewe Gardens. Only slightly further South admittedly but it will be there for a further month from the 2nd September. This is part of , whose theme this year is People & Place- a perfect fit for the Tanera project.

Week 2 ends (roughly week 2 anyway...) and we've made 25% of our target- a real mixture of new faces and old friends- thanks again everyone for your support! Please keep on sharing the project and telling people about the Kickstarter directly. It really does make a difference if it comes from someone else who really believes in work, other than me!
In other news- if you happen to be in Athens, Greece you can check out some portraits from the Tanera work in a group show of Black & White Portraiture at Blank Wall Gallery until July 6th 2017.

Usually I'm wary of starting a blog-post with a line like 'WOW! What a crazy week!' but in this instance I'm finding it difficult to resist...
Thanks to you guys, we've made it to 18%- nearly 20% of the target in just seven short days! It's a absolute privilege to have got such support for this work already! I really appreciate too, all those people who've been finding the project through the BBC article, Twitter, Facebook etc. and generously backing the project 'cold' so to speak- having only just come across this work. Your support feels like a huge gift.

campaign.story:
The Font Deck is a practical guide to typography, printed on high-quality Bicycle® playing cards.
Each of the 52 faces contains a mini-lesson about fonts, complete with a beautiful visual example.
With this deck, designers and non-designers alike can learn the fundamentals and key terms of typography, improve at recognizing important fonts, discover fascinating history, and get better at using typography in their daily lives. 
It's essentially a typography textbook crammed into a deck of cards.

Topics
Here is a list of the topics covered on the faces of the cards.
    Card Stock
The Font Deck is being printed by the United States Playing Card Company, in Erlanger, Kentucky. They make the best playing cards in the world, including Bicycle® and Bee®, casino-quality decks. The smallest batch they will produce is 2,500 decks, so that's why your pledges will give me the funds and quantities to manufacture with such a great company.
This deck is being printed on Bicycle® card stock, with Air-Cushion finish. Air-Cushion finish is a linen-textured coating on the cards that give them an incredibly smooth, slippery feel. They're a pleasure to play with.
The USPCC's high-quality industrial printing presses give the cards a rich, vibrant colour, and the lettering is very crisp and legible.
   The Rewards
 
 The Design Deck
In 2014, I designed and kickstarted the Design Deck, and received tremendous support from the design community, with almost 1000 backers.
Since then, thousands have of Decks have been sent to dozens of countries. The Design Deck is available as a reward for this campaign, so you can have the pair of decks. If you'd like to purchase the Design Deck and get it right away, click here to visit my website.

Typeface Poster
Another pledge reward for backing the Font Deck is the 'How to Choose a Typeface' poster that I designed. It allows you to answer a few simple questions, follow the flow chart, and then arrive at the perfect font for your project.

The History of Typography
A few years ago, I created a stop-motion animation about the history of typography. It seemed to strike a chord with people, receiving more than a million views, and that prompted me to create the Design Deck and now, the Font Deck.

Thanks for your support!
To get in touch, please send me a message on Kickstarter or email me at forrestmediaco@gmail.com. If you'd like to order a Design Deck right now, click here to visit my website.
Click these links to follow the Font Deck on Instagram and Facebook.
Thanks!
Ben Barrett-Forrest

updates.update_userinfo: A printing update, and a few cards to peruse
updates.update_content:
Hi everybody,
Printing update
The Font Deck is almost a reality! The most recent update from my manufacturer is that the card sheets are printed, and now they are starting the 'finishing' process. That's where the individual cards are punched out from the large sheets, then put into the tuck cases and sealed up. 
This process takes 10 days, so the decks will be shipped to me on October 27. And I'll ship them out to you as soon as I receive them!

Hi there,
Thanks for your patience while I worked out a few things with the United States Playing Card Company, the folks printing the Font Deck. There was an issue with the kerning of the letters on the proofs they sent me, so we had to go back and forth for a couple weeks until all the spacing was just perfect. (The irony of a deck about typography being printed with improper kerning would have just been too much.)

updates.update_userinfo: The Font Deck is ready for printing (+ pictures!)
updates.update_content:
Hi there,
The Font Deck is entering the home stretch! 
For the past month, I’ve been working with the United States Playing Card Company to get everything perfect and ready for production. It has been combed through by two talented copy editors, and every little detail has been refined. Below are some shots of the finalized cards and the tuck case in the printing template. (The nines of diamonds will be replaced by the correct numbers in printing.)

Hooray! We did it!
Thanks to all of you fantastic folks, the Font Deck was funded, and will become a reality. I am so appreciative of all the support, and I am excited to get this baby out to you!

campaign.story:
We crushed our first STRETCH GOAL!
***STRETCH GOAL 1.5 — help us reach our COMMUNITY GOAL of 1,000 BACKERS!***
$75,000 STRETCH GOAL — ILLUSTRATED VERSION OF ARABIAN NIGHTS!!!
We Read More Than Ever, But What Are We Reading?
Congratulations! You are alive at a time when human beings are reading more than ever. But too often we choose sources of information—news feeds, photo streams, online news, email—that nourish our minds like candy bars nourish our bodies. What if we all spent 10% more time reading great literature?￼ 
Read With a Purpose
Mouse Books is literature for the mobile space. Our books are hand-selected, durable, beautiful, approachable texts that go with you anywhere. They never run out of battery life, their ‘screens’ never crack, and they don’t ring, buzz, or vibrate. Mouse Books are all 48 pages. 
 Here’s how it works: 
CURATE: Our Mouse editors carefully curate selections of literature, short stories, speeches, poetry, and more, all structured around themes that are topical, challenging, and varied. Basically, we create a great literary playlist.
DESIGN: Each text is thoughtfully designed cover-to-cover to make the reading experience easy, fun, and beautiful.  
BUY: Readers can buy a single themed three-pack or a subscription of quarterly, themed shipments. Each quarterly shipment includes a themed series (three-pack), bonus books, and other surprises. 
READ & SHARE: Read Mouse Books on a plane, during your commute, in a coffee shop, at the dentist, at home. When you finish your Mouse Book, give it a home on your bookshelf, or pass it on to a friend, family member, or stranger! And if you subscribe, we’ll send you extras to pass around to people in your life.
REFLECT: Reading without reflection is like eating without digestion (Edmund Burke). Reading Mouse Books is just the first step: We organize online discussions, host weekly podcasts, support local book clubs, and provide thought-provoking questions at the back of the text.
BUILD COMMUNITY: The Mouse Book Club brings people together around great works of literature. Join a movement of reading that demands we slow down, look around, reflect on how we are living, and imagine the possibilities of humanity.
   CAREFULLY CRAFTED 
 Mouse Books are meticulously designed. From the text size, to the thickness and color of the paper—every element has been considered, tested, and refined to give you the best and most portable reading experience.
   QUARTERLY THEMES 
Each quarter our literary experts curate a selection of three pieces of literature (short stories, speeches, poetry, and more) that explore a given theme. Take the guess-work out of book-picking, and be sure you're reading dignified texts wherever you go.
LIMITED EDITION BONUS BOOKS
And there is more! In addition to the themed 3-pack of books, in each quarterly shipment there will also be some surprise, limited-edition bonus books carefully chosen by our team! (subscribers only!)
ONE YEAR OF MOUSE BOOKS!
A one year subscription will get you all of this! Four quarterly themes, bonus books, and surprise goodies! 
SURPRISE & DELIGHT
Our team of editors and designers put a tremendous amount of care into the Mouse Book experience. Our objective is to surprise and delight you with every single shipment. From our in-house podcast book club to surprises slipped into your shipment, we are constantly scheming to create a mind-blowing experience. Basically, we want receiving your shipment of Mouse Books to be one of the best feelings in your life.
  KICKSTARTER EDITION - $75,000 Stretch Goal
The Mouse team is thrilled with the Kickstarter experience and to celebrate we want to make this stretch goal a collaboration with YOU. Last week, we put out a call for artists from the backer pool and got many amazing responses. Ultimately, we picked an incredible concept artist named Bobby Rebholz, who will help us create an illustrated version of an episode from the Arabian Nights!!!  If we hit $75,000 every backer will get one copy with their first shipment. (For subs, this be one of the limited edition goodies) 
THANK YOU AND PLEASE HELP GET THE WORD OUT SO WE HIT THIS GOAL!!!
Front Cover Mock-Up
  Interior Mock-Up with Placeholder Image by Backer Bobby Rebholz
  Back Cover Mock-Up
SHARING EDITION - $25,000 Stretch Goal
The Mouse team believes that while reading great literature is an imperative start, SHARING great literature is even better! Our first 1000 backers at any level will receive TWO COPIES of Michel de Montaigne’s Of Friendship - one for you and one to share with a friend! We're sending to the printer on June 15 and will get them to you ASAP!!!!

MOUSE SHARING EDITION


EARLY ADOPTER EDITION (All Gone...)
Our first 500 backers at any level will receive an early-adopter edition of The Dead by James Joyce. This book is super-hot and cuts right to the heart of the Mouse Book experience. You'll also get access to the audiobook and a podcast of the Mouse team's book club discussing The Dead. (immediate shipping to US backers only)
MOUSE EARLY ADOPTER EDITION
WORLD-CLASS PRINTER
We are obsessed with making these books extremely high-quality. We've partnered with one of the great printers in the USA, eDOC Communications from Mount Prospect, Illinois, to bring Mouse Books to life. And since our printing partner is local to our Chicago-based team, we know our quality standards are upheld during every print run. 
This is the actual Heidelberg Speedmaster XL 105 that prints Mouse Books!
MOUSE FEVER
MOUSE HOLIDAY PREVIEW EDITION
We had the idea for Mouse Books in late 2016. To test it out, our team handmade a 100-copy HOLIDAY PREVIEW EDITION and sent them out as surprise gifts. We kept it a secret from most people that we were actually behind the books, and the feedback was overwhelmingly positive. These are quotes from emails, texts, and physical THANK-YOU notes we received from this experiment:
“I just love this little thing.” 
—John in Oakland
“Thank you for sending the wonderful little book on Bartleby, which I read on a trip to CA this past weekend. It was like reconnecting with an old friend and it reminded me that there is no greater mystery in the universe than the human mind, which my neuroscience colleagues remind me has more synaptic connections than all the stars we know of in the universe.” 
—Tom in Minneapolis
“The Mouse Books idea is exceptional.” 
—Cal in DC
“The book’s format is compelling, so much so that my wife has taken the book and hasn’t let me carry it. It’s hers now, I’m afraid.”  
—Alex in Charlotte
“Thanks for sending.  In this most curious of times I am looking for ways to see the larger context as some form of insight into how exactly we find ourselves here, not in a cosmic or existential “here,” more like WTF?” 
—Wendee in DC
“Thanks for sharing that short story with me. I found it uncomfortable, exponentially exciting, and also inspiring, as I have been doing a lot of writing myself recently.” 
—Mac in New York

“Thanks so much for the gift. The Melville novel was an inspired idea and I absolutely love the Mouse Books layout and feel. It’s a genius idea. I looked at their website but they seem to still be in pre-launch mode.” 
—John in Boston
TEAM
Mouse Books is 6 people:
Brian Chappell: Ph.D, Teacher, Spiritual Philosopher
David Dewane: Architect, Journalist, Social Entrepreneur
Ted Eccleston: Engineer, Optimist, Highwayman
Courtney Garvin: Graphic Designer, Runner, Epoch B All-Star
Chris Motley: Architect, Snowboarder, Smooth Operator
John Schretlen: Economist, Philosopher, Soapboxer
T-H-A-N-K  Y-O-U-!
OK - you made it to the bottom of the page. Clearly, you have Mouse Fever and are coming on this adventure with us. Please take one minute and share a link for this page with anyone else in your life you think would enjoy Mouse Books! 
Follow us on Instagram @mousebookclub
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Mouse Books is, in our estimation, a very low-risk project. We have two major costs: printing and shipping. We have a keen understanding of both. If we hit our funding threshold we will be able to fulfill one year of quarterly shipments to all subscribers, and print/fulfill all 3-pack orders.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

As everyone on the mailing list is probably aware, Mouse Books has a new campaign running for two Poe books, one of which will be exclusive to Kickstarter with only enough copies printed to fulfill rewards. If you don't want to miss out, make sure you pledge before that campaign ends! ;)

FWIW, I kind of like having the blank lines. Since I often read these books as a filler activity, I have to stop before reaching ends of chapters a lot. I use a bookmark, but remembering where I left off on a page is a little easier with the line breaks. I'll still figure it out without them, but the visual breaks are nice when I tend to stop and start frequently.

I believe one of the three books in this shipment had the usual 48 pages, so I'm not sure they're moving to 64 as a standard. Maybe they'll use both sizes depending on how many pages they need to cover the excerpts/text they want to use.
Great books!!

My copies of the third quarterly shipment books arrived today, and they look good! I noticed the increase text size and increased page count you mentioned. That should help with making reading a little easier and possibly getting a bit more text into the books. It looks like a good set of books, too. I think I've read one, know about a second, and the third is new to me. It should be fun reading them when I get around to them. (I'm still catching up.)

Since tomorrow's June, I'm guessing shipping in May didn't happen. Do you have an update on where things stand with the third quarterly shipments? Again, I'm not in any big rush; I just like to know when to expect things I'm waiting on. Thanks!

Thanks, sounds good. Anything that can help grow the customer base and raise interest in the product should be good. Me, I'm pretty much hooked already and don't need convincing. :) As long as we get info and details on renewing in time for the 5th shipment, so we don't miss any books, I'm good.

@John: I can understand not wanting to spread yourself too thin on social media to start, but I do think that you should at least create accounts -- partly to claim your name on them -- and put up some basic info, like your web site address, maybe with a note that more info will be coming soon. That way, we can reference your accounts when posting about this, and help drive some traffic to you. For example, I see you're not really active on Twitter, but just having the account means I can mention you when I post (which I do), and send people to an official source. You're right that your approach can be tailored to the audience of each social media service as well. In the beginning though, you could simply cross-post the same thing to all of your accounts. Not everyone will follow you on every service, so doing this puts the same message in front of everyone who is following you, no matter where that is. Just some more thoughts while I wait for On Friendship to arrive. :)

campaign.story:
PLAY

Holocaust survivor Asriel Strip used his brother’s diary to make an incredible connection to his family’s history of escaping Nazi persecution. Watch this video to learn about the importance of preserving diaries, the focus of the Museum’s first-ever Kickstarter campaign. 
We’re thrilled by the response to this Kickstarter campaign to raise funds for cataloging and digitizing over 200 Holocaust diaries and translating and transcribing three of them. 
After reaching our $250,000 goal we’re excited to announce a new stretch goal: An additional $50,000 to translate and transcribe 10 more diaries. Back this project today to help Save Their Stories!
PLAY

This is no ordinary map.
US Holocaust Memorial Collection, gift of the family of Joseph Strip
It’s a deeply personal illustration of one family’s harrowing escape and survival during the Holocaust. It’s included in a diary—one of over 200 diaries the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum has in its collections waiting to be cataloged, translated and published online.  
We’re in a race against time to do this specialized, expensive and time-consuming work, and we urgently need your help.  
We know first-person accounts are powerful. Most people are familiar with the diary of Anne Frank, and her personal account is often the first introduction that many have to the devastating history of the Holocaust. But it’s not the only diary of its kind.  
Each of the diaries in our collection has an important story to tell, of suffering and strength, persecution and perseverance. Written by people young and old, from diverse backgrounds and countries, they bring to life a broad spectrum of individuals’ experiences during the Holocaust. Now, in the face of growing Holocaust denial, we must bring more stories to light before we lose the firsthand memories of survivors and witnesses who can shed light on the context of these diaries and other priceless artifacts in the Museum’s collection.  
As the survivor generation passes, it is our responsibility to make sure their voices live on so that their experiences will not be forgotten. You can be a part of preserving history: Back this project and Save Their Stories.
For this project, we'll catalog, preserve, and make available online over 200 Holocaust diaries in the Museum’s collection -- for the first time ever. The handwritten pages and notes are in 17 different languages and will need to be transcribed and translated into English. While we would love to raise enough funds to complete the translation of every diary, reaching our project goal will enable us to translate into English three diaries written by Jewish refugees who fled their homes to escape the Holocaust:  
The diary of Joseph Strip, a young boy who wrote about his family’s harrowing experience over the grid-lined pages of his math notebook. 
The papers of Lucien Dreyfus, a journalist and schoolteacher from Strasbourg, France, who was deported to Auschwitz in 1943. His collection includes letters to his daughter, son-in-law, and granddaughter who escaped to the United States in 1942.
The diary of Hans Vogel, who fled Paris with his family while his father was interned, which contains hand-drawn and colored maps of their journey. 
Each of these three diaries will be published in its entirety online so that people everywhere can view the original pages and read the translations. Like Anne Frank’s personal record, these stories expose the truth of Holocaust history -- so that ever more researchers, authors, teachers, students can learn from them and help fulfill the promise of Never Again. 
Here is our estimated timeline for this project:  
Summer/Fall 2018: Cataloging complete for all 200+ diaries 
Winter 2018: Digitization complete for all 200+ diaries 
Spring 2019: Collections for all 200+ diaries published online at ushmm.org  
Summer 2019: Translations and transcriptions for 3 feature diaries added to ushmm.org collections listings
The Museum has collected millions of pages of historic documents containing details on the individual experiences of Holocaust victims and survivors. Although we are committed to making our entire collection available online, the sheer size of it makes this a lengthy, expensive project. 
Each additional first-person account or piece of evidence made available on the Museum’s website--which is visited by millions of people every year--has the potential to reveal a new aspect of Holocaust history or highlight its relevance to the world today.
These three are just some of the many accounts we hope to bring to the public:  
Joseph Strip (formerly “Stripounsky”)
US Holocaust Memorial Museum Collection, gift of the family of Joseph Strip
Joseph Stripounsky awoke early on the morning of May 10, 1940, to the sounds of aircraft and gunfire. The Germans had invaded his town of Antwerp, Belgium. He was just 17.  
Joseph fled with his parents and younger brother, leaving almost everything they owned behind. He carried with him a math textbook and two math notebooks, one of which became his diary.  
They joined thousands of others heading south through France, making a slow and arduous journey with very little food or money. In France, they spent a year trying to get farther away from the ever-encroaching Nazis. They managed to secure American visas through Joseph’s father’s employer and finally landed in New York in May 1941—just six weeks before Joseph’s 18th birthday, when he would have been legally required to stay in France.  
Joseph tells the story of his family’s harrowing exodus through everyday details and extraordinary sketches.
Lucien Dreyfus
US Holocaust Memorial Museum, Gift of Monique Allen
Lucien Dreyfus was a dedicated journalist and professor of modern languages in Strasbourg, France. In 1940, anti-Jewish legislation was passed in France, and he was dismissed from his teaching position because of his faith. 
As persecution against Jews intensified, he fled his town and sought safety in southern France. Refuge did not last long. In October 1943, he and his wife were arrested and just one month later, they were deported to Auschwitz and murdered. 
Lucien had kept a diary since 1925, but his writing became more frequent during World War II, recording the realities of day-to-day life, the experiences of his students, and what he knew about Jewish persecution in other parts of Europe. 
His diaries also contain deeply personal messages he wrote to his daughter, son-in-law, and granddaughter who were able to escape France in 1942 and eventually made it to the United States. Lucien knew he might never see them again, but continued to write with the hope that they would receive his diaries. Miraculously, they did years later. 
Hans Vogel
US Holocaust Memorial Museum Collection, gift of Eva Vogel
At the age of seven, Hans Yakov Vogel fled Germany with his parents and elder brother in 1936, settling in Paris where they remained until the outbreak of war. His father was separated from the family and interned by the French as an enemy alien at Lisieux, and later at Gurs in the south of France. In May 1940, just 24 hours before the invading German forces reached Paris, the rest of the Vogel family fled south. They traveled among a stream of other refugees, mostly by foot, as the Luftwaffe shot machine guns at them.  
Through the help of friends, the Vogels were reunited and settled in Oloron-Sainte-Marie in the unoccupied zone near the Spanish border. They remained there from June 1940 until April 1941, when they received papers from the United States Consulate allowing them to immigrate. They arrived in New York via Lisbon on the steamer Nyassa in August 1941. Two years later, Hans Vogel died at the age of 16 from an illness.  
Hans kept an extraordinary diary of their flight, including photos and hand-drawn and colored maps tracing the family's journey from Germany through France and eventual immigration to the United States.
Your pledge doesn’t just get you access to behind-the-scenes updates on the work (and often the discoveries made) during the process of cataloging, translating, and publishing these stories. We're also offering fantastic rewards, exclusive to this Kickstarter project. Backers can receive rewards such as a "Save Their Stories" tote bag, limited edition watercolor prints from Holocaust survivor Simon Jeruchim, a "Save Their Stories" journal, exclusive behind-the-scenes tours at the Museum and its collection and conservation center (not open to the public), and much more.  
Jeruchim Watercolor Print
Your pledge is tax deductible! The amount of your contribution that is deductible for federal income tax purposes is limited to the difference between your pledge minus the fair market value of the reward. If our project is completed and the goal is met, you will be asked to fill out a survey so that we can send you your reward. USHMM is unable to recognize your gift unless the informational survey is completed.  
Please allow an additional 4–6 weeks for your reward to ship internationally. Note: we are not responsible for international custom fees.  
Some of the rewards are experiences (tours, events, lectures) offered at a specific time and place. USHMM is not responsible for any backer’s travel or costs to participate in such experiences. Further, if a cause beyond USHMM’s control requires rescheduling or cancellation of an experience, USHMM is not responsible for any additional travel or costs a backer may incur in order to participate at the new time. USHMM cannot guarantee that experiences occurring on dates yet to be announced, or that must be rescheduled, will occur on a date that is convenient for all backers.  
A living memorial to the Holocaust, the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum is located on the National Mall in Washington, DC, and inspires citizens and leaders worldwide to confront hatred, prevent genocide, and promote human dignity.  
Since its dedication in 1993, the Museum has welcomed more than 41 million visitors, including 99 heads of state and more than ten million school-age children. Its website, the world’s leading online authority on the Holocaust, is available in 16 languages and was visited in 2016 by more than 19 million people.  
All photos unless otherwise noted: US Holocaust Memorial Museum
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Challenges: No matter the outcome of this Kickstarter project, the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum will remain committed to its mission of rescuing Holocaust evidence, confronting hatred, and preventing genocide.

And, the Museum will continue to work to find funding for Save Their Stories—but the more than 200 diaries featured in this project will not be made accessible until the financing is secured. Without Kickstarter funding, there is no immediate date for being able to do this work and bring these first-person testimonies to light for students, teachers, scholars, and those wanting to learn more about the Holocaust and preserve the memory of its victims and survivors.

Risks concerning rewards: As always with manufacturing a product, it’s possible to come across production delays. We are confident that with successful funding, the Museum will be able to deliver our tangible and experiential rewards within the times stated for each. However, our rewards that feature live events are subject to change, given availability and circumstances outside of our control.

Should any changes be made to availability of rewards and events, the Museum will communicate these to backers as soon as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Reflections on final stages of the Kickstarter campaign
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
Thanks to your support through our Save Their Stories campaign, the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum continues to make great progress since launching this campaign two years ago. To date, we’ve cataloged, digitized, and made available 207 collections with diaries that were written by Holocaust victims, survivors, and witnesses, and more are being processed. To view these diaries, search “Kickstarter” in the Museum’s Collections search.
As the project’s processing archivist, I'm responsible for managing and cataloging each diary collection. Assessing the diaries, I have been struck by the variety of their content, even beyond the fact that they are written in 17 languages by people of all ages. Some writers made daily entries. Others kept lists, recorded recipes, or wrote poems. Some diarists were very visual, including drawings, maps, photographs, and newspaper clippings.

We are so grateful to all 5,610 of you for your incredible support of our first-ever Kickstarter campaign. Thanks to you, over 200 diaries of Holocaust victims and survivors will be catalogued, digitized, and shared with the world—and over a dozen of them will be fully transcribed and translated.

So close to the stretch goal 
As backers of our project, you have already ensured that the memories of over 200 Holocaust survivors will be preserved and shared for generations to come. Thank you so very much. Now we are just under $5,000 away from our stretch goal of $50,000 more. There are just 35 hours left to meet this new goal so we can transcribe and translate another 10 diaries, including those of Ruth Mueller and Inge Fischer Engel - more about them below!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have worked very hard this past year to bring our project to light. This campaign is to give us the final funds we need to get our first book printed and shared with the world. Good news is, we're lucky to already be partnered with a great printing company and have the majority of the content finalized and ready to go. We are also happy to say that we have partnered with reputable NGOs that will distribute the donated books. These factors will help us ensure you’ll get your purchases next March. We know that with every project comes risks, and we promise to be open with you every step of the way!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Queen Girls Update on Approximate Deadlines!
updates.update_content:
Hi lovely backers!
We know it has been a while since we last updated, so we wanted to give you a heads up on our progress with Queen Girls.
As you know, this is our first book printed and we are learning tons about the process. Unfortunately, we were not counting on the New Year in China, and the printing process took a bit longer than expected, delaying delivery date estimates. But we are SO excited to tell you that the books have been printed and are on their way to Chicago! They will be arriving late April. Once we have our hands on them, they will be shipped out to you immediately! We can't wait to get started!

Happy Saturday everyone :)
We just wanted to send a quick hello and check on the status of the surveys. As many of you know, we sent out the surveys last week. If you have yet to fill it in, please do, so we can deliver the rewards exactly how you’d like. Thank you to all those who have already completed yours!
Quick update on Queen Girls - Books are set to begin mass production on Monday - exciting times!! We are taking a few days to recharge our batteries before starting the next books of the collection - As you probably know by now, our two future Queens are Isadora Duncan (the creator of the "Barefoot dance”’ style) and Savitribai Phule (a teacher, poet, and social reformer). We can’t wait to get these going!

campaign.story:
I am creating a catalog of my art nude photography to get the word out in 2017 about my limited edition prints. There are twenty five images in the catalog.
This project is limited to a maximum of 55 total backers.
Figure Fantasy
I use a camera and computer to bring my imagination to life. It's an expedition to map new territory in a dream-like world. These photographic hallucinations are a commentary on the real world: the colors are plausible, the subjects are almost normal. Look closer and the fiction is revealed. Delicate tones, vibrant colors, or subtle gradations mimic classic hand-colored photography. Inspired by oil painting, highlights and shadows are embellished with opposing hues of warm and cool to set the mood for the illusion. 
2017 Art Catalog
This twenty-seventeen catalog is a beautifully-printed collectible memento of the body of work and a conversation piece for your coffee table or bookshelf. The catalog is a photobook-style showcase, including descriptions of each artwork and my inspiration. It will be square, 8.5 inches/22 cm.
Sample catalog pages
Digital: $20+, high resolution PDF download (all pledges $20 and up include this!)
Softcover: $50, 70# semi matte paper
Hardcover: $65, autographed, 100# semi gloss paper
Video of previous catalog
Print Packages
#1 "Fruit of Knowledge" 24x16 in/61×41 cm, edition of 6
   More options in 24x16 in/61×41 cm size
#2 "Parking Spot #4 (Zanzibar)" 30x20 in/76×51 cm, edition of 10
 More options in 30/20 in/76x51 cm size
#3 "Summer Vagabond" 30x20 inches. Look for the giant mouth between the tracks
  #4 "Allegory of the Arch" 30x20 inches, edition of 10
  #5 "Lilith's Workshop" 36x24 in/91x61 cm, edition of 10
  #6 "Lifesaver" 24x36 in/61×91 cm, edition of 6
 More options in 24x36 in/61×91 cm size
#7 "Ava Backstroke", 24x36 inch, edition of 15
  #8 "One Second Before Awakening" 24x36 inches, edition of 6
#9 "Droll Portal" 27x40 inches/68×102 cm, edition of 6
          Detailed images of this artwork 
more options in the 27x40 inch size 
24x16 in print, catalog, and set of 10 cards: $250
30x20 in print, HC/signed catalog, and set of 25 cards: $600
36x24 in print, 24x16 in print, HC catalog, 25 cards: $900
40x27 in print, 30x20 in print, HC catalog, 25 cards: $1,400
Gallery Cards
5x7 inch, 13x18 cm
Heavy, 17pt card stock
Glossy finish
Different image on each card
2 for $10
Set of 10: $40
Full set of 25: $80
Private Blog & Recognition
All backers pledging $10 or more will have access to a private update section of my website. I will post work in progress, video updates, philosophical ramblings and other exclusive content. You will also have the opportunity to weigh in with your opinion by voting on some images.
I will also credit project backers on my site. You can choose to be thanked publicly, privately (where only other backers can see) or remain anonymous.
Shipping Options
If you live in the US, standard shipping will probably suit you just fine. Prints are sent via Priority Mail and take 3 business days for most. Catalogs and cards take 9 days or less. International shipments are sent via first class mail. If you are outside the US and don't want to wait for regular delivery, ask me to quote express delivery.
Limited Editions
I am debuting designs that are available here for the first time, each in single print size. Once each limited edition is finished, it will not be reprinted. Many of these prints are being first offered here on Kickstarter and will be available to the public in 2017.
"Limited Edition," is thrown around haphazardly, but it has a legal definition in 11 US states. I take it seriously, producing small numbers of artworks under my direct supervision. I personally inspect, sign, and number each one.
Artists have produced limited edition prints for centuries. The process begins by choosing a trusted printmaker. These prints are made with archival inks and 100% cotton rag paper. The product is acid free and the colors are guaranteed to remain at their original brilliance for at least 150 years. Each print is personally inspected by me for quality and consistency before I sign and number it.
The photography will be printed on a very heavy (300 gsm) matte finish papers. These are not posters or photo prints. The printing process provides dense color coverage that is as opaque and vivid as a painting.
I work directly with a skilled, local printmaker who specializes in art prints. We work together to make certain the appearance of each color and even small details such as the texture of the paper are exactly as I intend. If anything doesn't come out perfect, we destroy it and print another one. Each image is printed in a single size, strictly limited to the indicated quantity. A certificate of authenticity is included.
What is Archival?
"Archival" is a word that gets thrown around a lot. There is no one standard, but for art prints it means it is intended to last for a long time. I use the best methods available to me, independently tested to last at least 100 years without a change in color. This doesn't mean they will disappear in 100 years, just when you could start to notice a change. Contact me for more details.
What is an Original?
Technically speaking, a hand signed, numbered photograph, produced by the artist is an original. I don't use that word a lot because there is some confusion surrounding it. Each print in an edition is virtually identical (except where it is signed and numbered) so they are original but not unique. It is not a reproduction because it is not a copy, think of it more like having identical twins.
The limited edition prints are originals in this sense, and the gallery cards are reproductions of those originals.
About Me
My style is candid and unapologetic; offering my unique perspective of beauty, nudes that are unbridled and aesthetic. I am a self-employed art photographer and all the images are of my own making. I have created and fulfilled several Kickstarters; it has been a great community to connect with repeat backers and a new audience.
More draft page layouts
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is a low risk project. Many of the designs are completed and I am familiar with the production process. In my many projects it is rare to have delays. If it does take a little more time it is to ensure quality. If anything does get off track I keep backers informed.
